Reviews.Title: “It's a Sofitel!”
Reviews.Author: Cpayneuk
Reviews.Content: As with the majority of Sofitel's I have had the pleasure to stay in, the Sofitel LA delivers on service and quality. The hotel has a very hip feeling and the staff are welcoming and friendly. The location is perfect for taking a stroll to nearby stores or coffee. I travelled for business and so the only complaint I have is the charge for wifi which I think nowadays should be free as standard. I mean if McDonalds and the Hampton Inn can offer it for free then surely hotels like the Softel which proud themselves on service can! I travel to LA regularly for work and stayed in a variety of hotels over the years but I think it's safe to stay I have now found my LA hotel! The rooms are spacious and clean and as you expect from a top hotel provides added luxury which makes a stay memorable. Furthermore, if you can book using one of their pay for 3 stay for 4 offers then it makes it even more worthwhile and affordable!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rooms and location.”
Reviews.Author: Kate M
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent in every way. The rooms are large and the bathrooms are very large. The location is excellent. We were visiting colleges In and around LA and found it to be in a central location. Arrived as restaurant was near closing but front desk kindly helped us to get bags to room and be seated in the restaurant quickly.

Reviews.Title: “once again !!”
Reviews.Author: joellevynyc
Reviews.Content: i cant say enough about this place i just stayed in la for a buiness trip and this was the best part of the trip from the time i woke up in my very clean room to the time i spent in the breakfast lounge i could not be happier the staff makes this place great from the parking attendants to the hostess ( martha ) i feel like family if your going to la and you want a top notch place to stay you must stay here joel levy nyc golden touch - planet gold

Reviews.Title: “The rooms are just too small”
Reviews.Author: elynchking
Reviews.Content: I had a difficult time deciding on the number of stars. In many ways this is a five star property - especially in regards to service. Everyone we encountered was absolutely delightful, smiling and helpful. However, the room is just too darned small. I was traveling on business but with my 13 year old and we had a king room. There is just enough room for the bed and side tables and nowhere to sit besides the bed and the desk chair. Even if you sat on the bed to watch tv it was uncomfortable as the picture on the wall is hung low so your head will be pushed forward. Normally we enjoy room service but we didn't even try (besides some coffee) as there was just nowhere to eat. The bathroom, on the other hand was large and spacious and gorgeous. The pool area is tiny and not very attractive. We were on the 8th floor and the noise from the street was very loud even through the double paned windows. This was especially annoying when some group across the street was picketing and every car that drove by honked at them. Not relaxing. Bonus for my teenager - the American Idol contestants were staying at the hotel and we had several sightings.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay-”
Reviews.Author: larryf310
Reviews.Content: Great location- many food options within walking distance. Good room setup for work, great stand alone shower and very comfortable bed. Staff at the property is one of the best I have encountered- very friendly and helpful. I will stay again when I need to be in the Beverly Hills area.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel GREAT STAFF but a little shabby in places”
Reviews.Author: djh2601
Reviews.Content: Fantastic first impression too too chic. The suite that i was allocated was in the perfect location for me top floor and on a corner, perfect. I soon began to notice issues the door between the bedroom and sitting was broken and would not close and the only way to close the bathroom door was to slam it hard ( not nice for the guests in the next room ) and very tatty carpets I went down to the front desk to see what could be done and spoke to Crystal who could not have been nicer and gave me several opyions including letting me look at another suite, i really liked the location of the original suite so Crystal said that she would get everything fixed by the time that i returned from shopping. True to her word everything was fixed and even the carpet had been tidied up and she even called to make sure that i was happy. All of the staff at the hotel are excellent could not have been better but a great big thankyou to Crystal BRILLIANT. There were a few tiny, tiny issues that i will not go into as they were all sorted out. My only complaint would be that the hotel suffers a little from style over substance, just silly oversights like the blinds do not cover the windows properly. But all in all a lovely hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel near Beverley Hills”
Reviews.Author: SMillington
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the Sofitel Los Angeles based on a promotional room rate they were offering at the time. Upon check in we were allocated our room which we didn't like as it was on one of the lower floors and very dark. After a quick call to reception we were given another room, which was much better on one of the upper floors. The rooms are nice and modern with good amenities but nothing out of the ordinary. We did mention on our booking we were celebrating our honeymoon, so we was a little disappointed not to receive anything such as an upgrade or something in our room, which was given in all the other hotels on our trip. The staff overall were very friendly and offered some good dining recommendations away from the hotel. I would say the hotel is a good solid option if you can obtain a promotional or reduced rate; in our case stay 4 pay for 3, otherwise I think it is a bit over priced considering what you get for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Home Again”
Reviews.Author: Perch_24
Reviews.Content: Spent a few days of our family spring-break vacation in Los Angeles and stayed at Sofitel - again.... feels like home. The hotel is in a great location - on last day realized that there is a great shopping street only two blocks away - good thing my wife didn't find this sooner ;) The facilities are typical top notch Sofitel that we have grown accustom to. Beds are perfect and the pillows are magic. Meghan (concierge) arranged an amazing private tour for us of L.A. - that was great! Fitness facility is over the top. Loved the Brigitte Bardot photo exhibit in the lobby - nice touch. One thing we did notice missing was the signature scent of the Sofitel hotels... this is the first we've visited without it and we missed it. Anyway, we would highly recommend the hotel for those that don't want to suffer through the "issues" of regular hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, superb service, very well located, great price if you look”
Reviews.Author: gajgmusic
Reviews.Content: We came shopping with our daughter for a few days. The hotel is very very well located. The Beverly center is a bit of a bust, but Robertsons is great, as is the Grove and Beverly Hills is close by to people watch. We could walk most places. When we checked in they upgraded us to an even nicer sweep (we brought our daughter and got a bigger room). The room was terrific, huge and had a great bathroom. The desk and all the staff couldn't have been nicer. The concierge was very helpful, they always had free papers including the new york times, and free internet. The gym was excellent and free as well. Beds were very good and the room very quiet. This is the second time I stayed and would happily stay again. We booked with a service (beverly hills luxury hotels) and got a great rate, much cheaper than two rooms at the holiday inn.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but hotel was not so great!”
Reviews.Author: Hollymount97
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over Christmas & while the location and lobby areas were impressive, the facilities & rooms just didn't stand up. First of all it was a significant 'hike' to the pool & gym through the office areas of the hotel. The gym was constantly out of basics like water, headphones & towels, although there was an impressive range of machines for a hotel gym. Compared to other, similar starred hotels in the area, the pool was pretty rubbish! The rooms were nice, great bathroom & fab view of the Hills & Hollywood sign, although the bed was really strange - oddly made-up & not that comfy. The main issue I had with the room (and other parts of the hotel) was the dust & dirt. There was literally a pile of dust in the corners of the rooms and on all the skirting boards. Also the rooms were never properly made up, with drink facilities, toiletries & towels not replaced. When issues were raised with reception nothing was done! Another complaint was the charge for WiFi which is ridiculous when most budget hotels offer it for free - there are plenty of places nearby that do offer it for free. The valet parking was great & the Simon LA was amazing! But overall just a rather disappointing stay - the hotel was overpriced for the facilities offered & I will definitely not be returning here to stay on any future trips to LA (although I would return to Simon restaurant).

Reviews.Title: “4.5 stars - thoroughly decent”
Reviews.Author: Onalin
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night on a stopover. The staff were, to a person, totally delightful to deal with. I think it's the best service I've had in a hotel, perhaps ever. From doormen to reception staff, concierge to room service, everyone seemed genuinely eager to help, positive and approachable. It was really great! Well done Sofitel! My room was well-appointed, with an AMAZING huge bed (the bed was super fluffy, yet supportive - it was really great!), huge TV, desk and decent-sized wardrobe. The decor was pretty bland, however, and accounts for my half a star off. It wasn't offensive, just - beige/brown/yellow colour schemes do nothing for me. It was very International Hotel. It may be that not all rooms have the same decor (I was so jet-lagged I couldn't be bothered asking for a different room). The bathroom was big enough to set up the ironing board, and had some good amenities (L'Occitane products, emery boards, loofah, shaving mirror, slippers and robe) and enough counter space for a cosmetics case or two. Room service was pretty good - prices were not outrageous, and delivery was really quick. The location is really handy for shopping - the Beverly Centre mall is right across the street, and there are a few interesting boutiques around (my fav is Scent Bar, an amazing perfume boutique on Beverly). I walked to LACMA, an easy three-kilometre stroll. I will say that the hotel doesn't have the buzz that other LA hotels have - so don't come here for a party. Come here for a friendly welcome and a really good sleep! Overall, I had a really pleasant stay here. Minor quibbles were the decor and paying for wi-fi; I'll forgive them because that bed is so fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay. The staff were fantastic and also gave us a surprise of chocolate dipped strawberries for our anniversary. Would highly recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “always good standard at sofitel”
Reviews.Author: thibaut a
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Sofitel los angeles, it has a very convenient location if you are going for business or for shopping (a large mall is just in front of the hotel); not that many dining options within a walking distance but who is walking in LA? staying in the sofitel is always a guarantee to have a nice room and a friendly staff, really good value for the hotel. From the check in process to the room service delivery, the staff was very helpful and fast to reply to any demand (they were telling me it was taking 30 minutes for the room service and always delivered before that with a big smile, very good service). the bar with live band was cool too, good ambiance. For once i have used a fitness center of a hotel and really liked it. Spacious, good equipment, it was very nice to end up the day by some cardio and weight. Little inconsistency on the service (one night they forgot the turndown while i was away of my room), but this was not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, comfortable, good service”
Reviews.Author: pinkfood
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 4-day stay at the Sofitel Los Angeles for leisure. The room was well-appointed, the bed incredibly comfortable, and service was excellent. Since our visit to LA was primarily to visit friends, we did not spend much time in our room except to sleep. Our room was located on the 4th floor facing the Beverly Center. That said, not once did we hear any noise from the street. Hallways do resonate sound, so I would recommend staying away from the elevators. We did not eat in the restaurant, but did go to the lounge a few times. The lounge area is nicely appointed with comfortable seating areas for you to enjoy cocktails with friends. The only major drawback that we experienced was that our visit coincided with the annual testing of the electricity and fire alarms. We lost electricity briefly after 2 am, and the fire alarm began going off at 9:30 am. However, the hotel was very good about notifying us in advance of the testing by leaving a note in our room with some glowsticks. The hotel also left us note reminding us about daylight savings, which I found considerate. The hotel only has valet parking, which at the time of this review was $33/day. We took our car in and out of the hotel sometimes a few times a day with no difficulty, and we were truly charged just per day. Hotel staff was exquisitely accommodating of any requests. I would definitely stay there's again on my next visit to LA and certainly recommend it to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zizza55
Reviews.Content: We have been in the LA Sofitel at the very beginning of out honeymoon for 3 nights.The hotel looks and is amazing! Huge, clean and the bed very confortable. Our room was on the 6th floor, facing the mall. Even though our windows were 'on the street' we barely heard any noise. The only weird thing was the bathroom window: inside the room, behind the bed. From the room you can see the entire bathroom, which means you can all the things someone is doing in there ( and all means ALL ). The window itself looks also nice, it s fun to shower looking into the room, I just don t understand why didn t they put a curtain, so that if you don t want your partner o look inside, you can decide to close it. Since my husband got sick on the second day, we ordered a lot of food from the hotel (which usually we don t do): everything was very good and the service was extremely kind. The concierge of the hotel was very helpful assisting us finding restaurants and trips. The only issue we ad is that we booked a tour with the concierge (TMZ tour) and we paid it 69$ per person, once at the booth we found out that if we would have book it directly with TMZ we would have spend 49$, saving a total of 40$ (high in a city as expensive as LA u definitely prefer to keep in your pocket ;) ). We also had the chance to go to the hotel s spa Le Spa. Very nice and clean but the massage itself wasn't special. I'd suggest you to look for a different spa, LA is full of places in which to get massages!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The accommadation was excellent, But the resturant and bar are dinly lit, Making it hard to read the menu's , The bed was one of the best I have sleeped in. And it was great having a ice machine on each floor. Plus a great location, Would stay there again and loved the shopping a cross the road ( Bloomingdales & Maceys )

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: SimplyGirlie
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend booked this hotel for vday as a surprise and it was a lovely surprise indeed. Check in was super friendly and kind and no waiting required.The room was on the smaller size but great amenities from emery board, cotton buds, loafa, slippers and more. The bathroom was spacious with great shampoos and soaps. Bed good linen and super comfy. In additon there is a small balcony but right across from the shopping centre. only negetive was 35 dollars for parking.. yikes... overall.. great quality hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great location and comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: room777
Reviews.Content: We stopped off here for a few days on our way to Maui. The location is brilliant and easy to walk around with lots of options for eating and shopping. Staff and accommodation was good and we stayed in a luxury room which was good with wifi and movies.

Reviews.Title: “Just lovely”
Reviews.Author: jskzug
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here. First of all, the beds were AMAZINGLY comfortable. The hotel is located in great location. We were very easily able to walk to the Farmer's Market and Grove. The hotel lobby is decorated very fashionably and this was overall a hotel I would definitely return to the next time I am in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Relax amongst the chaos of Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: Jwsfun
Reviews.Content: From the moment you walk through the door of the Sofitel LA, you realize you've entered a world of quiet sophistication. I was so impressed at the quick check in and polished professionalism of the front desk staff. We were even escorted to the elevator by the check in agent. ( which requires you to slide your room key to activate--good security). Once in the room, I found it to be comfortable and relaxing. They had soft music playing and I thought that a lot of attention had been paid to lighting. It was soft and romantic, yet still had task lighting for work. The bed was amazing and I really wish I could have taken the sheets as they were of top quality. The bathroom was massive and the rainfall shower head was incredible. The restaurants on site were a little expensive but major Kudos to the hostess with the French Accent who greeted us each morning. She made you feel like you were THE most important guest in the hotel. She was just fantastic! We used the concierge one time and she was efficient and went out of her way to make sure we had dining reservations. The location of the property is amazing for shoppers, as it's directly across the street from the Beverly Center. There are over 15 restaurants of top quality that are all within walking distance. Congrats Sofitel- You have an amazing product with this one!

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what an amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lizj1987
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded my expectations. I arrived thinking this hotel was going to be quote classy, but from the minute I entered the lobby and was directed to my room, I felt at home and a very warm welcome to LA. The room was beautiful, with complimentary robe & slippers, cable tv and a great view of the Beverly Centre opposite the street, this room was great for any tourist new to LA. The hotel is in walking distance to a number of great restaurants including PF Chang Chinese, Jerry's Grill, and an all night chemist which stocks grocery's as well as alcohol. Although the Safe didn't work I felt secure leaving my belongings in the room and came back to a serviced room each afternoon. I would like to thank the staff for making my stay so enjoyable and a great first experience to the USA!

Reviews.Title: “Just makes a 4 rating”
Reviews.Author: OverseasTravel2
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a little hit and miss. The concierge was phenomenal, the location was convenient (with a car - a must in LA). However the rooms are small, you can hear the neighbouring room through the shared bathroom vents and the hotel was generally underwhelming in decor but comfortable. No tea and coffee facilities was simply odd. Terrible argument with the parking attendants after 7 attempts to locate our car was incredibly frustrating and took the shine off our stay. For the price it was good value (purchased online at discount).

Reviews.Title: “Sofitwl Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: alleys
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel back in may 2011. The hotel its self is quite nice, and fairly modern. Had no problems with the service , the reception staff were only too happy to assist as well as the parking attendants. The hotel features a pool , spa and health spa. The only two things could say that we didnt really like about this place is the rooms are on the smaller side of things and the bed was not that comfortable. If its shopping you are after than this hotel is in the perfect place for you. It is directly across the Beverly Centre which houses some of the most popular department stores in the us ie Macys , Bloomingdales. Also has a variety of other shops from the lower end of the market to luxury brands like Louis Vutton, Gucci etc. Across the road there is also Nordstrom Rack where you can pick up a pair of Fendi glasses for $60 usd. Across from that you also have Ross department store which if your lucky enough you can pick up clothes from many different designers at a fraction of the price. Sofitel hotel is only a few blocks away from Rodeo Drive...if I were to go back to the LAX I would definatley stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bwisetraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed in January February 2012"This hotel is situated across from the Beverly Centre which is a shopping centre. Bloomingdales Macey, and other named shops. The hotel is nice friendly staff. The restaraunt serve a beautiful dinner. You can then sit in there courtyard for after drinks very pleasant. Stayed 2 nights on arrival to LA then returned here for last night to catch our flight home. Returned to airport by taxi for $45.00 USD The hotel helped with arranging car hire delivered to the hotel and return to the hotel. Would definately recommend this hotel. A bus stop is a cross the road so you can catch it do a on off for site seeing and runs every 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price!”
Reviews.Author: jasmin6
Reviews.Content: This is my first time writing a review on any website but felt the need to write one for this hotel. The hotel room was clean but extremely tiny! I had read other people's reviews and this seem to be a common complaint but I didn't realize just how tiny the rooms are. There is no coffee maker in the room. If you want a cup of coffee, they will charge you. We wanted to iron our clothes but couldn't find an outlet except for the one in the bathroom. Since the room is extremely small, the tv is pushed off to the side. I booked this hotel from Hotwire and paid $200 per night. Totally not worth it. I have stayed in a lot of hotels since my husband and I love to travel. This one is not worth the price. Even a two star hotel offers more than this hotel. Forgot to mention you have to pay $33 per day for the parking. Having Breakfast in their restaurant that consisted of an omelet and waffles and a cup of coffee costed $50. I don't mind spending the money if you are getting what you paid for but not the case in this hotel. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: James W
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for the first time at the Hotel Sofitel in Beverly Hills for 26 nights due to my surgery at Cedars-Sinai Hospital, which is nearby. I have read a lot of the reviews here and wanted to share our thoughts on Sofitel from January & February, 2012. First, the hotel is also a first, as in first class and we were very satisfied with the two rooms that we were in. Clean, comfortable, very quite and nice. We stayed on the 7th floor and then moved to a handicap room on the 4th. The complete staff from the valet, doorman, bellman, front desk, restaurant, security, etc can only be described as the very best that we have had the pleasure to experience in many hotel stays from Paris to West Virginia's Greenbriar. We ate many meals in the hotel and they have excellent values be it at breakfast or at dinner. They also have a free coffee bar that is opened very early in the morning, which was very helpful, due to our being from the east coast.This was our first stay at the Sofitel and we choose it solely based on being the closest hotel to the hospital, so to have such great experience was such an added plus and I hope that this recent review helps you in choosing the Sofitel for your next visit to Beverly Hills and an added plus, is a great shopping mall directly across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Base for Exploring LA”
Reviews.Author: Shan_and_Jase
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sofitel twice during our trip to the states in Jan/ Feb 2012. We could not fault anything!! All the staff couldnâ€™t do enough to help, the room was clean, funky and had everything we needed (including a great view of the Hollywood sign ( even if it was in the distance). We had the best nights sleep while at the hotel as the bed was soo comfy!! We thought the location was fantastic as everything we wanted was only a short cab ride away. We would stay her again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice at LA”
Reviews.Author: ruf0us
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel at L.A. Rooms facing hoolywood Hills are much better than the ones in front of the Mall. The bathroom has L'ocitane amenities and is spacious!! The perfect choice for people looking for Shopping and sightseeing!! The Service is Very good and the concierge was very helpfull!!! Sure I'll stay there in my next visit to L.A?

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel and Staff!”
Reviews.Author: GinandJar
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at the Sofitel and it certainly will not be my last. From an early arrival to a very late departure, the staff was sooooo accommodating. I stayed in a suite and OMG where do I begin? The bathroom was huge, you can watch TV while you soak in the tub, or you can have a party in the huge shower! Everything was very clean and beautiful. The bed was very comfortable but I do have one slight negative, the pillows were like sleeping on marshmallows, they were way too soft for me. Now back to the great stuff. We needed a pair of cuff links for my nephew right away and the stores were not open yet. I called the Concierge and he was awesome, he found a pair for us right away! The staff at the Sofitel was very professional; they displayed pride in what they were doing and were service oriented. I would love to name them all, but there were so many! The flowers in the lobby were very beautiful. I was there when they set up the Valentine's Day floral arrangements, WOW! I also had a couple of meals at the hotel and everything was quite good. I had a wonderful experience at the Sofitel and I cannot wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Smelly comforter and mold in shower”
Reviews.Author: V B
Reviews.Content: Very very disappointing. I do not know why anyone would want to stay here except it is a great location. The bed was uncomfortable the comforter smelled like it had never been washed. The bathroom looked cool till I looked inside the shower and saw the mold. I only stayed one night although I had planned to stay longer. I notified the front desk of the issues but, all they did is say they were sorry, I would never go back. Lots of hype for nothing but a let down.

Reviews.Title: “Good and bad experience”
Reviews.Author: rockstarcher
Reviews.Content: We had just arrived after a long flight from Australia, but were excited to have landed and start our holiday. At check in, the receptionist was perfectly polite and helpful and offered to give us a room with a balcony. Upon entering the room...no balcony. I was also looking forward to a long bath but no bath tub (unusual for a large hotel) The concierge were quite unhelpful, we asked a question one morning and got a slap happy reply until he saw cash folded in my husbands hand and then fired up a conversation and answered all questions. Another concierge remarked to us one morning to "not forget your umbrella today, its going to rain" , very helpful information but could have been more helpful if he added to that statement that the hotel offers complimentary umbrellas for guests We also purchased the internet for one night.....don't bother as it was soooo slow, we rang and told them to take if off our account as we had to sleep for an early flight. The receptionist on the other end understood our issues and immediately took the internet charge off our account. The main problem I had with this hotel was that I had made 2 reservatiions, the first for 2 nights, the second for one night. All prepaid through expedia. I emailed prior to our arrival to have the 2 reservations merged, I also confirmed at check in that the 2 reservations were to be merged, however on our seond day (the end of the first reservation), we had housekeeping knocking on our door asking when we were checking out, I went to reception and they said no promblems and took another imprint of our credit card. After a full day out we arrived back at the hotel to find our room keys did not work.....off to reception again we go, they reissued yet another 2 guest room keys. Surely it does not have to be that hard!!! On the upside the rooms we nicely decorated clean and the bed was so amazingly comfortable and we slept like babies Would recommend this hotel, they just need to iron out a few bugs and train their staff a bit better. Another bonus is that the tourist double decker bus stopped just across the road from the hotel and did 3 loops of LA, the first Santa Monica, the second Hollywood including Kodak and Chinese theater and the third, downtown being Chinatown and Japantown.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: amazingmuppet
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and service, nice rooms with soft bed linen and fantastic showers. Best room service I've had In a while too

Reviews.Title: “First Stop - USA!”
Reviews.Author: meg71brisbane
Reviews.Content: Los Angeles was our first stop in a two week holiday in the USA. Good size room, comfortable bed and good amenities. The brought up a kettle when asked and service was always quick and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: karenjnz
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel in an excellent location across the street from the Beverly Centres wide array of shops. The room was on the smaller size but had a view of the Hollywood Sign, the bed was wonderful as was the shower with its huge head.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Value --They Make You Feel as If You Are Family”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkRona
Reviews.Content: We have two adult sons who live in LA, so we visit about twice a year, often staying at this hotel. The room is always well-apportioned, comfortable (great bed) and clean, with excellent amenities, but the best thing about this place is the staff. We almost always breakfast at the hotel and even when it has been more than six months since our last visit, the maÃ®tre d'hÃ´tel always welcomes us back with a smile. We love to eat alfresco, and there is a small outdoor area where the most excellent breakfast is also served.

Reviews.Title: “One of my greatest hotel experiences.....EVER! Flawless and delightful.”
Reviews.Author: StaceyP
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to the Sofitel Los Angeles (last was in 2009) and this outshone our first visit - it was simply sensational! We stayed for two nights and had the most gorgeous room (Suite) with a balcony, exquisite furnishings, wonderful service and a delightful stay. This is now one of my very favourite hotel experiences. We loved it so much!

Reviews.Title: “Great Vibe, Walk to WeHo”
Reviews.Author: JV101
Reviews.Content: Very nice vibe and mood at the hotel-- funky lobby, art, and bar, and very European rooms (albeit very small). Stayed here in February 2012 and enjoyed our stay. Good hotel right across from Beverly Center shopping and within walking distance (10 minutes) to WeHo clubs on Melrose and Santa Monica Blvds. If you get a GOOD DEAL, this is worth it. Otherwise do not expect a 5-star hotel. 4 at best. I would not pay more than $250 a night for a room. Only BIG disappointment was the pool area-- very small and uninviting. Looks like it was added as an afterthought to the hotel in a vacant corner. Not worth going to hang by the pool. Exercise room/spa were GREAT. One of the nicest hotel gyms I have ever seen with a huge selection of weights, cardio, etc. Free for hotel guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great People. Great Location. Great Service”
Reviews.Author: AustraliaFeliz
Reviews.Content: My husband & I arrived at 9am after a 14 flight from Australia. We assumed we would have to drop our bags and come back at check in time later in the afternoon. However they just checked us in, no problems! The rooms are nice, clean and comfortable. Probably not 5 star standard though. Location is directly opposite a large shopping centre and within walking distance of most of the wanted Hollywood attractions. We ate at Simon's restaurant and the food & service where fantastic although a bit pricey. All in all a good experience. A nice & convenient place to pass through probably not to vacation for any length of time though.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded all Expectations”
Reviews.Author: melbtraveller09
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel, without doubt the best Sofitel Iâ€™ve stayed in. Great location, right across from endless shopping opportunities at the Beverly Centre, with West Hollywoodâ€™s wide array of restaurants and bars not far at all. Itâ€™s a stylish hotel but manages to find the right balance of comfort, the rooms are very nice, with the fabulous Sofitel beds and fantastic showers. Loved the bar, it seems to attract some of that â€˜LA sceneâ€™ crowd but the staff were still very relaxed and friendly. The porters and reception staff were efficient yet very welcoming and friendly, and thankfully there was no pretentiousness at all (which unfortunately Iâ€™ve seen in the staff at a few other Sofitels). All up very happy with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This Sofitel doesn't live up to the brand”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn S
Reviews.Content: I'm a big fan of Sofitel hotels (particularly in Europe) and liked this one's central location (used to live nearby so know the neighborhood). It was an okay stay. Service was competent (a previous reviewer noted that there were a surprising lot of bell staff and I have to agree) and the food in the restaurant was just outstanding, everything, from breakfast (where you served a delicious, complimentary mini-smoothie) to lunch (fantastic pizza) to cocktails on the ingenuously designed outdoor patio that almost makes you forget you're at the crossroads of two massive L.A. boulevards. The nightclub/bar, which is adjacent, frankly looked like something from the early 1980s, and was rather creepy, anything but enticing. Our room was just so-so. First room I was given was tiny, with a shower-only bathroom (I'm a regular Sofitel customer and I don't understand why I was given a crappy room to begin with when clearly there were other, better rooms in my price category). To its credit Sofitel moved quickly when I asked for a bathroom with tub, and the second room, along the same corridor, was much larger. Pleasant but unexceptional with one particularly oddity: There was no headboard and a framed print was placed where your head would rest if you were reading in bed. Literally the framed hit the middle of the back of my head. Bizarre and uncomfortable. The bathroom was adequate but nothing special, even with the aforementioned bath, which was one of those 1970s models that's shallow. The view was terrible -- we looked out on the Beverly Center parking lot. Depressing. I don't think I'll go back to this hotel again -- there are too many better options for the same money in L.A. It reminds of the Miami airport Sofitel, which also could use a cash infusion. But the big difference is that at the airport the pickings are slim. Here, not so much.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but dirty room, 3* service with 5* price tag”
Reviews.Author: babaa
Reviews.Content: First impression, a hotel with too many bell staff hogging to "assist" you at the door even when you only had a small carry-on with wheels and a purse. Sure, so they "show" you the room as if you've never been to a hotel and stick around to make sure you are satisfied, until you take out a bill from the pocket will they leave. Room: interior nothing too spectacular. The bath room with both tub and shower is quite nice and spacious. But also makes the rest of the room look like its from another hotel. Our room was located on the 3rd floor with window looking directly out at the hotel's decorative exterior.. not the greatest view. Plus with the curtain being few ft away from the window..odd. Never mind the looks, but for the first two nights, me and my friend already noticed we were not alone, but occupied by other flying friends as well. We simply ignored it because it was late and we were tired, and had to wake early to help prep for another friend's wedding. However, on the last evening returning to the hotel, I couldn't believe I found a DEAD MOSQUITO on my pillow. It was nothing too small either! Again, we were too tired to make a fuzz which would probably have cut into our few hrs' nap already. I ended up waking up with five extremely unattractive and very noticeable mosquito bites on my face and forehead. I informed the concierge and showed them my face, and they simply gave me an insincere apology and said will have someone "look into" it. To my knowledge, of the many hotels I've stayed at, they always do follow-up's if/when problems occur. No follow-up's, no calls, no emails. So ended up I had to send in a comment form myself. Facility: Tempted by the pictures, I wanted to check out the gym and spa. But to my surprise, I was pretty much ignored for a full 5 minutes, with no help offered. The staffs were just happily chatting away. They gave me one quick glance, seeing that I'm looking into the brochure and they quickly went back to their conversation. No introduction, no offers of help or explanation. Great service there. Overall: Visiting LA, most people would drive, so there isn't a really inconvenient location depends on ur itinerary. What's good with Sofitel LA, is there's a mall right across and only a few minutes drive from all the shopping and excitements. Just be ready for the heavy traffic all around during rush hrs. Taking side roads can be an option. For the same price, I'm sure better service in similar location can be found. I'm not sure if I want pay this particular Sofitel another visit. Disappointing..

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel, Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: LaRon C
Reviews.Content: A lovely room. I wanted to stay and not go to the conference! Everyone was very pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, but very much a business hotel”
Reviews.Author: K_K_travellers
Reviews.Content: It's French and it all works. Very professional. If you want an efficient, business hotel at a good location this can be highly recommended. If you, on the other hand, wants to stay in a hotel with atmosphere, go somewhere else. The only thing of criticism we noticed was that at a dinner at the hotel restaurant two other guests returned there meal to the kitchen.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel,great location,unhelpful staff”
Reviews.Author: WAussie1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights at the beginning of a 4 week holiday.because I had booked for more than 4 nights we were upgraded to a prestige suite which was very large, great bed, beautiful bathroom, view of the hills and very comfortable. Location is perfect with the Beverley centre, hopon hop off bus right outside the door and the grove a reasonable walk Checkin was good but after that we didn't find the staff extremely helpful , if anything I thought they were a bit snobby We were told there was coffee in the morning but on the two occasions I went to get some it had been packed away and it wasn't even 9 am. I spoke to their booking desk about a tour but she advised the operators office would be closing and I would have to come and speak to her again in the morning?I would expected with a hotel of this standard they would have got my room number and details and contacted me in the the morning with the tour sorted. Instead I rang and booked myself. In the hotel information booklet it stated we could get a letter mailed by going to the same conceirge desk.my husband had a letter that needed mailing.went to the desk, then got sent to the checkin desk - no one could assist as they didnt have any stamps.we didnt post our letter but held it till new york,( the novetel have a small letter box in there foyer for guests to post mail,they hand you a stamp at the checkin desk) surely they could have taken the letter, charged us for a stamp and sent it put with their own post I think there are better value hotels with genuine, friendly, helpful staff who value service

Reviews.Title: “Best & friendliest service ever”
Reviews.Author: richmich3
Reviews.Content: My family were all so impressed with the friendliness & service we experienced at this hotel that I just have to share this. The Hermes bathroom soaps were pretty special too! We didn't spot any celebs, but I believe there were some there. The location was quite central to many things we wanted to do. Next time though we will hire a car for our stay in LA. The parking at this Sofitel is $33/night which sounds alot to me.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Happywalkabout
Reviews.Content: After using many other hotels in LA, I have stayed at the Sofitel on the last two occasions. They have the most comfortable beds ever and the hotel is perfectly located. The staff is exemplary. I doubt I'll stay anywhere else in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel - Service not great..”
Reviews.Author: Travelling004
Reviews.Content: Always hard when you expect so much more from these large chain hotels - nothing wrong with the hotel but nothing amazing either - your hard earnt money - because this hotel is not cheap can be spent somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Good position”
Reviews.Author: Sean L
Reviews.Content: Great location, close to lots of shopping center.The property was excellently located and the staff from the door to the restaurants were excellent and helpful. But the wifi connecting was not free.

Reviews.Title: “The only place I stay in LA”
Reviews.Author: travelnut2009
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable place to stay. Rooms are immaculate and like the location. Staff is vvery nice and helpful. Easy to grab a bite or drink in the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Suite upgrade, great location!”
Reviews.Author: AussieMandM
Reviews.Content: We checked in about 3 hours early as we arrived form our flight about 12pm. To our surprise, our room was ready and we checked straight in, the perfect start to our stay. The suite was awesome. Big lounge room with dining table and lounge area / TV. Bedroom was spacious with walk in robe and the best bed I have enjoyed in a hotel for many years. It was divine and I slept really well every night! The bathroom was also large and modern, rainwater shower head, big bath with tv in the wall and very fancy window which you could block out if need be. We had a view of the Hollywood hills and could also see the observitory and HOLLYWOOD sign from our window/balcony. It was a great view to wake up to. Really try to get a room facing the Hills as the other side of the building gets a view of a shopping centre, definitely not as nice. I am so grateful they gave us the Hills side. Make sure to ask for it. The bar downstairs was very modern and trendy. Drinks about standard prices but a very cool place to be and had great atmosphere. We didnt get a chance to eat at the restaurant so I can't comment on that. Their were a few issues though that bugged us. The cost of valet was expensive, the most expensive we have ever paid. At $33 a day plus tax, it adds up. Three nights cost over $100 which is a good money maker for them. The room does not even include wi-fi internet. It costs $10 per device, per day, so be careful of that. This is the only hotel in our four week US trip that didn't include free wi-fi. Very disappointing. Lastly, it would have been nice to put our own food and drinks in the fridge, but it was stocked with their own drinks electronically so we couldn't even take them out without getting charged. A few disappointments but not enough to spoil or outweigh the sensational location, room and view. Breakfast was a little pricey so we went the the Urth Cafee about 2 mins drive away each day. Breakfast was amazing. We tried six different options in our three visits, each being tasty, well priced and well portioned. Its a definite if your in the area! We would definitely stay again. Great location, the large shopping mall across the road has all the shops you could want and the are so many restaurants and bars within walking distance... I hope this help you all out. Regards.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, smallish rooms”
Reviews.Author: jennyinCALI
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel is really a gorgeous hotel, and in an excellent central location in LA for shopping, restaurants, etc. They have a swanky bar and nice vibe. I would definately stay here again. That being said, I thought the room was a little small for the price, although fine for a couple. It did annoy me that I moved some items in the mini-bar fridge (to look at the sodas), and they charged my credit card for them because they were moved. Apparently it says somewhere that you you cannot move things around in the fridge. resolved after talked to accounting staff but not a cool policy and Im lucky i noticed it on credit card. Never seen that before at a hotel. But, a nice hotel and experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Darren B
Reviews.Content: Such a great place to rest after a long haul flight. Very friendly staff who remembered my name the next day, very comfortable bed, spacious bathroom, very quiet. They do a great breakfast in the restaurant too.

Reviews.Title: “Tired”
Reviews.Author: ASMULREADY
Reviews.Content: If you get a good rate for this hotel, go for it, yet otherwise, don't bother. It's ok, yet just very tired and the rooms need an update. I stayed here for only one night and the room was fine, bed comfortable, yet not in the same league as many other LA hotels. Great location and good gym, yet the rooms are very 1992. The reception area is very nice yet the pool area is very poor for a hotel that claims to be 5 star

Reviews.Title: “Romantic gataway”
Reviews.Author: buddah32984
Reviews.Content: Took my girlfriend for a wonderful gataway and was absolutely pleased with our stay. The hotel was wonderful with excellent employees from the bartenders to the spa associates. The room was really nice the bathroom was beautiful. I scored major points with my girlfriend not to mention breakfast at simon l.a. Delicious. Will be going back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent West Hollywood Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ocahan
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Sofitel LA in December 2011, we traveled with 2 friends from Australia who had previously stayed here twice and highly recommended it. Location is very convenient and is close to Santa Monica Blvd, a 5 minute walk to Cedars-Sinai Medical Centre and across the road great shopping at the Beverly Centre. The staff were very friendly and attentive, the Hotel lobby and rooms immaculate and exquisite beds. We dined one night at the Hotel's restaurant Simon LA and had a delicious meal, the lobby bar is also a place to be seen. As is usual, Wi-Fi is an extra, however there are 3 apple computers for free in the lobby which satisfied any requirements to surf the web.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Our stay was pleasant, because the hotel is fairly quiet and it was close to our family celebrations. The package we ultimately got was not exactly as was advertized on the web but ended up about the same. The restaurant breakfast, even the American has a nice European flair, and the service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Yosi212
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a Christmas vacation with my husband and 11 year old daughter and had a wonderful stay. The Beverly Center Mall is directly across the street and there is a 24hr CVS for the small things we forgot to pack. There is valet parking that cost about 20$ but right around the corner there is on street parking. We parked there with no problems. The atmosphere is very calming and relaxing. We stayed in the Prestige suite which was extremely comfortable. The only negative about the room is it doesn't have a fridge or microwave. Another thing is that if you move any of the beverages in the mini bar they automatically charge your room. Make sure you check your bill for that. Overall nice clean comfortable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel with friendly service and good rooms”
Reviews.Author: Therooster
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights in one of the penthouse suites. We thought the value was outstanding, as the room was nice and comfy but the price was nice and low! Staff were very professional, courteous and helpful. The room was clean and the bed very comfortable. The location is ok, without being outstanding. The nice thing is that if you want to do some shopping, Beverly Center mall is just across the street, which is very convenient. We used the restaurant and room service a lot. We thought it was very good, but again without being outstanding. Very tasty meals overall and good breakfast menu (note: there is no buffet brekky). Internet was wireless and charged at $10 a day, though the connection was a bit slow, but ok. Overall, it was a good stay and we felt we got very good value.

Reviews.Title: “You have arrived.”
Reviews.Author: BNystedt
Reviews.Content: When you check into the Sofitel LA you feel youâ€™ve â€œarrivedâ€�. It is simply like the hottest hotel in the city, with stunning interiors marrying French chic and Hollywood glamour. This luxe hotel has a decor that is the stuff of magazine covers. Its central location is a stoneâ€™s-throw to world-famous Beverly Hills, Rodeo Drive, West Hollywood, Melrose Avenue and Sunset Boulevard. Its location at the intersection of La Cienega and Beverly Blvd makes for quick access by car, taxi or â€“ oui - the bus. The 11-story buildingâ€™s silhouette looks traditional but there is nothing traditional about the interior of the hotel. The public areas are on-trend; the rooms are where Gallic Ã©clat meets all-American comfort. The amenities are well thought-out and add to the feeling of posh. The only down-side is the hotelâ€™s Ãœber-cool lounge: Hate having to tackle a waitron for service â€“ and the prices, Yikes! But this hotel takes service seriously and the staff is impeccably trained with service that is both friendly and precise. No LA attitude here. We LOVE this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “5 Stars for a great price - great hospitality, location, home away from home”
Reviews.Author: betti14
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sofitel the 3 days before Thanksgiving in Nov 2011. From the moment we walked in to the time we left I felt like I was in as close to a 5 star hotel as possible - without actually paying for one. Unbelievable holiday decor - modern and orignal. Our first room did not have windows that opened, so all I did was ask and they put us in a room 2 floors up with "french doors" - which opened to the tiny balcony and was a very nice touch. Apparently all the rooms with 2 beds face the Beverly Center, but I didn't mind because everything else was so great! I think our first day there LA got about 5 hours of steady rain - and even with the doors shut, the water seeped in onto the carpet. I don't think LA in general is equipped for heavy rain so I considered it a fluke. Coming from Boston this is nothing. The bathrooms were very nice - lovely glass enclosure - rainmaker shower, L'Ocittane products, hairdryer (without having to ask). The Robe was so so comfy too! No fan though. I thought that was weird. The beds Crazy Comfortable! Feather beds and soft sheets were such a nice luxury away from home. The hallways were lovely. The Concierge / Valet so helpful. Complimentary umbrellas for the rain. The Restaurant Bar very appealing for both Dining and Drinks. The gym was fully equipped with machines and food/water! Le Spa is a "Must Do". We got a $25 off with our reservation which was a nice surprise. Very decadent. The pool is so-so compared to all the other ones in the area, no view and sun fades away by 1pm due to the Beverly Center blocking it. When we were there the pool was out of service, so the hotel allowed guests the use of the SLS pool which is supposed to be excellent! This location was perfect for me. Facing Beverly Center, 10 min walk to Robertson St and the Ivy, 25 minute walk to the Grove. Close to public transportation if necessary. 5 min walk to Hertz rent a car, 5 min walk to Melrose Ave. Across the street from the tour bus pick-up (Starline and others). We actually even walked home from the Comedy Store one night from the Sunset Strip! About 30min walk downhill. I really loved this European hotel, and the luxury it exuded. Normally I am not in the room a lot while traveling due to sightseeing, plans etc - but here I didn't want to leave! We were supposed to get the "I love chocolate" package, but we never did. I was so impressed with their other services, hospitality and room service though that I forgot about it until after I left. They allowed us late check out which we really appreciated. Overall I would absolutely stay here again - highly recommended for just about anyone. I cannot compare to the Four Seasons or the Peninsula, but I will say I felt like a VIP the entire time I was here.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay. Going back in March”
Reviews.Author: Sanja B
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Very modern, great and clean rooms. We had views of Hollywood sign and the hills and it was great view to wake up to every morning. It was our first trip to LA and we could not have been happier with location of this hotel. Directly opposite the Beverly Centre which enabled to walk across for quick bite to eat in mornings. Valet parking was very prompt but probably slightly overpriced. Fitness centre was one of the best equipped we have seen at a hotel. Loved it so much, we have booked another trip to LA and yes we will be staying here again. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: MatureStudent
Reviews.Content: Located across from Beverly Shopping Centre. Rooms nicely finished but more of a European style and size, smaller than normal US rooms . Restricted seating in room. Strange glass window to toilet/shower area from bedroom which prevents privacy while in bathroom. Attentive front desk with business centre with Apple computers. Parking at $32 per night is expensive. Did not eat in hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A nice Hotel made GREAT by its people”
Reviews.Author: Leave_the_house
Reviews.Content: Once you experience a hotel like the Sofitel you gain an understanding about what makes a good hotel a great hotel. Small touches, design, interactions with various staff and from this experience an attitude of â€œnothing is too much trouble.â€� When I checked in I realized that my flight from LA was departing at around 12:00 midnight the next day and asked if there was any chance of booking the room for another night. When I explained my situation the front desk staff provided me with a solution that worked for both of us. They suggested I check out of my room at the normal time and they would hold my baggage for the day. I was also offered at no charge the use of the Spa at the hotel for a change of shower and a change of clothes at the end of the day. This solution was terrific as it saved me paying for another night. The rooms at the Sofitel are great as they are not the typical box square cookie cutter hotel room you normally get, yet they manage to incorporate all the aspects you require without the loss of functionality. As my luggage had been lost in transit I asked housekeeping if they had any amenities for me to be able to use. They were extremely helpful in providing personal grooming items delivered to my room within a very short space of time. The WiFi in the room was easy to connect to and had fast transmission rate. The bed was comfortable and had easy access to side lights and clock radio. The only negative in the room was a lack of tea & coffee making facilities. I would think that this is almost mandatory in hotels these days. I had breakfast in the Simon La restaurant which was a very pleasurable experience. As mentioned earlier, it is the small things that make a great hotel. As I sat at the table the MaÃ®tre de noticed I was wearing dark colored trousers and asked if I would care for a black napkin rather than the white one on the table so the fluff wouldnâ€™t show on my trousers. The meal was brilliant with fresh food, well cooked. My concern staying at a French hotel was that the staff might be aloof and uninterested in the patron. What I found at the Sofitel was that the staff were chic and efficient â€“ a nice surprise. Liked: Service level from all staff was brilliant The location of the hotel is central to many areas in LA The room was nicely furnished and broke with the traditional square block into an interesting, yet still functional space The food at Simon LA was brilliant The WiFi was easy and fast Disliked: No tea or coffee making facilities in the room

Reviews.Title: “" Can't Stop Thinking about the Bed!!!"”
Reviews.Author: trotter13
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel because it was close to the CBS studios and it had a good star rating. When we arrived at the hotel there was six valet attendants and everyone greeted with a smile which was pleasant. (no self-parking) The check in went smooth but our Luxury room it was a bit small , we requested an upgraded and we agreed to the Opera Suite. The room was nicely furnished and glad we had a room type weâ€™re accustomed to experiencing. We went to our event and upon returning we thought we take a quick shower and go back out. The room was so peaceful and the shower was very refreshing with Hermes bath products which smell divine. The whole suite vibe was very nice, therefore we immediately decided to stay and enjoy the room. The room was facing the Hollywood Hills which was a peaceful view, not showing the hustle of Los Angles and we both agreed that didn't seem like we were in LA. The two TV were good size and very clear, loaded refrigerator and you can request an empty one for free and walls were solid for noise control. OMG the BED with the Frette bedding felt so wonderful, it was like I was sleeping on a cloud. The bed topped off this excellent experience. I love good sleeping beds and this ranking at the top. I could imagine sleeping there all day and night! We ate dinner at the SIMON LA, my partner had a bamboo steamed fish which was light and fluffy, very tasty and I went for the mouthwatering cowboy rib-eye, I do recommend this restaurant for the food, service and atmosphere. Love the location of this hotel, it's at the corner of La Cienega and Beverly Boulevard, opposite the Beverly Center and also close to Rodeo Drive, Melrose Avenue, and Sunset Boulevard. One guest I met told me she truly enjoyed an massage theLeSpa. This is a small hotel with a first class touch. Itâ€™s a French hotel and the operator is hard to understand and seem a bit short with you, but that would be my only complaint, but don't let that keep you away from this excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely beautiful”
Reviews.Author: juju-anne
Reviews.Content: Our room was beautiful and had a view right opposite the Beverley Centre. The beds were very comfortable, which was great as we were so tired from our long haul flight. The bathroom was very big a spacious but don't count on having a bath tub if you are wanting a good soak. Staff were very polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “a good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ramiJordan
Reviews.Content: convinient location, friendly staff, clean room, nice resturants, and suitable gym what do you want more

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms, nice views of LA”
Reviews.Author: FilmDave
Reviews.Content: Our room had a great view of the hills and Los Angeles. We could see Beverly Hills and Hollywood. The bed and sheets were very comfortable. The bathroom was spacious but only has a shower. That wasn't a concern for me, but if you are looking to take a bath, you may be out of luck. Service was efficient and polite. Many French people work at the hotel which was interesting to be in the heart of LA. The valet service sometimes took a while but the staff was extremely courteous. The mall across the street is great if you forgot something at home, but the variety of shops is nothing special. Room service was quick and tasted great. You will want a car in LA, but this hotel is on major bus lines and easy to walk to various cafes, drug stores, malls, banks, bars, etc. I was able to find a discounted rate online, but the rack rates are expensive. Would definitely stay here again. It's not as luxurious as the Beverly Wilshire, Peninsula, or Four Seasons but the staff is just as well trained and works hard to make you feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “USA tour”
Reviews.Author: PRoche Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good hotel located in west Hollywood with comfortable rooms and in a decent area. Limited public transport and when in LA need transport to travel around although the roads with the amount of cars are a joke! Friendly and efficient staff with well decorated and furnished reception area. Bar area good for drinks although not outside due to time of the year.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Rooms & Service was amazing”
Reviews.Author: Love2TravelML8
Reviews.Content: I decided to book The Sofitel LA for a few days for my LA leg of my trip. As a Platinum Accor member I was afforded a nice room upgrade with a small balcony with views of the Hollywood sign - if you have good eye sight that is! Hotel: Conveniently located near West Hollywood and adjacent to the Beverley Centre, you're close to the happening areas. But with anything in LA you will need to rent a car to get around because none of major attractions are that near to each other. Room: Large, beautifully appointed with high thread count sheets, cool Bose radio/clock, massive rain shower head and a cool little balcony. Importantly the bed was great, we had a nice sleep - it was so quiet too. Gym: As an avid body builder I was happy to see that the Sofitel's gym was fully decked out. It was the best hotel gym I've trained at - and I've been to alot of hotel gyms. The well stocked towels, apples and Evian waters were a nice touch too. The pool is great too, very cool. 10/10 Service: The service at this hotel is fantastic, they recognise platinum status and everyone is friendly and helpful - espicially concierge. Overall: This is a great value deluxe hotel, which is centrally located with superb staff and plush rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel, faultless stay!”
Reviews.Author: DM1100
Reviews.Content: Everything you would expect from a leading Hotel. The staff were exceptional and always on hand. The concierge helped plan our stay and arranged our excursions. No plans to return to LA yet, but have booked at Sofitel's for forthcoming trips.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location with High Quality Sofitel Standard”
Reviews.Author: MrJellineck Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: As an A Club Gold Member, we've stayed at Sofitels in the US, Canada and Europe - the Sofitel in Los Angeles did not disappoint. The quality was consistent with Sofitel standards and we were very happy with the staff, room and amenities. The fitness center was exceptional - very spacious & well equipped. I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: andrepaulGoldCoast
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on a recent trip to Los Angeles. Smart hotel in a great location, right across the road from the Beverley Centre. The rooms are spacious and comfortable and well maintained. The hotel is within 20 mins walk to Farmers Market and 20 mins walking distance to Robertson Blvd for shopping and star gazing. Being around the corner from La Cieniga Blvd you are close to great restaurants and only a short walk from Santa Monica Blvd and Melrose Ave. Sunset and Rodeo Drv are only a quick cab ride away. The staff are very friendly and helpful and everything is catered for at this hotel. This will always be our choice of hotel when we stay in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Gender bias still lives”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My only concern with my stay was that a male at the service desk did not give my wife the respect that was due to her. He would not accept her credit card but insisted that mine be used. I had to sign for any bookings that were charged to our room. This did not happen with any other staff member during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Meh”
Reviews.Author: tuescon
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Sofitel after Mandarin in Vegas which in all probability has raised expectations unfairly high. Pros: Good location. Great staff. Very good beds! I need a firm bed and it was much better than the one in Vegas which was way too soft. Cons: Not sure if it's the standard in LA (or most cities in the states) but the standard rooms were rather small and cramp. Wifi charges is based on each device. I have a personal phone, a corporate phone and an iPad. Do I really have to choose which to use? The shower is really weak and is designed poorly as water always gets out and wets the entire bathroom. Overall, average hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location...”
Reviews.Author: Magnum55
Reviews.Content: my wife and I stayed at the Sofitel Nov 6 to 10 while on vacation in LA. The hotel is in a very central location... just a 20 to 30 min drive max to the Staples Center, Universal Studios, the Getty Center, Griffith Observatory, Kodak Theater etc... The Beverly Center is right across the street and there are several restaurants within a few square miles. Over the five nights we stayed at the Sofitel we had no complaints. The staff was efficient and courteous and the hotel premises were neat and clean. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “superb service!”
Reviews.Author: monicaj240 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is our 4th stay at The Sofitel Los Angeles, it is a perfect location for our business travel in Beverly Hills, and also a perfect location to relax after a long work day! wonderful accomodations, great restaurant and bar! Beautiful lobby, and the rooms are well appointed and very comfortable. We can honestly say we have not one negative comment about this property, and for the price (extremley reasonable for 4-5 star hotel in Bev Hills) it beats other, more expensive hotels in the area in regards to service and comfort!

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelmed”
Reviews.Author: kiwikurt Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I was a bit surprised with the lack of ammenties. I regulalry stay at Accor Hotels and expected a Sofitel to be a step above Novitel. However, not having facilities for hot beverages like a Nespresso machince of filter coffee maker seemed a bit odd.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort, service and location at Sofitel L.A.”
Reviews.Author: Matt C
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Sofitel in L.A. several times for work and it's great. The staff is very focused on customer service and were responsive even when I arrived late from a delayed flight. Check in and check out always is a smooth process. The beds are extremely comfortable and the showers are awesome. While the rooms aren't all that big, you have everything you need. And if you are lucky, you can get a view of the Hollywood hills. The location is key, as you are across from the Beverly Center and close to many great restaurants and bars. The valet is expensive but you can always park over at the Beverly Center for $10 if you don't need to be pampered. Occasionally there is a celebrity event at the Stone Rose which takes some attention away but it's not all that intrusive. Prices at Stone Rose are on the high side but the food is good. Overally, a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “great location....”
Reviews.Author: gail y
Reviews.Content: the restaurant and bar service was great....... the hotel service not so great......room was cleaned until we called late in the day.

Reviews.Title: “A great European experience”
Reviews.Author: Preben B
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in this hotel more than five times this year, every time on business, and no matter what time I check in, be it in the middle of the night or during the day I get a warm welcome back from the staff. Being from Europe I like the atmosphere and the French style breakfasts, and I have stayed in Sofitels in Europe as well as her in the US and have never been disappointed. It's close to good shopping, good restaurants( incl. the one in the hotel) and not too far from LAX.

Reviews.Title: “wow”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Other than sound proofing in the rooms, which may be an issue if you are light sleeper or have party goers on your floor, this is an amazing hotel. It is one of the best for location, convenience, ease of getting around (despite valet parking only, but that's LA).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay and an amazing bed”
Reviews.Author: Goose99
Reviews.Content: 2nd time staying at this hotel and both stays have been perfect. The staff is very friendly and attentive. The rooms are very clean and large. The bed is one of the best hotel beds my wife and I have ever slept in. Great location to shopping and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, friendly staff, the best hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alnaimi
Reviews.Content: I have stayed 2 times in this hotel. The first one is for 6 days and the 2nd stay is 8 days during the month of October and November. The hotel staff from the valet to the front desk to the concierge are very friendly and helpfull. The rooms are very clean, housekeeping are fast and on time. The room service not bad at all. I will definetely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: SharkATL
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here during a recent vacation to LA. Centrally located near Beverly Hills. Very modern feel to the hotel. Stylish pool area. Also has a very hopping nightclub. Overall a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel in West Hollywood!”
Reviews.Author: AllisonM_Vancouver
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over the Halloween weekend for a girls getaway.The hotel is very stylish, trendy and posh! As well, the front desk and concierge were all very attentive during our stay. The main hotel areas (lobby, front desk, restaurants, etc) are very modern... overall you really feel like you're experiencing a true Hollywood hotel! We had dinner one night at Simon LA, the food and drinks were delicious (a bit pricier, but its like this everywhere in LA). You are also right next to Beverly Centre - lots of shopping if that's what you're in to! We were in a room with 2 double beds, it was quite spacious, comfortable, a little dated... but still in good condition (and clean!). My only complaint is we were in a room near the elevator so it was quite noisy in the early hours of the morning. I would still rate this hotel a 4 star property and would recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “The people made the difference”
Reviews.Author: gwyndafini
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel for two nights at the end of a long vacation. The location was great for us, we enjoy people watching on Sunset Boulevard and love going to the Farmers Market which is 5 minutes drive away. We booked on a special saver rate and were happy with having the standard room type which was small but nicely furnished. We asked to change the room for one that had a bath and that was handled superbly, nothing was too much trouble. We were heading out for a meal and the Head of Security spend time asking about our stay and recommended a close restaurant which turned out to be a great tip. This level of service made a difference. On the down side, the valet parking was too expensive as was the internet charge.

Reviews.Title: “No doubts , book it”
Reviews.Author: Geert999
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, excellent staff, nice restaurant Simon LA

Reviews.Title: “Value for money in an expensive city”
Reviews.Author: internationalist159
Reviews.Content: You can usually get pretty decent rates (especially for LA) at this hotel which is its main redeeming feature. The rooms are quite generous for the price if you stay in a suite (I don't know what the smaller rooms are like) and the feel of the rooms is that they are not yet tired and are fairly modern. The cable is decent, ie not the most basic package which is saying something for penny pinching american hotels. Some of the rooms are oddly shaped (ie the bathroom is in the middle with only sliding doors to lock it off) and the shower of our particular suite had a large opaque window which, shall we say, was not so opaque. Not an issue for couples, but considering I was travelling with a friend - we pretty much had to not go into a certain area of the room when the other was showering. Although, speaking of the shower, it was HUGE and had multi-directional jets and a place to sit which I found, felt very luxurious. The amenities such as pool and bar are adequate and the staff are reasonably helpful. It is well positioned on the cusp of beverly hills and right across the street from the Beverley Centre which is a very big mall/shopping centre. The valet (because in LA you must have a car) is competitive with other hotels and is quite prompt. The only real complaint we had was with the concierge, who honestly speaking, was an idiot. She was totally ill-informed about good places to go and her maps/lists were incorrect - which actually cost us a lot of money in cab fares and a lot of wasted time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for LA”
Reviews.Author: GaryinSydney
Reviews.Content: Just a 2 night stay on the way between SYD and NYC. Excellent location, as on the cusp of W. Hollywood and Beverly Hills as well as directly opposite great shopping venues at the Beverly Centre and the discount stores at Beverly Connection (Marshalls, Nordstrom Rack etc). The hop-on, hop-off bus stop was also across the street from the hotel entrance, so very convenient for a short stay as ours with no hire car.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean all around, comfortable rooms, great service, great price for the location.”
Reviews.Author: chicagowl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is A great location for getting to Beverly hills and west Hollywood nightlife. Staff from valet, to check in, to the bar and house cleaning were very welcoming and friendly. Everything in the hotel is very clean and beds are comfortable. This hotel also has a great gym. The rooms are a bit small but that isn't a problem for me when visiting LA as I would rather be outside. A definite recommend if your wanting to stay in this area and be close to all the best that LA has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel with superior service...”
Reviews.Author: djm0810
Reviews.Content: Arrived on an early Sunday morning during street closures all around the hotel...though we had to drag our luggage from several blocks away...once inside the hotel, all difficulties were forgotten. The delightful young lady at the front desk quickly checked us into a 9th floor room overlooking the Hollywood Hills. The room was small but clean & adequately equipped with abundant light from the two French doors that could be opened to let in the California breeze. The bathroom was roomy enough with a large shower (no tub) & L'occitance toiletries, fluffy robe & slippers & magnifying makeup mirror. I did request and receive a coffeemaker & extra pillows. The bed was a bit unusual but was comfortable enough. The room service was not great but there are many wonderful restaurants within walking distance. Overall, the service we received from the staff was exceptional. Friendly, helpful tips from the Concierge, front desk, & bellmen. I would imagine this hotel is very convenient for sightseeing as Citysightseeing bus stops across the street and you can purchase tickets at that stop also. Also, if you need a nearby hotel close to the Cedars Sinaii hospital. If shopping is your thing, there were many stores literally across the street including Nordstroms Rack, Macy's & Bloomingdales. The CVS also across the street was great & I recommend that you pick up a few things, especially bottled water, Diet Coke, snacks, etc. as the hotel does not have pop machines or any place to pick up a quick snack. We did not have a car & taxi's are very expensive...on average about 35-40$ for just about anywhere in the surrounding area you would like to visit. We did use them for a trip to Santa Monica & downtown to an awesome club called Edison's. There were a couple of restaurants that had great happy hour specials including PF Changs & a fabulous pub, the 3rd Street Stop about a 5-10 min. walk.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: LouthLady
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel is an excellent hotel, clean spacious room (Superior double) good lively bar at night but could not be heard in bedrooms. Although we didnâ€™t eat in the restaurant at night, the breakfast was just gorgeous out on the patio area (but pricey â‚¬20pp for tea & pancakes inc tip but they do include a small smoothie sample & bread basket complimentary. The pool is lovely & has plenty of seating areas away from the poolside to enjoy the LA sun. The hotel is located across the road from the Beverly shopping centre, about a 20 minute leisurely walk from the Grove shopping centre & about 7/8 minutes from Robertson avenue another good shopping street, also home to the celeb favourite restaurant The Ivy. There is a CV pharmacy across the street in the Beverley connections & plenty of restaurants & the Starbucks in the Beverly centre opens very early around 7am (I think) & closes at 9pm. The www.grandluxcafe.com (which is my favourite restaurant in the USA) is a must to try something for every taste. All in all a great hotel & I will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: jskiba55
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sofitel LA in July for 4 nights with my partner. On our American holiday we stayed at the Sofitel in LA, New York and Washington DC. If I had to rank them, I would probably rank this on third but it was still a great hotel. I am an A-Club Silver member and this was noted by the hotel and our free drinks voucher was provided. I think have a feeling we were put in an older room as the layout of the room was slighty different from what I had read from the reviews on TA. We were in a Luxury Room with a Hills view. The view was nothing exciting. The room was very clean, enough room to be comfortable and the bed and showers were great. The staff were excellent and everything was smooth and no hassles.
