The best part of this hotel is the location. It is directly across the road to the Beverly Centre which is great shopping. We ate at the restaurant one night and it was good but nothing special. No complaints and I would recommend the hotel as it is comfortable, clean and in a great location. The rooms weren't cheap so it would be good to keep a look out for special deals.

Reviews.Title: “Room was like a little cocoon that I didn't want to leave”
Reviews.Author: Enick
Reviews.Content: Arriving jetlagged from Sydney having not slept in about 24 hours, entering the Sofitel was a fabulous start to our trip. We were allowed to check in early, all of the staff we met were very pleasant, and the room was super comfy. I especially loved the light blocking efficiency of the window coverings and the quietness of the room. I can't comment on the food or gym or spa as most of the time we were in the hotel I was snuggled up in the very comfy bed! The location is good for tourists, being across from the Beverly Centre, some eateries and a stop point for at least one of the hop on hop off bus services that span L.A. It was a great 3 day stay and I would happily recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Plush and Pleasing”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: 10 out of 10 . We arrived in LA as the last stay of our 6 week Canadian & USA tour and we were all pretty well tired and looking for a place to rest our weary bones. Well, I can say that the Sofitel in LA topped off a great trip. The bed in our room was the best bed on the whole tour . It was very comfy and we had our best nights rest during the entire trip. The rooms were special as they were well equipped with a good sized bathroom and a shower recess that I'd like to dulplicate for my own home residence.

Reviews.Title: “Superb service”
Reviews.Author: stevekSD Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Sofitel Los Angeles several times now. The service is outstanding - from valet parking, through check-in, concierge, room service. This is my hotel of choice after trying many in LA. Location excellent for West Hollywood/Bev Hills restaurant scene.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Staff is welcoming and helpful. Rooms are comfortable and relaxing. Great bed. Love the French Press coffee in the restaurant! Have stayed there twice and will likely stay again next time we're in LA!

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel Rocks!!”
Reviews.Author: SamToronto_bodyblue
Reviews.Content: I have been going to LA for business, at least 4 times a year for the past 12 years and the Sofitel has been my fave place to stay, best location, you can walk to Beverly Ctr, Robertson, The Grove, Excellent Restaurants close by. Service at the hotel is impeccable, concierge is very helpful! Spa is worth a visit, and the gym is never busy! Rooms are immaculate! Best views at the back of Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: sooz d
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful property! This was my second stay and everything was absolutely perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Always a great experience”
Reviews.Author: tingy011
Reviews.Content: 99% of the time I am in L.A. for business I stay here at the Sofitel. Perfect location, I am always happy with my room with the french doors. I love looking at the mountains. The staff is very helpful and friendly. The beds are like sleeping on a cloud. Usually I have very happy with the food at Simon but this time my dinner and dessert was not up to par.

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel - great location. Not massive rooms though”
Reviews.Author: gibosity
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two nights in late September. Everything about the hotel is top notch, from the service to the amenities. The lobby is different to most others I'm used to, but with space at a premium in LA, I can understand why it was bit smaller than usual. I was a bit disappointed with the room size. Considering the amount we were paying, I was hoping for something bigger. However, the bed was super comfortable and the rain shower was fantastic. The pool is quite small, but again, with space at a premium, this is understandable. Probably the best thing about this hotel is the location. With the Beverly Center right across the road, as well as other department stores and restaurants, there's plenty within walking distance. Added to this is the fact that Rodeo Dve and Sunset/Hollywood Blvd's are only 5 mins drive away. I should mention that it's about time hotels of this calibre started introducing free wireless. Many 2-3 star hotels offer it, so why not the higher end chains? If you're looking to stay in LA and see the sights, this is a great place to do it. The staff are helpful and courteous, and it's a great place to come back to at the end of a long day!

Reviews.Title: “west hollywood done right”
Reviews.Author: dbbarton
Reviews.Content: Worth every penny , Great Rooms ,great staff, Best fitness room i have seen in years for a Hotel and it all worked!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: TravelGuru1973
Reviews.Content: We travel often to LA. The Sofitel hotel is in a great location across from the Beverly mall and within walking distance to amazing restaurants, such as The Ivy and Newsroom Cafe. The Spa at the Sofitel is one of the best - I've had facials, massages and nail services here. The beds are super comfortable and the linens and bath products are in alignment with 4* hotel standards. The free coffee in the atrium is DELICIOUS! The decor is modern and the bar very trendy. This hotel makes for a great girls' night out - spa during the day, busy lounge at night. The only reason I would not rate a 5* is the value as some of the rooms are quite small.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: mljc68
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Sofitel was very enjoyable. Great room, very nice and friendly service. When we first checked into our room we noticed some large stains on the carpet so we called the front desk. We were then shown two other rooms to chose from, and a porter came almost immediately to move our bags to the new room. Itâ€™s in a great location, very close to everything (great shopping!) and we also enjoyed the lounge for pre-dinner cocktails in the lovely outdoor tents. I would definitely return to the Sofitel for its location, amenities and service.

Reviews.Title: “USA California Explorer”
Reviews.Author: Dimpy1
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very impressive, the foyer, the layout, the staff. As soon as we arrived we were made to feel at home. The room was fantastic and very spacious. Although there was a large shopping centre across the road, we were given the impression on the website that Rodeo Drive was around the corner, thinking we would walk there, but it turns out to be 10 drive or 30 minute walk, so thought the write up was a bit misleading. But apart from that the meals were excellent and when you arrive you get a discount voucher to use at the restaurant. The breakfast was also great with table service being a great change from a buffet. Would still recommend the hotel to anyone, just don't expect Hollywood to be around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Kareneastsussexuk
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd stay in LA and 2nd time at the Sofitel (1st stay at four seasons for honeymoon). We stayed in the opera suite and found the suite to be very spacious and clean. We were travelling with our 1 year old and the staff went out there way to make sure we had everything we needed and felt very at home. The location is excellent for both shopping and sight seeing.

Reviews.Title: “ARRIVAL SERVICE WAS A LET DOWN.”
Reviews.Author: ANDORRA-GEMMA
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel LA was carefully selected from many hotels for our trip around USA. We booked a superior room with city view and we booked direct with the hotel. It's description was clear with 325 sqft,city view,King Bed, glass enclosed shower. We arrived late in the evening and were allocated a room which did not look like the images we had viewed. It was small, older furnishings and the bathroom was fitted with rails and shower access for disabled use. I returned to reception and asked that they confirm we had been allocated the correct room as it didnt appear to be Superior and the recptionist confirmed yes. There was no room change offer available that evening. The following day, we raised the issue again with the reception and explained that our room was not superior, no glass shower and smaller than our booking confirmation. The receptionist immediately moved our room saying that we should have not been allocated this room. Our new room was what we had expected. The hotel gym and breakfast service was excellent and the location was good. The major disapointment to us was this lack of service and interest on arrival that led to a night in the wrong room and time wasted moving the next day.

Reviews.Title: “That old adage..”
Reviews.Author: FamilyGuy2000
Reviews.Content: That you pay for what you get is quite true at this hotel. If there are four in your party like us (me, wife 9yo & 5yo) then you will need a suite. It was a lovely room but the kids still needed to sleep on a fold out couch. We had breakfast, parking and WiFi included in our package which is a great option (though they did forget to take this off the final bill until I made mention of this fact). The food quality is excellent (though expensive) I am also not a fan of hotels that automatically include a 18% gratuity in the bill. The menu said that this was for dinner only and for parties of 6 or more but we found that it was included on every bill breakfast, lunch and dinner. This is not really a hotel that caters or welcomes children. Overall we were happy with our 3 night stay and would stay there again if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Very classy hotel - polished staff - very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: BusTrav106
Reviews.Content: This hotel is directly across from the Beverly Center and is convenient to a lot of attractions - Beverly Hills, Santa Monica, West Hollywood, etc. I chose it initially because it was the closest hotel to my brother and I was completely disappointed during my last stay in LA. From the minute I got out of the car till I checked out - I was made to feel very welcome. Staff members even greet you at the door at the end of the day with "Welcome Back". I have read a few other reviews that say the rooms are small - they are - very small. But in LA it is to be expected. The food in the restaurant is fantastic - one of the best tuna steaks I have ever had! One word of caution - check your bill at the end of the stay - I was charged for mini bar items I never used - a minor point but I watched most of the other people checking out without even glancing at the bill. Enjoy the Beverly Center - right across the street - great shops.

Reviews.Title: “5 days of satisfaction”
Reviews.Author: Thomas V
Reviews.Content: First visit to Sofitel LA and was stisfied from the moment we arrived. Welcomed by an extremely friendly hotel staff, you feel at ease right away. The room and bathroom were very luxurius and and exceeded standards, what is general at any other Sofitel I visited before. Also the restaurant 'Simon LA' was a great pleasure, fine dining and service. Located next to Beverly Boulevard the hotel easily accessible by car. If you want a very nice hotel in LA, i recommend the Sofitel and will surely visit it again on my next LA visit.

Reviews.Title: “Service is their mantra!”
Reviews.Author: tarcat71
Reviews.Content: We were there for medical reasons and the Sofitel was there to assist us at every turn. Their rooms are comfortable and well appointed. The restaurant is delicious and service is quick and excellent. But, the bell service far exceeds any hotel we have ever stayed in. They could not help us enough. They were never without a smile. If this hotel cannot meet your needs, you need to go to a different city!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, unfitting service.”
Reviews.Author: Imolarede46
Reviews.Content: The location is absolutely amazing. Right on Beverley across the Beverly center. My first room had no electricity... This was unfortunate due to my late arrival. Housekeeping took approx 45 minutes to bring shower gel in the am. No coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Deneys
Reviews.Content: A great option in LA- well positioned for shopping, helpful concierge and great rooms. The bar at the hotel is also great so all round a job well done.

Reviews.Title: “No Problems, Great Staff, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Azhkman
Reviews.Content: When I book a hotel, I always read the "terrible" reviews to see exactly what could go wrong. From those reviews I expected at worst, an indifferent staff. Thankfully, none of that happened. I requested a late checkout, which was granted for 2pm free-of-charge. Everything I needed from the front desk, they were very good about assisting with, and everyone was polite. I stayed in room 712, which had a view across into the Beverly Center mall, an ok place to stroll and kill time. Within walking distance of the of the hotel is The Grove (about 25min), and many fast food joints, and a few restaurants. The room and bathroom were very clean, and everything worked to a great standard. The burger from room service was fantastic, though, I would have preferred regular fries versus herb fries but hardly an issue. The layout of the bathroom is quirky, but they make the most of it, the shower is massive, the kind of place you can have company if that's your thing. I try to avoid giving 5 stars out, but I could not find anything wrong with this hotel in my experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel and Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Laura56003
Reviews.Content: Every single detail was taken care of at this hotel. It was beautiful and comfortable and I would for sure stay there again when in the Los Angeles area. The staff responded to our every need/want. The only thing I wasn't that satisfied with was the room service food. It was good, but too expensive for what was served. Anyway, other than that, the experience was one of our best ever.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Bebej1976
Reviews.Content: In short an amazing experience.Â  We stayed three nights at the Sofitel Los Angeles and were really impressed from the moment we arrived until our departure.Â  The hotel had a perfect location for us, located close (walking distance)Â to the bars and restaurants of West Hollywood and an easy drive to the sights of Hollywood and Beverly Hills. Â  We hired a car and found our way to the hotel easy from LAX. Friendly and efficient valet parking is available for US$32 per night which we found reasonable for the area. Â We were greeted with a stylish and modern lobby and were hugely appreciative of being able to check into our room even though it was only 10am. Service was really personalized and efficient. Â The receptionist on completion of checking us in actually walked us over to the elevators and pointed out and explained all the services of the hotel. We found this very thoughtful and helpful.Â  We had a room on the 8th floor and were extremely happy with it. Â It was a good size with an amazingly comfortable bed. It had a small Juliette balcony and a spacious bathroom with large walk in rain shower. We slept really well and the corridors were very quiet.Â  Wired and wireless Internet was available in the rooms for a charge but there was also four Mac's located in the lobby complete with a printer that guests could use for free.Â  There is a small pool and sun deck as well as a spa and a gym. The gym is quite simply one of the best hotel gyms I've encountered. A large facility with a full range of cardio, free weights, weight machines and more. There was also a spa but we didn't have time to use any of the treatments.Â  We didn't use any of the food or beverage outlets within the hotel as we were pretty much constantly out and about and there is a huge range of dining venues within walking distance of the hotel. If I had to find any 'could do better' points of the hotel it would be to provide tea and coffee facilities in the rooms (there are none) and to extend the gym opening hours or make it a 24hr facility. The gym is not manned and access is gained with your room key. I noticed that a lot of guests were from Australia/NZ/Asia and on their home time zones and the gym was starting to get busy at 9pm (morning time in those time zones) so it would have been great to have extended use of the facility. But all in all a fantastic and beautiful hotel that I would highly recommend. And provided I could get a competitive rate with them again I would definitely make it my hotel of choice in LA.Â

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Service and Great Property”
Reviews.Author: Daryl C
Reviews.Content: The signage for the hotel is very modest so we drove past before we saw the name on the front door. Inside, everything is anything but understated. The lobby is very modern with great artwork and a high-end concierge. The restaurant and bar are very sophisticated. (French press coffee for breakfast for instance.) The bar scene can get a bit loud so if you're looking for a quieter locale for conversation, cross the street to the Capital Club. Top notch food, drink, and atmosphere. The hotel is across the street from the Beverly Center. Don't get too excited; it's only a glorified mall. But as a place to stay, the Sofitel is well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: michelle_moo
Reviews.Content: Sofitel LA is a gorgeous hotel, located conveniently next to a great shopping mall. Close to local attractions such as The Grove, Farmers Market. It seems difficult to get a truly central hotel in LA as the city is so spread out, but we found this location very convenient for the sights we wanted to see. Service at the hotel was second to nome. Valet service was quick, breakfast at SimonLA was tasty and again, great service. Our 3 nights were somewhat spoiled by very noisy neighbours, a large group of young dance performers who were using the room across the hall as a sewing / dressing room. People coming and going at least every 2-3 minutes until quite late at night. When we called to complain, the hotel promptly sent someone to sort out the issue, but I do feel that large groups like that should all be placed together on the same floor to minimize disruption to other guests. Overall though, we were very satisfied with our stay and would recommend the hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Dominique L
Reviews.Content: This was the fifth time I had stayed at Sofitel LA and I seem to enjoy the hotel more and more every time. It is a beautiful property and its location is ideal to explore West Hollywood and Beverly Hills. The rooms are large, the views onto the hills stunning (sunset particularly), and the hotel quite lives up to the Sofitel brand. I was privileged to stay at other US Sofitels, and Sofitel LA is definitely one of my favorite with DC, Chicago and NY. I enjoyed the pool area this time as I was traveling in late August. For shopping fans, the Beverly Center is a few steps away. Nice restaurants on Melrose are also within walking distance, which makes again the location ideal. Clean, hip, stylish, convenient, comfortable and reasonable in terms of price; Sofitel LA has the magical formula of other Sofiitel properties in the US . I look forward to staying there again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel... bring your $$$”
Reviews.Author: Familyfour09
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beautiful. Stayed one night for a stop over before heading back to Australia. Could not fault it but as for all top hotels everything was expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't trade it for anything.”
Reviews.Author: Roger D
Reviews.Content: Sofitel is all about service. From the front desk staff, to the concierge, to the valets who park your car, to the bellman who brings your bags to your room, to the housekeeping staff that tends to your room with detail and unobtrusiveness, these folks can't do enough to make you feel welcome. Could have stayed at "hipper, trendier" places, but Sofitel has a refined elegance that transcends all that. The staff has but one interest: "How can we make your stay with us as good as it can be?" No task or request goes unanswered, or ignored. And they make a guest feel that they are genuinely pleased to have been of service. Bathrooms, btw, were immaculate. The restaurant, Simon LA, is very, very good. Delicious food. Never rushed. We ate at Capital Grille and Villa Blanca and they were both wonderful. But the hotel restaurant was our home base for convenience and the quality of food and service excelled. The Sofitel is not inexpensive. But I'm sure it's possible to pay more in the area, and get less. Loved it, and will return.

Reviews.Title: “Decent for the price”
Reviews.Author: Grant M
Reviews.Content: We purchased this hotel on hotwire and got a good deal for something located in Beverly Hills. The location is very good if that is the area you want to stay. It is right across the street from a mall and only a few blocks from Rodeo Drive. The hotel is very much what we thought. People greet you when you arrive (valet and main lobby door). Front desk was very accommodating about our early check in at 10:30am even though they were extremely busy upon arrival. We did order some late night room service (available 24 hours) and it was delivered in about 25 minutes. We never tried the restaurant or main bar so I cannot comment on how that service would have been. Most of the people on staff were nice, but we were not expecting much. The rooms were very clean but very small. Bathroom was very small as well. We tried the gym out one day and it is actually very spacious compared to other hotels in Beverly Hills. They had the standard stair masters and treadmills but also had a full selection of free weights and quite a few machines. The locker room while small was the best part. It has 2 showers and they each have 24+ shower heads. Pretty cool! They do have a spa but we never checked it out. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to a traveler that was on a budget and wanting to stay in Beverly Hills. It does not come close to the Four Seasons or the Montage in terms of service or elegance but you will pay a higher price for those qualities.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good standard”
Reviews.Author: Tistret
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean rooms with amenities from L'Occitane. Room service menu and service is great. Concierge is nice and helpful. Pool and sun deck is nice and clean with complimentary strawberry water. Stone Rose Lounge is OK but service a bit indifferent. Ask for a room with a view over the Hollywood Hills.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: liketotravel952
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel but I wouldn't consider it luxury. My first time in L.A. so I did my homework on hotels. I chose The Sofitel on reviews. It was a good hotel and their service was great. I didn't care for the beds to much but it's not worth complaining about.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: staravalos
Reviews.Content: Right in the heart of the city. My friend came into town and we wanted to stay in a hotel that was central to everything! This hotel was just the place. Great views, great service and overall beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hdjrev
Reviews.Content: Had a two night stay here in January. We enjoyed a suite looking at the Hollywood Hills. Great room with ample space. Excellent Hermes amenities. Excellent gym. Concierge were spot on with their dining recommendations. Great for celebrity spotting.

Reviews.Title: “LA with children”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel in LA is a great place to stay, if you want to be close to Hollywood and to have good shopping close by (it is right across the street from the Beverly Center). We had a wonderful room (a suite), our kids (4 & 7 years) slept in the living room, while we had our private bed room. Service was outstanding and very friendly. The rooms were in very good conditions and our kids got crazy about the TV in the bath room (we actually never used it, but they liked it anyhow). The surroundings are very urban, with only concrete, few trees and a a big street crossing; yet, still an outdoor restaurant for breakfast and a pool exists. The restaurant was very good, and the area nicely decorated, you almost forgot you were in LA. The pool area however, is too small and it gets easily crowded. The service has to be called via the phone, there is no fixed bar or restaurant (actually the expenses are booked as room service). To get to the pool you have to walk via the conference area and almost via the service entrance, which is not very inviting. For one afternoon it was ok, but I would have wished for something more professional. Depending on what you need it is a great hotel, with an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: Robert C
Reviews.Content: Amazing service. Amazing decor. Excellent restaurant. Loved everything about it.

Reviews.Title: “a good option in LA”
Reviews.Author: Bigdada64
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights with the wife and kids, had adjoining rooms. Had a package that included breakfast and parking each day. Overall a nice stay. used the pool one day, small but serviceable. plenty of towels, and ice water available. The restaurant was wonderful each morning, fresh hot food with a french twist. The rooms were clean and comfortable, bathrooms nicely appointed. they do have the french style of shower/tub, with the partial door. takes a little getting used to, but it's not a deal breaker. large lighted closet, free water in rooms, even had a loufa in the bathroom. Beverly center across the street for shopping and dining, as well as other restaurants nearby. Overall a nice, if pricey stay in an area that's accessible to other desireable spots in LA.

Reviews.Title: “I could tell this was once a four star hotel”
Reviews.Author: catatmwc
Reviews.Content: The staff was all very friendly, and I could tell that when this hotel was new it was very nice. The problem is that they've let alot of things go in the rooms (leaky plumbing, stains on the carpets, drapes, and furniture). The first room they put us into smelled very heavily of mildew (the bellman said the carpets had recently been cleaned), and the second room also had a strange smell, but not the headache inducing mildew so we stuck with it. I've stayed in 5 star hotels and I've stayed in Marriotts, and honestly I'm not sure that the room quality even matches that of a Westin or a Marriott. We also once had our towels replaced only to find that one of the towels (when unrolled) was covered in brown stains (which I'm hoping was makeup and not something else). I called guest services and the woman I spoke with said that she'd let management know- We didn't hear anything else about it. The pluses are the the very friendly staff, the comfortable beds, and the Simon LA restaurant! It was also close to some great shopping (walking distance to Robertson and Melrose), and there were some really good restaurants on La Cienega (Fig & Olive, Nobu, Stk...).

Reviews.Title: “Top spot with top service!”
Reviews.Author: Lyo125
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Sofitel in LA and experienced an amazing and helpful staff, plus great food at Simon LA and neat and clean rooms with suitable business amenities. Highly recommended. No one said no to any requests! They really treated my collegue and I so well.

Reviews.Title: “good”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: staff very polite and helpful. The only thing we thought could be improved in the room was the shape of the bath. We felt it was a rather precarious shape for having a shower. We have been staying at this hotel for over 15 years and have always found it to be of a good standard. Loved the flowers in reception and finding the market down the road was a real bonus for us. findin 200 characters is difficult and have more than run out of things to say.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and friendly property”
Reviews.Author: doobeebaby
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 had a nice stay at this property surrounded by nice shopping areas and restaurants. The staff were very friendly and the concierge was helpful in making restaurant bookings ... etc. All in all a very pleasant stay. Would be happy to return.

Reviews.Title: “Classy, but not worth the $”
Reviews.Author: Oli0612
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here for one night. Internet: not free Parking: only valet parking $32 per night (with in and out privileges) Location: right across Beverly Center Food: complimentary bottled water, didn't try their restaurant, room service food was ok When we checked in, the staff said they have upgraded us to a suite, so we were all excited. When we went into the room, I wasn't so sure that was an upgraded one. It looks the same as the one I have booked for. We are not really a fussy couple, so we didn't make sure if it was upgraded or not, and just took whatever they gave us. But now since I am home, I just went to their website and checked their room types. We booked the Luxury King, and the next level room type is supposed to be Prestige Suite, which I assume was what he was supposed to upgrade us to, but we definitely DID NOT stay in the Prestige Suite. So I am not too sure what happened there. Inside the room, bed was comfy. Their BOSE system was good. Nice LG TV. Bathroom was nice, except some maintenance could be useful. Shower (both hand-held and rain shower) was hard to use at first. I tried to get it to hand-held, but the pull keeps going back to the rain shower. We later found out, the water needs to be strong enough before we can pull the pull for it to stay at hand-held. Overall, was okay, but for over $3xx a night, NOT WORTH IT.

Reviews.Title: “Fine, if you like being "in between worlds"”
Reviews.Author: truffin30
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sofitel LA August 1-5, 2011. It is located at the edge of West Hollywood and B Hills. Neighborhood somewhat marginal - a stretch of seediness along La Cienega detracts, especially an "all nude" bar. Various city types sauntering about the area constantly, but no one harrassed us. Outside very nice and clean. Inside nice but very dark, even at noon. Decor and ambience shouted "cutting edge" but clientele was mainly ordinary folk, like us, or at least people with means but more traditional lifestyles. Nice diverse group from gay couples to what looked like a high school cheerleading group. Staff was friendly and professional for the most part. Room was smallish for the price. Room was nicely decorated - the bathroom was sweet. Room was also very clean. I must say that one of Sofitel's selling points - their specially designed beds - were a disappointment. Turned out to be a downy top on what felt like concrete. In fact the entire bed was a bit awkward - haven't slept without a headboard on my bed since college. I guess that was a "cutting edge" touch. Right. The emperor has no clothes guys - your beds suck. Room service was fast and good. Prices were fair. However, the wet bar is a money sucker. Best to just go to CVS across the street, buy snacks and soda, and use Sofitel's delicious free ice instead. Of course, if you really WANT and CAN afford to spend $10 for a small pack of peanuts, knock yourself out. Also, valet parking is $32 a day. Prompt delivery of car to door and very nice doormen, but this is a money sucker also. By all means DO NOT USE the map you can print off their web site for anything like true directions to anything. For instance, if you were just going by their map to other locations, you'd think the Chinese Theater was about 9 blocks total away from the hotel. It is more like 30. The hotel IS centrally located, but everyone needs a car in LA to go anywhere it seems. Too bad the only thing worth walking to was the Beverley Center across the street. Overall I'd say my stay was average based upon other travel experiences. But as I said earlier, I felt like I was in two worlds - one very dark and "polished", the other "just folks".

Reviews.Title: “Simply excellent”
Reviews.Author: Ozaqua
Reviews.Content: Fantastic rooms, great service, good location. Plenty of restaurants nearby, and the Beverly centre across the road. Staff were welcoming and genuinely helpful. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel Los Angeles is in a great location from which to explore LA. The staff are friendly, the rooms are nice and the hotel bar has great ambiance.. I frequently stay in Accor hotels and this is definitely one of the nicest ones I've visited to date.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel spoils you and sets a standard!”
Reviews.Author: passportrequired
Reviews.Content: We chose Sofitel LA/Beverly Hills after our great experience at the Chicago Sofitel. Luxury, privacy, restaurant, room service, comfort, class, amenities, floor plans all provide the guests the best welcome. Close proximity to fine restaurants, shopping plaza, boutiques, landmarks,etc. The pool area, with luxurious towels, water cooler, and food service is worth the time to indulge in (we brought our own wine and snacks and consumed discreetly!) The club was well attended, with limos pulling up with clientele, good music. The staff, very very accommodating, always smiling and acknowledging every guest or inquiries. Great computer/business and coffee area. Don't deny yourself a Sofite stayl.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Jenabel
Reviews.Content: We arrived and were upgraded to a suite since we had made our reservations online. The man who checked us in was superb...very welcoming and friendly, explained where everything was, and then walked us to the elevator. I was impressed. Our room was excellent. Nicely furnished and decorated. Comfy bed. I have no complaints about our stay.

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest hotels out there”
Reviews.Author: HWatt
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sofitel Los Angeles last April. I have to say this is one of the nicest hotels we have ever stayed. The rooms are beautiful and comfortable, the service is exceptional, the concierge is pretty helpful, the restaurant / bar are amazing and breakfast is fantastic. The hotel is conveniently located across from the Beverly Center and within walking distance to very good restaurants in Beverly Blvd. But... what impressed us the must was the pet room service. If you are a dog/cat lover like us this is the place to go. Weâ€™ll definitively stay at this hotel next time we visit Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel is a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: mwasyluk
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week at the Sofitel Beverly Hills in April 2011. Having been impressed with the Sofitel in New York City, we made a point of checking out it's California counterpart - and we were not dissapointed! The hotel is very classy and very comfortable. The rooms were lovely and spacious as was the bathroom. Room service was prompt and yummy and housekeeping was spot on. Do yourself a favour and have at least one meal in the restaurant - the food was fantastic! Best Potato and Leek soup I've ever had...mmmmmmm! Concierge was incredible, not only getting us reservations for all the top spots, but also securing the best tables as well! Doormen were always pleasant and conversational. The location is great - directly across from Beverly Hills Shopping Mall! Much more shopping and great restaurants were well within walking distance. Hollywood Boulevard, Beverly Hills, the Sunset Strip are all a stone's throw away. Even one of the double decker tour buses stopped right at the Sofitel's front door - how convenient is that?! We truly had a wonderful time!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Katmar83
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of our San Fran to LA drive and were not disappointed. At check in, seeing we were two friends traveling together, they offered for us to move from a single king to a room with 2 double beds, and gave us a high floor. The room was lovely, and we loved the L'occitane accessories in the bathroom! Of course the valet was expensive, but we had to do it, and the staff were so helpful with the valet-helped with bags, shopping, etc, so we felt right at home. Everyone we came across was friendly. I have no idea why people complained about the beds-they were beautifully comfortable!! The concierge got us reservations to Chateau Marmonte (which is exclusive and hard to get into), which we were very grateful for. We had heard this restaurant was amazing but it definitely was NOT. Will post review on the restaurant separately. All in all, we enjoyed our stay-friendly staff, beautiful rooms and great location for shopping!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't know what people are complaining about!”
Reviews.Author: Adrianhamill
Reviews.Content: We had a very good experience at the Sofitel LA. We had a king luxury room which was nice and quiet apart from the odd rude/drunken guest who was a bit rowdy in the hallway at 2am -but you get that anywhere you stay. I found the bed very comfortable, but my husband found the bed a little soft. The staff were friendly and helpful. Great location - right across from the Beverly Centre - great shopping! The hop on hop off bus service is directly across the road also, which was great for first timers to LA. Charges for mini bar are automactically added to your bill as soon as you pick something up from the fridge and parking is also very expensive. Overall a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: givanildobs
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, close to shopping, large rooms, room is clean.Staff very lovable. Soft sheets..... my wife loved....

Reviews.Title: “We were happy”
Reviews.Author: flannelpants
Reviews.Content: We ended up staying here because of the Sofitelâ€™s proximity to the Grove â€“ namely the American Girl store for a girlsâ€™ weekend with my young daughter. We got the Sofitel through hotwire, which saved us some on the cost. They gave us a room with 2 double beds even though they only have to give us a room with one bed. We didnâ€™t get a room with a view, but that really wasnâ€™t important to us. It turned out that we were there the same weekend as the BET awards. Yeah, parking is expensive at $35 a night, but it costs that much everywhere surrounding and the valet service is excellent. They were always happy to help with luggage and packages. Iâ€™m surprised by the number of people who complained about the beds. The beds are perhaps different, but I think didnâ€™t find them better or worse â€“ just different. We swam in the pool for a couple hours on Saturday afternoon. While there isnâ€™t a kiddie pool, the pool itself was fine for children and the staff and patronage were child friendly the day that we went. The lounge chairs are super cushy and comfortable. We love their fresh lemon water at the pool. We dined at the restaurant, Simon LA, on Friday evening. Surprisingly the restaurant was not crowded when we arrived and we were seated immediately. We filled up on drinks, appetizers, and sides, and maybe directly related, our service was slow. It took forever to get the bill when we were done. My daughter and I had pedicure appointments at the adjoining spa â€“ LeSpa on Sunday morning. The service was superior. We were treated very well. They even brought us water and orange slices. I highly recommend using their services. We were very happy with our stay at the Sofitel and would stay there again if we happen to be in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Look elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: dmckown
Reviews.Content: I went to a businees meeting at Cedars which is very close to this hotel and I would say the location is great but the hotel was disappointing. The bed was one of the most uncomfortable I have ever slept in at any hotel. The pool area is small, so not a good choice for kids, but there is the convenience of Cedars, Beverly Center and many good restaurants close by. Finally they actually charge extra for Wi Fi, which I could not believe. I'll stay elsewhere in the future

Reviews.Title: “2nd time at Sofitel L.A.”
Reviews.Author: bicocchinaonesta
Reviews.Content: We've been at Sofitel for the second time, we had had an amazing experience the first time (2008) and we've been well also this time but with some disappointments. The rooms are comfortable as usual, the hotel is really good and the position is strategic (of course you need a car). Valet parking is expensive (in line with other hotels) but the guys are really efficient and fast (they will do it for tips?). Negative note: the guy at the concierge was rude and he did not shine out of sympathy... in a structure so the kindness of the staff is very important. Anyway, we suggest you this hotel because it's a good hotel where to stay in LA with a right quality-ratio price.

Reviews.Title: “Miserable experience ever at a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eerios
Reviews.Content: The worst experience of my life. I called the reservation center 5 days prior to my arrival, asking for a double bedroom, but upon check-in, they had no record that I called, and told me the king-size was the only room available. In exchange, I asked for parking to be discounted as itwa s a whopping 32 $/night, and they said they couldn't do that. So we took the car out and parked it in the Beverly Center for two nights. Then, the room was smelly due to the refrigerator being broken. This was fixed immediately. Upon check-out, they charged me for a double bedroom, which I never got, and they had no record of. As soon as it's time to settle the charges, they recognize I had a double bedroom request, which to me, seemed really convenient.... I was appalled by this. Also, they charged me for the parking for the two nights which we never used. They tried to rip me off...maybe they thought I didn't speak much English, and were trying to take advantage of that, because if a non-native was charged that way, they would pay without a second thought.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Sneeker635
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week on business and had a King Luxury room. The stay overall was great, I would definitely come back. Overall it is a quiet hotel, no craziness going on even with Stone Rose. The staff was amazing, if you walk by they always said hello or asked if they could help. There was not one time that a staff member failed to greet me. The location is great as well, easy access to both Beverly Hills and WeHo. There was only one downside and that was the bed. I expected the bed to be more comfortable. I am a hotel snob so I expected better. It wasn't bad, just not what I would have expected. Other than that I have nothing bad to say about the place.

Reviews.Title: “It was a wonderful stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Earthmann
Reviews.Content: wonderful hotel with fantastic rooms (i had the prestige suite), perfect service, and a perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “the bed must be a joke. worst bed ever.”
Reviews.Author: usatrip2011june
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Rooms are nice. Staff is friendly. Rooms a not noisy at all. There are two things which are making my stay a nightmare. The bed.....the bed is some kind of bad joke. Even westin has better beds. Imagine concrete slab with some sort of feather filled thin.....3cm ....duna on it. This is my second night here and I'm looking forward leaving this hotel. It's a shame because people seems to be polite and friendly. The second and the last issue is the concierge......no english los angeles guide available. Just some glossy magazine full of advertisements for guci etc. Yes I'm a tourist. Lol . Unfortunately I have to say that I cannot recomend this hotel. The main issue is the bed. I can ignore that Snob working at concierge and get tourist info from the web.....but good night sleep is the most important thing....which u won't get here. The best bed on my trip was intercontinental followed by cosmopolitan westin etc. Even emergency overnight stay in some "inn" on the cost had better beds.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: blandab
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel in the first weeks of June 2011 and cannot say enough good things about the hotel for the price. Firstly let me say that we had trouble booking a hotel at around the price you can get to stay at this hotel (tip - use the tripadvisor rates tool to get the best rate at that time, it's awesome and saves you heaps of time), it seems Los Angeles has a lot of budget hotels that are poorly located or low quality and then a lot of high priced hotels living on past glory. The Sofitel shone out as a beacon in between these groups for us. The hotel. Vey comfortable, clean rooms with modern decor and the most comfortable beds ever! The bathrooms are very clean and modern with the toiletries and large shower with ceiling rose head highlights. The gym is commercial quality and nobody ever seems to be in there, the pool area is a little exposed to traffic noise (being at ground level) but heated to a nice temperature and with nice amenity and the heakth and beauty spa is a little pricy but exclusive (as you would expect with the West Hollywood location I suppose)and we had nothing but amazing service there. One slight negative is that there is not free wifi in the rooms, but this is counter acted somewhat by free use of 3 computers and printer in the Lobby. The hotel lobby, bars and restaurants are modern and very well presented, with the breakfast in the restaurant a highlight and something we highly recommend (Martha is amazing and will make you feel at home every morning). Now that I've touched on the staff I will continue. From our favourite Martha in the restaurant to Johnny the head of security all of the staff were great. The Concierge is always willing to help and very informative, and we found it best to book everything through them as with restaurants especially the Sofitel name seemed to open some doors in LA we couldn't. We had a little cab trouble (some of them don't like to put on the meter and/or claim they can't take credit cards as their machine is 'broken') so the front desk hand picked a cab for us the last day for the long trip to Anaheim and we had no problem (there are cab ranks right outside the hotel on each side of the road by the way). Great service in general we found. And the location, what a great spot. The hotel is located directly opposite the Beverly Centre, a large shopping centre with many exclusive shops and a place at which the Starlite hop on- hop off bus stops at every half hour from 9:30am (definitely worth using to get around the city, very affordable and visits all the must see places, with commentary), which is very handy. There are many great restaurants in walking distance (Jerry's Famous Deli, Koi, Urth Cafe, Bazar to name a few) and an abundance of other shops (including a 24 hour CVS pharmacy) and eating spots (Taco Bell, Corner Bakery, Tea Leaf and Coffee Bean etc) in walking distance as well. The rooms at the rear have a view of the Hills and Santa Monica Boulevard is a short walk to the north. I think I've covered everything, in all we ahd a great stay and would definitely stay again if back in LA. A big thanks to the staff at Sofitel for setting our honeymoon US tour off on a great foot!

Reviews.Title: “Comfy beds, great location”
Reviews.Author: desertdad67
Reviews.Content: The lobby was gorgeous, and had a chair made of coins (huge hit with our kids). Our room was spacious, the bathroom well laid out with nice toiletries and huge towels. The beds were amazingly comfortable. We were a little bit worried about noise, as our room fronted Beverly Center. It was completely quiet. The location could not be beat, close to the Farmer's Market, The Grove, Robertson Blvd, and directly across the street from Beverly Center (which is an odd mix of stores). It is also close to Universal Studios and the Griffith Observatory. Many great places to eat near by. Our room rate included breakfast. It was fantastic! They allowed our children to make substitutions and our waitress was so kind to us, especially our kids. We will definitely be back and have told our friends what a great property this is.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE LOVE LOVE this LA Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CathyMacMahon
Reviews.Content: From the moment we pulled into the hotel foyer our experience was perfect. There is no other way I can describe it. I have never had such a perfect hotel experience. Nothing is too much trouble for the staff at the Sofitel LA. The rooms are stunning, the facilities equally so. (There is a most divine raspberry cocktail everyone should try in the gorgeous bar). Across the road from the Beverly Centre it is a shoppers dream location. Very close to the sunset strip also. An excellent location. The concierges were so helpful. The bar staff very talented. The room service delicious. I really couldn't fault anything. My best hotel experience EVER (and I'm a seasoned traveller).

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: maisieMelbourne
Reviews.Content: This is a well located and very well run hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful and the rooms were lovely. Nice little pool area and the restaurant and bar downstairs were great. We would happily return next time we are in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny!!!”
Reviews.Author: ilovetoshop44
Reviews.Content: I'd have to say, this is one of the best hotels we've stayed at! From the service to the beds...it all was great!!! I highly recommend staying here while you're in L.A., you won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, with lovely rooms, great restaurant, terrifice service from every single staff member and great rates.”
Reviews.Author: barooga
Reviews.Content: This was out last hotel on ou 31 day trip, and the best by far. The hotel has had a recent upgrade and is a modern, chic, trendy yet warm and inviting place to stay. The hotel staff from the guys out the front to the lobby staff, reception, concierge, house-keeping and restaurant staff wer professional, efficient, helpful, friendly, accomodating and a pleasure to deal with. Nothing was too much trouble and we felt welcome, appreciated and well looked after. The hotel is in a terrifc location, right across from the Beverly Centre (huge shopping mall with all the big name stores), plenty of small restaurants in the surrounding area and close to the airport (about fifteen to twenty minutes cab ride. Our room was upgraded to a top floor suite and it was so comfortable. The bed was fabulous (best sleep I'd had all month) the airconditioning was invisible (quiet) but perfectly set, the bathroom was well appointed with a great shower, the view was excellent and the traffic noise not overwhelming. Free Wi-fi was a bonus and so was the two bottles of water provided every night at 'turn down'. The restaurant was wonderful. Great food, outside dining an option, even at breakfast, the staff were efficient, attentive, friendly and professional and we ate there every morning because of this and the ambience of the restaurant. Plus, the prices were reasonable. Check out time was 12 Noon but we weren't flying out until 11:30pm. No problem, they not only stored our luggage for us until 8:00pm, while we spent our last few hours doing the tourist thing, until we left for the airport, but also offered the use of their spa centre for us to have a shower, change our clothes and freshen up for the flight home, free of charge. This was the last week of our holiday and we couldn't have picked a better place to stay. I would reccommend this hotel to anyone who wan'ts a high class establishment, with excellent service and a helpful attitude at a more than reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, small rooms.”
Reviews.Author: bluelace
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my parents. The location is convenient 2 malls walking distance and a pharmacy. I made the reservation thru Jetsetter, good deals and you know in advance the hotel name but no cancellations. I booked a better room with a view of Hollywood Hills and the Hollywood sign. The room 811 was nice and pretty decent in size. The staff very courteous and attentive. I was walking by and I saw the regular rooms so tiny even for French standards. I don't recommend this hotel for families unless you booked a suite.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff/Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dborm1
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Sofitel was one of the highlights of our recent trip to West Hollywood/LA. I donâ€™t ever remember a more professional staff. The staff has helpful but not annoying. I was especially impressed at how courteous and organized the bellman/valet staff were, despite the busy conditions. The room was very nice with a spectacular view. We could even see the Hollywood sign when the sky was clear. The housekeeping staff was awesome and catered to our every need. Overall, great place to stay, great location!

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: Nwer
Reviews.Content: My parents came to visit me and my husband from our homecountry and decided to take a short trip to LA for a little sightseeing. The hotel was nice, but they only offered a valet parking, which I guess they could just add to the room fare since most people drive when they are in LA. Location was very nice, in front of Beverly Center, and about a 15 min drive to Hollywood on weekends. The staff was quite friendly, but at the time we checked in there was no one who spoke spanish, something were inconvinient if my parents had been traveling by themselves. We also wanted to ask if we could rent movies with spanish subtitles in the rooms and the concierge couldn't give us a clear answer, finally there was no movie for us. The rooms were clean, but some of them a little small for the price. We were in two different rooms, so we could tell that the service was not the same. They kept taking complimentary water to my parents, but my husband only got one bottle in two days. We were woke up at 8 am on sunday by the cleaning service, which was quite unpleasant, but I can't really complain about it since we didn't put the DND sing on the door. Overall it was all you can expect from the price you pay.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to fault”
Reviews.Author: GreedyIan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. I liked everything about it. I didn't have time to use pool or spa - but they looked good. All staff very friendly and helpful (as I would expect from a Sofitel). The rate I paid was also very good value (less than what a motel would cost in London). If I was to be very picky I prefer rooms with a bath (this only had a very large shower).

Reviews.Title: “Arrogant front desk staff, services not as offered/expected”
Reviews.Author: bambue
Reviews.Content: Our luggage was never brought to the storage as requested but kept in the lobby (for some time accessible to everybody, then behind a curtain). After complaining we were said it was our thought as they expected us to wait until our rooms is ready and luggage could be brought up to the room. What a nasty answer! Just to make sure, we had informed the front staff already before that we would leave for the Universal Studio right now. The carpets had stains. One can hear everything through the doors. Especially queen bed rooms look small but also the kings are not offering that what the price would make once expecting. The bath utilities were used and not replaced. After calling the service team, they changed immediately. In addition, we were offered Tea and Cookies by phone to excuse for their mistake - somebody should be sent up to the room directly. Just to make this clear, we never got any tea or cookies at all!!! We had dinner in the hotel restaurant. The service was very good but the food was lousy and not worth the price. I had Risotto â€“ as we come from Europe we know how Risotto should taste but it seems that the hotels high rated cook doesnâ€™t know it. The rise was cooked and then made thick with some binding agent. Thatâ€™s also how the Risotto tasted, like paper. The rooms are nice but you can go somewhere else. The neighborhood is not specially nice. Even we had booked mountain view, we got one room phasing the parking house next to the hotel. The hotel is - for US levels - expensive but does not at all convice and fullfill the level they promise. The hotel is close to Universal, La Brea Tar Pits and Beverly Hills.

Reviews.Title: “The best welcome back ever.”
Reviews.Author: alacson
Reviews.Content: I would like to congratulate you all on a very memorable weekend at Sofitel. The staff from start to end worked to their very best to make you feel welcome. My wife whome had a meeting at Cedars Sinai Hospital, felt at ease with the close proximity of your property. As for myself and our daughter we felt at home. A little background on myself, I used to work at your hotel 2001 - 2003 and during those times I've seen the big imporvements that was done since then. I never felt so at home to see some of the familiar faces and the great attitude of the new. I will never forget my time there and especially our time with my family now as we stayed there. I can count on everyone to once again make a mark on coming back to a familiar sight....family. Thank you again and we will sure let people know here at the central valley about our stay.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay!!”
Reviews.Author: kathleen896
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed The Sofitel! Rooms were large and comfortable.. Great mini bar, although overpriced.. Cute pool.. Limited seating.. Great service and wonderful bar/ lounge area.. very close to everything in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: LacySpikes
Reviews.Content: From the moment I pulled up to this hotel I was treated like a princess. The valet was very courteous, grabbed my bags and took them to the front desk, the lobby was so beautiful. The front desk staff was very friendly, check in was super fast. I got to my room and I had booked a room with a balcony which I did not get. I called the front desk and they apologized and could not change my room that night cause they were booked, and told me to call back in the morning. So the next day I went shopping and totally forgot to call them in the morning for a room change, but they remembered I went to my room and noticed all my things were gone , and I called downstairs and they had moved everything into my new room. Wow I didn't even remind them, they just did it. The room was pretty spacious, very comfy big bed, and the shower is very nice, you don't want to get out. I didn't eat in the restaurant , but I did order room service it came faster than expected and I will definitely recomend the caprese salad. YUM. I pretty much stopped in the bar everynight on my way out. The bar has a very nice atmosphere, well it's more of a nightclub than a bar. Definitely a hot spot in L.A. Drinks are a little pricey, but if you can afford the hotel than 14 bucks for a drink isn't that bad which is what you are going to pay in any trendy night club in L.A. If you are driving valet can take a minute, so my suggestion is calling down to the valet prior to leaving your room and your car will be ready for you as soon as you come down. Next time I am in L.A. I will definitely be staying at Sofitel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Sofitel LA is top of the line. Quiet, hip and all the amenities. Excellent exercise room and bar. Wonderful bed. The location is close to Melrose, Santa Monica Boulevard and the Beverly Center. Everything is very clean and modern. Top notch!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and comfort”
Reviews.Author: SFpol
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. Its upscale, yet the staff are not pretentious. The location is excellent. Room is very nice and comfortable - probably one of the best beds I have ever slept in. Windows keep out most of the outside noise - I think I maybe heard a siren or two, but that's it. And you didn't hear other guests at all. Bathroom is nice. Only complaints would be that they need to have better lighting....and its hard to use the small close-up mirror when its so high. Love the rain shower head - although be prepared for a shot of cold water when you turn it on...even if you do use the other nozzle at first. Gym is nice - brand new cardio and weight machines. I would have liked some more pilates type equipment - bands, foam rollers, etc - but overall, very nice. Will definitely be staying here again on my next trip to LA

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel close to shopping”
Reviews.Author: chippochic
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights with my 30 year old daughter. There was only one bed in the room albeit a King size but I found this odd for the US. Even when travelling with my partner 5 years ago across the US (Las Vegas and New York) 2 beds in the room was the norm. The room was nicely appointed but a little small and the curtain on window drew across about 2 foot into the room. Our flight from Australia arrived early morning and we had to wait until 3pm to check in. This made for a long day and we were extremely tired. The Beverly Centre is across the road. The pick up for the hop on hop off tour is also across the road. The Farmer's Market and The Grove are a few blocks away which we walked one day. (I don't recommend this unless you are fit) We didn't have a car and had no intention of driving on the other side of the road. Public transport does exist in LA and we caught the buses frequently. There was a charge for WiFi and no coffee in the room. There was coffee in the foyer but you had to get dressed, go down 6 floors to get it. There was free internet on 3 computers in the lobby and printing for free as well. This was useful for printing out our tour tickets and hotel confirmation in San Diego. The Sofitel is a really good hotel but when we returned from San Diego we chose to stay closer to Hollywood Boulevard within walking distance of the Hollywood and Highland area. (See review of Days Inn on Sunset)

Reviews.Title: “Felt like a VIP the whole time”
Reviews.Author: tter2
Reviews.Content: The first hotel I stayed at during my 3 month-long trip to the US last year. This place just oozes class. I managed to find a great deal on a Prestige Suite, which was still quite pricey, but worth every penny. Having arrived at LAX at like 6:30AM, I arrived at the Sofitel at around 8AM, and unsurprisingly, they did not have a room ready for me. That was fine, I didn't expect one to be, but they happily took my luggage and invited me to have breakfast in the hotel restaurant. I chose not to, but instead had a bit of a walk outside in the surrounding area. It's not the in the best or most convenient location, but it is located literally across the road from the Beverly Center - a large, VERY upscale shopping centre, which did not open until 10AM. I walked back to the hotel at around 11, and to my amazement, the room was ready. The man that took my luggage and showed me to my room was so excited for me that it was my first time in the States and that I was staying in such an awesome room. This put a smile on my face, that's for sure. The suite is split up into 3 rooms: the dining/living room; the bedroom; and the spacious bathroom. The suite contained two big HD LCD TVs, numerous couches (including a sofa bed) and places to relax, and an AMAZING King sized bed. I had read previous reviews that claimed sleeping on one of these beds was like sleeping amongst the clouds, and I have to say - they're right! I didn't want to get out of bed! The bathroom was incredible, especially for someone who has never stayed in a 4-5 star hotel before. The prestige suite contains a nice massive soaking bath - like a hot tub but without the jets, but the real star is the shower! The shower head is literally the size of a dinner plate, and you feel as if you're standing under a waterfall! I got room service on my first night there, and I all I can say is YUM. The food was delicious, very high standard restaurant-quality food. Another perk of staying in the suite: I could see the Hollywood Sign from my window/tiny balcony. That was awesome. My parents and sister stayed in a standard room about a month after I was there, and didn't have the same kind words to say about their stay. I'd say this means that there must be a clear and distinct difference in luxury between the standard rooms and the suites. If you're willing to splash the cash on a suite, you won't regret it... but with a standard room you might? Regardless, I had a fantastic stay at the Sofitel LA, and will definitely stay there again when I'm in LA next!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer60661
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really nice. It is located across from the Beverly Shopping Center and near Cedars Sinai Hospital. I enjoyed my stay at this hotel, my only complaint is that they charge for wireless. For a hotel that offers all the amenities, this seemed odd. Otherwise, I had a lovely stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: familyvacati0n2011 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised with our stay at Sofitel LA. The service was great, and we had a lovely meal at the inhouse restaurant. The rooms were spacious - we had booked a weekend deal that included an upgrade to a suite.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent - a great first-time experience in US hospitality”
Reviews.Author: jonezy27
Reviews.Content: Nothing seemed too hard for the Sofitel staff. The bell staff and consierge were both very friendly. Brilliant rooms and they tried hard to give us the best room available for our first trip to the US. The location is quite central to many of LA's sights, and there is a Hop-On Hop-Off tourist bus stop right out the front. It's about a $15 cab ride to Hollywood Blvd which is the tourist hub of LA. Of the 5 hotels we've stayed at in our time in the US, the Sofitel were the best all-round.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: LQUIROS
Reviews.Content: From being welcomed upon arrival, to checking in to the duration of my stay - everything was fantastic. During my upcoming trips to Los Angeles, the Sofitel will will be where I stay.

Reviews.Title: “We walked into our room and knew our vacation had started.”
Reviews.Author: hollister1
Reviews.Content: A friend of ours recommended the Sofitel specifically for their bed linens. And she was right. The bed with the milllion count thread linens was so comfortable. The hotel was convenient to the sightseeing attactions, but do not wallk, because nobody walks in LA!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly & Classy Unpretenious Comfort in Beverly Hills”
Reviews.Author: MadisonCowan
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by the welcoming & uber-friendly energy I immediately encountered upon exiting my car at Sofitel Beverly Hills. I was then greeted by the extremely courteous & professional reception staff & soon after check-in escorted to the lifts leading to my floor. My room was immaculately clean & inviting as well as spacious yet comfortable. I definitely recommend the Sofitel & will return on future business & pleasure trips to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Room and pool were awful”
Reviews.Author: Sunnymom2000
Reviews.Content: Save your time and $ - there are far better hotels in LA at that price point. Not sure how it was awarded a 4 1/2 star rating.... it deserves a 3 at best. Preface: I was a mom traveling alone with 2 kids. (we are a family of frequent travelers, and have been on many international and domestic trips in the past -- the kids have enjoyed the big city bright lights in places like SF, Vegas, Chicago... we often stay downtown to be able to walk out to things. Kids have enjoyed the action and excitement of a city. We were in LA for spring break. After spending a few days at Newport Beach going to Disney and getting in some beach time, we decided to drop off our car and spend 3 days in LA to visit the American Girl store and take a hop on hop off hollywood tour. We chose the Sofitel because of the great TA reviews and for its central location. We wanted a clean, comfy, somewhat modern place with a nice pool and easy access to the Grove. Service: Not much to rave about. We pulled into the front area in a cab - with all our baggage. 4 men stood around chatting while the kids and me lugged all the bags out of the cab ourselves. No one asked if we were checking in, nor if we needed any help. Check in: The check in process was smooth, and the manager was very helpful. He said that the double room we had booked would be small and he would look into accommodating us in a larger room. There were none available... since we needed 2 beds, we stuck with our initial room type. We were given a room on the 8th floor with the 'best' view for the 2 double room type. Room: It was the smallest room we had ever seen, other than a motel we once stayed in Flagstaff, AZ. The view was of a parking lot and a CVS -- drawing the curtains to block out the grey depressing sight, made the room feel even smaller. The bathroom did not provide a great deal of privacy, and had no ventilation system. Shower was a joke -- I am not a tall person, can't imagine a taller person showering. Windows could not be opened, making the room very stuffy. Comforter had a dead bug on it, when I called to report it they sent a new cover not a new comforter. The person who brought it up, did not appear to have clean hands, and walked all over the carpeted room in his shoes, to change the duvet cover (not sure why they did not just change the entire comforter). When he left the room, his shoes left behind a sticky black residue all over the carpet. It was gross. Pool: With such a small room, we thought we would be able to relax a little at the pool. It was a warm afternoon in LA. Well, the pool was at the very end of a long, dark hallway on the second floor. When we accessed the pool area, it took us a while to find the pool, as it involved climbing down a creaky fire escape to access. Not inviting to say the least. The pool was cold, no jacuzzi or hottub. The area around it was dirty and cramped, Not inviting at all, even on a warm LA afternoon. My kids are impossible to get out of a pool, and they did not want to spend any time in here. Since the room was too small and cramped to relax in, I suggested we spend a little time at the poolside. But it was too depressing to spend more than a few minutes out there. The shrubbery behind our deck chair was dusty, and I swear I heard 'rustling' in the bushes right behind my head. It was impossible to relax. How can a 4 star hotel get away with such a terrible poolside? Most best westerns have a better poolside. That was the deal breaker for me. I asked if they had reciprocal privileges at another hotel, and got a snooty sneer. Any jacuzzi tub on the premise? Another sneer - maybe it's not the french way, but this is CA - hot tubs are the norm! Concierge: The concierge looked at me strange when I mentioned that I didn't have a car with me (LA is a driving town). She was very inconvenienced when I asked questions about tours, transportation and dining - not a smile for me nor a hello for the kids. When we got back after dinner, and stopped at the front desk to ask if there was a larger room available, we were told that we could be upgraded to a presidential suite for an extra $800 per night. Who pays that much for a hotel without a decent pool? For half that price, we could be at the Four Seasons! To top it all, I did not get a good nights sleep as the bed was lumpy, and the room was airless. I awoke stiff and unrefreshed. We also felt nickled and dimed at every step - $9.95 for wifi -- per device -- so you either share your computer with your family/ partner, or pay per device! (makes it hard to plan your day); no in room coffee, nobody ever offered to hail us a cab. It was not the chic, zen, urban oasis we had hoped for. We checked out the next morning -- it wound up being a time consuming affair as we booked through expedia and needed to get the refund authorized from the hotel... expedia was very helpful though. I'm glad we made the effort, and we moved out to a hotel in Beverly Hills with a 31/2 star rating . Despite the lower star rating, we were given a much more spacious room, free wifi, the place has a beautiful pool and tennis court, free car service within 3 miles. For the same price of what we paid at the Sofitel, we were upgraded to a 1 BR suite. when we told the concierge we were going to the Grove, she said their car would take us as a complimentary service (turned out to be a Mercedes!), and we were driven out there in style -- just like one would hope for in LA! I use TA for all my travel planning, so wanted to get this out for all the expedia and TA users out there. My first review, and sadly for a hotel i did not enjoy at all. Not sure why this place is so highy rated and reviewed. People might have a better experience if they were upgraded to a better room, but that pool is scary. Not in keeping with a four and a half star rating. Not sure if I will try the Sofitel brand again. I love France and LA, but this place did neither justice. No So Cal hospitality, no French class. Only bright side was the friendly manager who did try his best to help out.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: edupc
Reviews.Content: Very well located, very very friendly staff, Nice restaurant. The only problem in my room (#744) was the noise from the bar.

Reviews.Title: “The best the best the best !!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: joellevynyc
Reviews.Content: Best place to stay while in la !! Service from the time you arrive to when you are going back to the hotel after a long day of business or shopping could not be better !! The staff is very warm , friendly and helpful and very profesional and go out of there way to accommodate what ever you ask! I travel a lot and stay at many hotels but this place by far has the best service and cleanest rooms and BEST STAFF!!! I can't wait to go back to la and stay here again ! Next time this will be on pleasure with my wife and children !! Joel levy april 2011 golden touch imports planet gold !!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BekeleyVisitorCenter
Reviews.Content: First time staying at a Sofitel property. Being an ex-hotelier, I am very observant when it comes down to service, cleanliness and guest satisfaction. The desk clerks, room service waiter, bartender and bellman were all very friendly and seemed to really enjoy their jobs. I don't remember staying at a hotel that had such a memorable staff. My room was wonderfu with a bathroom to die for (which is very important to me, a femalel traveler). Even though our event was a taxi ride from the hotel, having the Beverly Center mall across the street and several great restaurants within walking distance was a real plus. i will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but loud”
Reviews.Author: o-m-j-p
Reviews.Content: Although the rooms were nice and had one of the comfiest beds I've ever been in, the adjacent school and access road made the rooms loud. This was mainly at 6am and 11:30 when the bins were emptied. Also the wait for the car from the valet was always around 10 mins. For the extra price a night for the parking I expected better. The gym was very good too. Some very good points but some to work on.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay in West Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: bobzelin
Reviews.Content: I am in LA every year, and this is the best hotel I have ever stayed at in West Hollywood, including all the famous ones on Sunset Blvd. As for the insane negative reviews that you may see - 1) the staff is incredibly polite. No one was EVER snotty or ignored us. Everyone went out of their way to help us. 2) this is not a hotel for children. If you have lots of kids, go to Disneyland, not a hot, beautiful, trendy hotel, that caters to professionals. 3) it is very easy to find your room, the elevators, and everything else. The hotel is very easy to navigate 4) this hotel is opposite Cedar Sinai hospital. You hear sirens thru the windows, because this is a major city, right in the middle of "all the action", including the hospital. You pick a wonderful hotel like this, because it is NOT in a rural area, but near all the great shopping and restaurants. 5) was parking expensive - sure it was, but so is every other hotel and restaurant valet in LA I actually don't know how they could improve this hotel. My stay was perfect, and I will surely return.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: dkn1989
Reviews.Content: The staff was very courteous and helpful. The hotel room was amazing. Breakfast in bed is definitely worth it. I can't wait until my next stay there!

Reviews.Title: “perfect for Cedars Sinai”
Reviews.Author: psprings
Reviews.Content: Stayed last minute with family member with health emergency at Cedars Sinai across the street. The small suite worked perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: RodrigoMex
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable rooms, and nice decor. One of the best health centers, witha really nice pool. The restaurant is very well decorated in modren style with beautiful outdoors furniture, really outstanding. It is great to have breakfast out there!!

Reviews.Title: “Great modern hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: sbmaureen
Reviews.Content: I made a one day trip to Los Angeles with my 20 year old daughter for an appointment at Cedars Sinai. We chose the Sofitel for it's proximity to both Cedars and the Beverly Center. I loved the hotel. It was clean and modern and gave us great service. I used Expedia to book and the check in was quick, they had all of the correct information which isn't always the case when using online booking sites. The staff was so friendly and helpful and great at anticipating your needs. Gym was up to date and very clean and well stocked. Pool area is lovely, though loud as you might expect on a very busy street but so pretty. My only complaint is that the platform bed was a little hard.

Reviews.Title: “Very Chic!”
Reviews.Author: lnrogers1220
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel, awesome location and great customer service. The Lounge next to the lobby is very nice and we had a great time Saturday night! I was expecting a bit more from the rooms, really average and the toilet kept backing up. Other than that I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: stephparisoli
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here many times and always enjoyed my stay. They have the best Hotel Health Club in Los Angeles. They have a fabulous hostess in the restaurant too which is always welcoming during breakfast. Def. give it a try!

Reviews.Title: “Staggeringly good!”
Reviews.Author: Mungo888
Reviews.Content: This is an absolutely incredible hotel. Very modern and really eye catching.
