We had an offer to upgrade to junior suites - brilliant rooms with a (distant ) view of the Hollywood sign. The bathroom was excellent and the shower superb. Spotelssly clean everywhere. The hotel had a very very cool feel to it. Very modern decor. It is opposite the Beverly Centre and lots of local food nearby. If you stay here - check out the Concierge desk - wow!! Excellent and huge gym. Didn't eat here - so cant comment on food. Free iMacs to use in the Lobby! Staff and service very impressive. Parking a bit expensive but valet system worked really well. One of the best hotels ever - just really good fun. Heartily recommend and a definite for a return trip. Would not consider anything else.

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything about it!”
Reviews.Author: gamecocks2ucla1
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at The Sofitel. I had driven by it on previous trips to LA and thought that it would be a great location to stay in on a future trip so I decided to stay there on this particular trip. I made a wonderful decision. The location of the hotel is perfect as it's location is convenient to Beverly Hills, Hollywood, West Hollywood, and even LAX as it's a straight trip on LaCienega from LAX to the hotel. It's also very convenient to the freeway system. The room was very comfortable, the bathroom and shower were particularly AWESOME! The bed slept very well and I had a great view of the Hollywood sign and Hollywood Hills from my room. SimonLA is an excellent restaurant as well. I enjoyed breakfast there on three of the mornings that I stayed in the hotel. I also enjoy the bar and the atmosphere of it as well as it's an inside and an outside bar. Overall this hotel get an A from this traveler. The only criticism was in room internet was not free. I travel from the east coast to the west coast at least twice a year and will certainly stay at The Sofitel again. For shoppers out there, it's directly across the street from the Beverly Center so that's another major convenience. The staff at the front desk, the concierge, and the valet/doormen were also extremely accomodating to me while I was there. I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent contemporary hotel”
Reviews.Author: rjmartintx
Reviews.Content: We had booked a room at PaliHouse, but our room was taken out of service due to a broken pipe. Fortunately, PaliHouse took the initiative of booking us at Sofitel for the same room rate and paid for a taxi for us to transfer there. We were not familiar with Sofitel hotels, but were quite impressed with this one. It is very contemporary in style and white-glove clean. They placed us in one of the deluxe rooms on the third floor that has a private outdoor patio with two chairs and a table. Although the room (341) was not huge, it was very comfortable. The bath felt larger due to the large picture window in the shower, looking into the room toward the tv or the patio, that is electronically controlled to be opaque or clear, depending on the wall switch setting. Cool! Breakfast at the hotel restaurant was superb. They start the meal with a complimentary glass of a fruit smoothie and bread basket. For $9.00, they served a fine American eggs/sausage breakfast. Very good value in a day when most hotels seem to gouge you with high breakfast prices. Service by the receptionist, bellman, and restaurant servers was very friendly and helpful. We'll probably stay here on our next trip, even though PaliHouse compted us two night for our trouble. Cudo's to both hotels. (Just wish Sofitel provided free internet rather than charge $10 daily, which explains my slight mark-down on Value.)

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: dmgirl66
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here at the tail-end of a month long journey through australia and new zealand. We booked through priceline and got a great rate for this hotel and were happy for it. The rooms were clean, modern, trendy. The bed was super comortable. Despite being on a main road, noise was at a minimum. The shower and bathroom were beautiful. We did have a problem with a light that didn't turn off and it was promptly fixed within 5 hours. The concierge desk was very helpful in helping us plan our trip. LA is a culture reliant on using a car or taxi's. We preferred to walk and found that many places did not take long to walk to: melrose avenue, the grove/farmer's market, and rodeo drive. All within a 45 minute walk. The Beverly Centre was right across the street. We did take the bus to Santa Monica and did take us a while but was a great experience. The taxi from the airport was around $45. The staff were great and the gym and swimming pool were wonderful. In fact the gym had better equipment (and lots of it) then most gyms you pay for. I would highly recommend this accomodation for a very comfortable safe stay in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: Manuel-London11
Reviews.Content: Fantastic room (10th floor) with great views. Room service excellent, change towels twice a day, very polite and helpful staff. Location is good and plenty of nice cafes and restaurants around. Gym very well maintained and nice pool

Reviews.Title: “Great location, value & decor”
Reviews.Author: AlanKey
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd visit to this Sofitel and once again was a great experience. Friendly & helpful staff, fabulous suite and great location for shopping & restaurants make it perfect for work & leisure.

Reviews.Title: “sofiHELL”
Reviews.Author: Albert323
Reviews.Content: For the first time in five years of being married (with kids) my wife and I decided to take a get-away vacation for our anniversary. Although a family member volunteered to watch the kids we did not want to travel far so we looked to book a nearby hotel for some R&R. The Sofitel is five minutes from my house so it seemed like a wonderful option. Jetsetter was having a sale on rooms at the Sofitel but suites were not available, so wanting to splurge (our first time away-alone) we used hotels.com and got the Opera King Suite for twice the price of a regular room on Jetsetter. We arrived for our two day get away at the hotel and we were greeted by a friendly receptionist who began checking us in. He then called over the manager and without saying anything pointed to the screen. The manager (M.) then pointed elsewhere on the screen and the receptionist replied "But..." and pointed again to the screen to emphasize his point. The manager simply replied "Over there" and once again pointed to the screen. Not being a complete idiot I began to realize there must be an issue with our reservation and asked if something is wrong but was assured that my reservation is "in order." The manager walked away and the receptionist asked if we've ever stayed in the hotel to which I replied "no". He then sent us up to "our" room which, as I suspected, was not a suite and was a regular room which I could have reserved for half the price on Jetsetter that very day (no tub no balcony etc.) But the cleaning service did make sure to forget a dirty rag on the coffee table (I snapped a few pics of that too.) It was now clear to me what had transpired and what all the screen pointing was about: all suites were booked and the receptionist asked if we've ever stayed there before hoping I wouldn't notice that the 300sqft room he sent us to was not 800+ sq ft nor was it a suite- perhaps he crossed his fingers hoping I would mistake the sink for a small "soaking tub". I called down and said I was not sent to the room I reserved. To which the receptionist replied "I'm so sorry but all our suites are booked out". I said that is fine but I do not appreciate being treated like an idiot and perhaps you could have told me that before confirming that my reservation was "in order". I then asked for someone to come up and get our bags so I could check out and get a refund and go down a few blocks to The London (great hotel!!). He apologized profusely and asked for ten minutes to try and straighten it out. We waited anxiously to hear back as we had a dinner reservation we had to make a week in advance (valentines day). A half-hr later we were escorted by the manger (M.) to a room that "should be to your satisfaction". We were brought into a suite (room #1002 which they insist is an opera king suite but if these pictures are correct it most certainly wasn't http://www.oyster.com/los-angeles/hotels/sofitel-los-angeles/photos/opera-suite/). As we were in a rush to make our reservation we agreed to stay in the suite we were shown to. As the manger left and we put down our bags I noticed the room was filthy, pieces of bread and plastic around the bed and a sticky substance all over the marble floor. I called the manager again and said the suite you showed us to is filthy to which he again began profusely apologizing. He said he would send up room service asap and asked if we would accept free parking on account of our experience. As my wife felt bad that I was so disappointed she urged me to accept and to leave asap so we could make our reservation. We missed our reservation. Aside for a malfunctioning shade and a really PATHETIC SHOWER (an actual rain-shower has more pressure) the rest of our stay was without incident. As we checked out I was presented with a bill which (you guessed it!) included parking as well. Being in a rush to get back to the kids I paid it, planning on calling for a refund. First I called hotels.com and was told by the rep I have to call Sofitel and that there is nothing they could do. I then called Sofitel and asked to speak with a manger and was put in touch with a lady from Accor (sofitel's parent) who apologized profusely and assured me I would receive a call back asap. Over a week went by and I did not hear back so I called Accor directly and spoke to the global reservation desk and with a lady (J.) who again apologized for the lack of response and assured me once again I would hear back asap. Nothing. Dear hotel patrons - if you are considering Sofitel for you LA stay you might want to consider a Motel 6 unless S&M is your thing. Dear business owners: As a business owner myself I always appreciate when a customer gives me the opportunity to fix an issue before posting negative reviews. And that is precisely what I did in this instance. Please read the above as a lesson in how not to conduct your customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and rooms but noisy on street side.”
Reviews.Author: Ecube
Reviews.Content: Spent one night with breakfast included. Breakfast was great as you could order of menu. Valet parking was required but very effiecient. Across the street from a huge mall with great stores and nice restaurants near by. Beds were very comfortable and the bathroom had excellent shower. Room had 32 in flat screen with lots of channels. Only complaint...if you are facing the street it is noisy, even on the 9th floor. Service was first rate and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Sofitel standard.”
Reviews.Author: FlyingSomewhere
Reviews.Content: We were going to stay at the Luxe, but it was fully booked. As an A|Club Platinum member, I was extremely disappointed with this Hotel, and would never recommend it.. on arrival (in a taxi), we were totally ignored by the bellmen, standing in the driveway talking to each other. One did tell me that most of their guests use limo services ! When we left the hotel, one bellman quite disinterestedly asked me if I was waiting for something (obviously).. I said yes, a car to go to the airport.. he walked off.. my husband then spoke to him and said we had a limo booked, and he took more interest.. After we checked in, one came up and asked if we needed any help. I told him that we had managed to get 4 cases out of the taxi on our own, so would get to our room... we were not given any special service on check-in or later. I asked if we could have a late check-out, and was told till 4pm only. I offered to pay a half-day rate if we could stay till 8pm, but was told no. Another guest I spoke to paid far less than us, and got a 4pm check out easily.. and wasn't an A|Club member. The room (apparently an upgrade) was a weird shape, very little space for suitcases, and no bath. I asked for a kettle and 2 cups, the kettle came (tip given), no cups. I had to call again, cups came (another tip). Paying $10/day for internet access is outrageous - and that's if it works. The sofitel hotel compendiums all refer to an internet service that is NO longer used by any of them. When I tried to connect and couldn't, I called the number provided and was told that they no longer provided support or a service to Sofitel Hotels. (2 of the 3 computers in the Business Centre required a password, and one mouse needed replacing.) I wasn't given the complimentary drink voucher, nor a welcome gift until I asked about them - then the staff person told my VIP status wasn't flagged, which was strange considering that I put it in the booking. The noise in the restaurant and bar was so loud that we left dinner early = it was also almost impossible to read the menu in the restaurant, or hear the wait staff. Our room was quiet - the only plus. On the afternoon we were due to leave, the phone rang around 3.15pm, but nobody answered me. When we did leave 3 staff were sitting in the corridor outside the room. We stayed here after 2 other sofitels - and LA Sofitel just doesn't compare with, eg, Washington, where each time we walked up to Reception, we were greeted by name, and the bellmen and concierge staff also greeted us by name, and always greeted us.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: NJMCW
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this oddly located hotel and checked in easy enough. I asked for a high floor and something close to an elevator. We received 3rd floor (hardly high) and so far away from the elevator that I needed a Sherpa to find the room. I could tell right away it was going to be one of "Those" stays. The room was weirdly shaped and small. The was a window above the bed that overlooked the shower, so that we you were taking a shower you had that "Peepshow" experience. Nice. There was a knob on the wall next to the toilet which I thought was odd and didn't seem to do anything, until I found out later that night it went to a speaker under the bathroom vanity which was hooked up to the TV. I don't know about you, but I don't need to hear the TV audio THAT bad. We also had a lovely view of a roof top and giant tree which completely blocked any type of view. If you squinted and used a telescope you might be able to see the Hollywood sign. When it was time to leave and we were more than ready, we used the in room check out only to find that they charged us $32.00 per day for Valet parking. Now seeing as they don't offer and even suggest any other alternative, nor do they tell you about the charge, I find it pure robbery. Coming from Vegas were you can Valet your car at the Dentist for a dollar or two, this was inexcusable. At least tell people that you are charging this, don't let it be a surprise. We also called for a bellman that never arrived. All in all, worst stay at a supposed luxury hotel ever.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel all round!”
Reviews.Author: TheTravellingChooks
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the Hotel in 2 rooms which I reserved and paid for in advance on their website. Our King Bed room was spacious with huge windows with a view of the Hollywood Hills and the Hollywood sign. Our children's room was a 2 bed room with a view of The Beverly Centre on the other side of the Hotel. There were no issues with noise in either room. The rooms were well appointed and the bathrooms were clean with everything you need..robes,slippers etc and L'occitane products. Big shower and spotlessly clean. The service of all staff was exceptional despite the hotel being 100 % full. We only ate breakfast in the hotel and it was delicious with complimentary croissant and brioche. There was a massive gym and pleasant pool area but we were there to shop and eat and the location was perfect. Beverly Centre across the road,3rd Avenue shops and restaurants and only minutes by cab to The Grove,Hollywood and Beverly Hills. There was free wifi on 3 apple macs in the lobby which was incredibly convenient and the Concierge was so helpful. I only tipped a few times to doormen,bellboy and concierge.There appeared to be no expectation just really great service. We will definitely stay there again when in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Be aware they charge your credit card five days after stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed you pre pay account 6 months in advance. Total stuff up. Then when u settle your account in full they charge your credit card five days after leaving and when u call they have no records of the transactions very disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Probably the worst Sofitel on the planet”
Reviews.Author: TravelbradBrisbane
Reviews.Content: This is the worst Sofitel I have stayed in, I am a platinum Sofitel customer so I have stayed in a lot of them, this hotel offers nothing special, the service is bad, the rooms are awkward with poor Airconditioning, the showers are a joke

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service at its finest...a lovely stay.”
Reviews.Author: nycreba
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sofitel Los Angeles while in town for a friend's wedding - they had reserved rooms at a very reasonable rate at the hotel. The line was long for check in at the front desk but the staff was very efficient, appropriately apologetic and very welcoming. Wedding gift bag in tow, we headed to the elevators through a very nicely appointed lobby: modern and sleek but not cold and formal. Up the room - which smelled like old baby diapers. As in, probably the guests before us had stayed there with a small child and since the windows don't open, even after a proper cleaning, the odor lingered. It was impossible to ignore, so we called down to the desk. Matthew answered, we explained the situation, and he told us to stay put...housekeeping would come up to "deal with it" and he'd look for another room for us. WIthin 10 minutes, housekeeping came up and asked what the problem was. Oddly, he couldn't smell anything but since we were already waiting for a new room, he poked around and then left. Moments later, another of the staff came up with new room keys and many apologies. He wrinkled his nose and said "I see what you mean" and we headed out. Upstairs two floors to the exact room without the smell (ahhh!), and we settled right in. Reason for pointing this out? Hotels handle things like this in many different ways, and the staff at the Sofitel was efficient, gracious, and extremely accommodating. What could have been a headache was merely a small bump in the checking in process. The rest of our stay was delightfully uncomplicated. Important things worked: wonderful water pressure, soft bed (but not too soft!) with luxurious linens, products from l'occitane in the bathroom (yum) and a lovely view of the hills. Didn't hear any hallway noise, the elevators came in a timely fashion, and our car, when retrieved from valet, appeared in a very reasonable amount of time. The fitness center is very well laid out with ample equipment, soft towels (not the usual gym scratchy variety!) and complimentary water and fresh fruit. There is free internet access in the lobby with a printer that works - another bonus. WIthout the option to rate 4-1/2 stars, I'm giving this hotel 4, but only because they charge $10/day for in room wifi which, in this day and age, seems somewhat unreasonale. Cable is free - why not the web? Additionally, the rooms aren't well laid out to handle luggage (no valet in the closet) and therefore our stuff was everywhere and that was a bit of a nuisance. Really, though, a 5 star stay in many respects, most noteably due to the outstanding service from the bellmen to the housekeeping staff to the front desk. Would highly recommend. Plus, lest I forget, the location can't be beat. We walked to the Farmers Market, Rodeo Drive, and shopping all along Melrose. Very well situated.

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed my stay here and I am a bit fussy.”
Reviews.Author: misskeys78
Reviews.Content: The Beverley Hills Sofitel was our first hotel of many during our trip across the USA. I haven't stayed in any other Beverley Hills hotels and this is the only time I have visited LA, so I'm not sure what is standard, but I got the impression BH could be expensive hotelling. The lobby was funky and modern and the staff were friendly and helpful, a relief after 22 hours of flying! We booked and stayed in the standard 'Superior Room'. I felt our room was well appointed (hairdryer was average though), clean. well maintained and had a good layout The room was not huge but a good size for two with a heap of luggage. The traffic was noisy along Beverley Blvd so if you're a light sleeper I would recommend asking for the quietest room if possible. I got booked the room over the web on a special, and felt we got good value for money. The breakfast was outstanding in the resturant downstairs, as were the wait staff. The bar downstairs (not owned or run by the Sofitel) was fabulous on the Saturday night with a lovely waitress who was very friendly and helpful and chatted to us for some time about travelling around different parts of the USA. One thing perhaps worth mentioning there was an extremely unhappy guest who was a sofitel member and had specifically asked for a certain room and was not given it. He was quite diplomatic about it to begin with yet the front desk person was very unhelpful with his request. We overheard all of this because the guest and the person on the front desk were yelling at each other by the end of the conversation. I felt the staff member handled this very badly and it shouldn't have got to a point where everyone in the lobby heard the details of the issue! So if you have any special requirements I suggest you get it in writing and make it very clear to them. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel, and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Edy16
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with prime location. Located next to shopping mall/cinema where you can loose yourself in shopping then eat in one of many restaurants (especially I would recommend the Chinese restaurant next to parking entrance) and watch movie in cinema. Staff is very professional and can't do enough for you. Its a a small hotel but very comfortable and elegant. Rooms are small but nicely decorated. Swimming pool area clean, exclusively decorated with comfortable sits, small pool but just enough for afternoon dip (you can always go to Venice beach which is not far away). You can have a drink by the pool and watch sun set.... very romantic. There is also a small club downstairs, which comes to life in evening, nice crowd, classy. We had a nice time.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but noisy”
Reviews.Author: MMa08
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel because usually sofitel provides comfortable rooms where you can sleep well. However after a 12 hours flight we found a room with the usual comfortable sofitel layout but with very poor noise insulation. This is not what I expect from a hotel in this price class. Location, breakfeast and other services were very good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice start”
Reviews.Author: BrissieTraveller83
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. We stayed in a Luxury King and it was just great. Besides an inital problem of being checked into a room and then going upstairs to find a lady asleep in the bed (not Goldylocks), we were then givenour new room some 5 hours later. Other then that, the hotel is very nice and the restaurant downstairs offers a great breakfast. Location is good, the shopping centre across the road is very dated and nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Rude, arrogant staff. Extremely disappointed with the service for the price we paid for. Not worth it at all”
Reviews.Author: AussieMelb2
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel because we've had positive experience staying at other Sofitel hotels. We arrived after a long 14-hour flight and weren't greeted by any friendly smiles. The bellboy didn't assist us with our luggage and check-in staff was rude and arrogant. I'm a platinum A-club member and yet the service I received and when asked about the possibility of an upgrade (that is something I'm entitled to with my membership), the response I got was "did you request for it?" Well, it is stated that upgrade is available upon request when checking-in. I didn't have to request prior to my arrival. Anyway, was asked to wait for about 2-3 hours before I could check-in at about 1pm. Was assigned a city view room which was extremely noisy. So, requested for a room in the hills which was quieter but had to wait for another 1-2 hours. We told them we were happy to wait before receiving a call about 10minutes later that there was a standard room available. We took that eventhough it was a standard room because we were tired. On the next day, when we went to the concierge to enquire about different ways to get to Anaheim (Disneyland) from the hotel, we were told to catch a taxi which would have cost approximately $120/way. We then asked if there were any trains that go there. The response we got from the concierge, in a rude and annoyed manner, was "you can waste your time!" Honestly, I think that was unreasonable and rude. He could have said "there is a train that goes out there but it will take much longer." We managed to find a cheaper and fairly convenient way to get to Anaheim after speaking to a representative at the tourist information centre. We took a taxi to a bus stop and it only cost us $40/way eventhough the journey was an hour longer. However, we managed to see the outskirts of LA. Concierge also didn't know much about day tours and had to go around to look for brochures, etc. Come on, aren't queries about local attractions and day tours frequently asked questions? Please do not book day tours from the concierge. It is much more expensive than booking it directly from the tour operator at the Chinese Theatre. We were told by the tour operator that the hotel gets a cut off it! When checking-out, the two reception staff were chatting as I walked up to them. They saw me walking up but continued chatting until about 5 seconds after I got to the desk. I was then given a bill that was $60 more than it should have been. I queried it and she checked the system before giving me the correct bill without apologising. There weren't coffee/tea or even kettle in the bedroom either. It was only available upon request. Nonetheless, despite the cost we paid (just a little over USD300/night), the beds were comfortable. Personally, I wouldn't recommend this hotel to ANYONE!

Reviews.Title: “Confirm before booking your room has been soundproofed - or don't forget your earplugs!”
Reviews.Author: Coffee4Kate
Reviews.Content: After 2 weeks of great stays with Sofitel hotels on the East Coast, we had a very mixed experience at the Sofitel Los Angeles. I booked a luxury room based on Trip Advisor reviews and learning it had recently been refurbished. The hotel is located across from the Beverly Centre and reasonably close to other great shopping in Beverly Hills. The central location coupled with the non-existent sound proofing of the rooms leads to one HUGE problem - exceptionally high levels of road noise. The cute juliette balcony doors of our luxury room faced Beverly Boulevard and amazingly were just standard, single glazed windows. We ended up sleeping with earplugs in attempt to block out the traffic noise. The next morning we spoke with reception to arrange a room change. They didn't seem surprised that the noise was a problem and were more than happy to move us to a room on the other side of the building. They advised us they were in the process of soundproofing the rooms. After heading out for the day we returned to the hotel at 6pm to be informed the room was not ready and that we were welcome to head back to the old room until our new room was available. The other services at the hotel were mixed. The fitness centre is huge and has a great range of equipment, however it didn't appear to be cleaned regularly and supplies of towels/water had not been replenished. Room service was prompt & friendly and the quality of the meal was of a high standard - try the mac and cheese! Would we recommend or stay here again? Yes - providing the hotel can confirm the room had been soundproofed!!

Reviews.Title: “Does the small things very well”
Reviews.Author: spiderpig01
Reviews.Content: This is an incredibly high quality hotel. The location is fine for LA. The lobby is magnificent. We stayed on the ninth floor in a King room. The room was large, spacious but unfortunately the floor was not clean - still had bits of stuff unvacuumed. The bathroom was outstanding - clean, extremely well equipped, rainshower, robes, L'Occitane toiletries. The bed was a sofitel type bed - very comfortable. Nice furnishings completely opposite to a "mass produced" style. The concierge was excellent. Although the hotel endorsed 2 tour groups - Starline and LA Tours, she correctly told us to go with LA Tours. She was proven correct when we went on a Starline shuttle to Universal the following day which was a joke. Steer clear of them. Went on an LA Tours city tour the day after - very good. The gym was complimentary and the most impressive of the numerous hotels we stayed in through the US. Comprehensive free weight collection, machines and exercise machines. Of all the places we stayed, the Sofitel just had all the small but important things ticked off. Also opposite is a large shopping center also a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Family-Friendly Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: popfab
Reviews.Content: First, be aware that if you book through Hotwire, you end up paying approximately the same price as you would if you were to book their "Family Maqnifique" via their website. And for the $20 you save (over a four day trip), it is absolutely not worth it for the attitude they give you! It is certainly worth it to book directly with the hotel. Dina, their customer service manager, was as arrogant and pretentious as I've ever encountered. It literally took hours on the phone before she would acquiesce to the same family package as stated in their website package. At one point, I wondered if I was speaking to a live person or simply an automated line. Finally--and only after I was forced to be in touch with hotel management--Dina "guaranteed" that we would be offered the family package with FREE BREAKFAST for the children. Upon check-in, I was told that it was "no problem...your breakfast charges will be credited at checkout." Of course, I was never told that breakfast only included 5 items, i.e., "Captain Crunch cereal," with no beverage, and that it had to be in the restaurant. Also, be aware that the "wireless package" that is supposedly included is actually $40 per week. Then, when I attempted to log on the next day, I had to pay an additional daily rate of $10. If you end up staying here (and I don't recommend it!), you must scrutinize every charge on your bill! I've never had the experience that I had yesterday where I had to question nearly 50% of the charges, and then they had to print out multiple corrections. Even then, I still have notes to speak to "Dina" about several charges that she promised would not be charged. Now I have no choice but to dispute the charges via my credit card. This hotel is certainly the coldest, most impersonal hotel we've stayed at in quite a long time. Also, be very aware that this is NOT a family-friendly hotel AT ALL. It is a very adult atmosphere and not at all appropriate for even young teens. Even though we were on a higher floor, the pounding music from the lounge on Friday night kept us all awake. There are many wonderful hotels in the area. We travel to LA several times each year, and certainly will never stay in the Hotel Sofitel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very upmarket”
Reviews.Author: dione22
Reviews.Content: The hotel is magnificent, and everything is perfect, but found the location a bit far away from everything Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Sa3ooD
Reviews.Content: Was a bit skeptical about the hotel after reading reviews, but turns out it's a great hotel at a great location, just facing the beverly mall and close to everything if you have a car. Has free internet by the lobby and concierge was very helpful in assisting us and recommending restaurants. Going back this year and booked it right away without even searching for other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kinnya
Reviews.Content: First time in Sofitel and was not what to expect but its a great hotel and very functional and not trendy for the sake of it. The rooms are not huge but big enough with good bathroom and comfy bed! The restaurant is good, and its a very busy restaurant but the service is quick and very good The hotel is across the street from Beverly Centre that is shopping mall and the bar is lively and has great bar. Would stay here again for sure

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Great Gym”
Reviews.Author: Travelaroundoften
Reviews.Content: The best gym I've ever experienced in a hotel. Good location and great rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for shoppers”
Reviews.Author: Annabellllll
Reviews.Content: Pros: Nicely decorated rooms, great bathrooms, excellent service, pretty central, great bar Cons: no self-parking, valet compulsory (very expensive), no free access to internet in rooms (alghough there are 2/3 computers down in lobby free of access), size of rooms a little too small for those prices

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent. Highley recommended”
Reviews.Author: kitseng
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was top notch. The location is outstanding, right in the heart of West Hollywood. The rooms are 'cozy' but they are well appointed with very nice showers, nice bath products (l'Occitane). I stayed on the 9th floor (out of 10) with a bad view of the Beverly Center which was expected as I booked on Hotwire and paid $170 for a Saturday night.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy, clean and central”
Reviews.Author: Roadiebodie
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing, we were based in central Beverley Hills and was excellent for shopping at the beverley centre. The hotel was clean and modern and the staff and concierge were very helpful. The bed was extremely comfortable and the bathroom was lovely. Overall we had a great stay and wished we could have stayed for longer. Excellent value for money! This hotel also offers free internet and has a great gym with an outdoor pool on the roof.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely option in Beverly Hills”
Reviews.Author: thelivingjuj
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel Beverly Hills was delightful, top to bottom. An initial problem with a smoke-infested room was resolved immediately and without a bit of fuss by the very helpful (and apparently all-male) staff. My only small personal gripe was that the beds were firmer than a typical Westin or Four Seasons bed - but if you like that type of bed, so much the better.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Staying at the Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: WannaDiscover
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our stay here. The service from every facet within the hotel was always top-notch. We had an ultra-clean room with floor to ceiling windows looking toward the Beverly Centre. The room included a very comfortable bed, desk/chair, large TV, large closet (with a safe, ironing amenities and plenty of hangers), mini-bar and a lovely walk in tiled shower with a large rainshower fixture as well as a handheld spray. There were fresh white bathrobes in the room. Being on the 7th floor, we found our room was ultra-quiet and comfortable. We had a very restful sleep. The Bose sound system instead of a usual chintzy $8 alarm clock radio was soothing and having TV or radio sound piped in to the washroom was great. The location was excellent for us, within walking distance to many places. The CVS Pharmacy kiddie-corner to the hotel proved very, very handy. We enjoyed the fun of the Hop-On-Bus that stops at the Beverly Centre. At $35 per person for a 24 hour pass, we were able to cram a lot of sightseeing in our short stay. Although we didn't frequent the hotel club or restaurant for lunch or dinner, we made use of the daily Breakfast at LA Simon restaurant, beautifully appointed we might add. If that experience was any indication, maybe we should have gone for Dinner there! The breakfasts were very impressive and well presented with incredibly personalized service (the wait staff remembered where we were from and took time to ask us about our travels and stay). The corned beef hash was incredible and very popular. The complimentary berry smoothy shooters from the Chef, as well as the basket of pastries with fresh honey and jams were a nice touch. The weather was cool and drizzly, so we did not get to enjoy the outdoor patio, but did take a tour outside and would have loved to enjoy it had the weather been more co-operative. All in all, we very much enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Sofitel and would definitely go back. The service was impeccable and the location was perfect for shopping and sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: rigachop
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel Los Angeles during our vacation in May 2010. Even though our room was at the back, the view was great. Breakfast is excellent and stuff very polite. The decor is trendy and bathroom big enough something we appreciated. The hotel is walking distance from La Cienega Blvd, Melrose Blvd , Santa Monica Blvd and Sunset. Beverly Center shopping mall is right across the street. Convenient location for visits to the Farmers Market and Beverly Hills in a safe neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: suesilv
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel make you feel like you are the only one staying there. Everyone, from the concierge to the guy getting our car, was friendly, warm, caring and helpful. The room was beautiful- we were somehow upgraded before we arrived- and the amenities were great. Slept really well even though the hotel is in a busy area of West Hollywood. Found the location provided easy access to some great restaurants and pretty central to our needs. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lap of Luxury....5 Stars!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LeeLee2100
Reviews.Content: If you want to feel like a movie star....stay at the Sofitel in Los Angeles (very close to Beverly Hills). 5 STARS!!!!! It looks like you are staying overnight in a museum. ~You arrive to a very friendly Valet attendant ~You walk into the over-the-top exquisite lobby (includes a bar owned by Cindy Crawford's husband) ~Simple, fast, friendly check-in process ~Front desk representative walked us to the elevator...great service ~When we walked into our beautiful room...we were BLOWN-AWAY Museum quality art, only the highest quality finishings, Huge flat-screen TV, amazing view of the hills, best bathroom/ rain-shower we have EVER used, Comfortable bed & bedding, everything seemed brand new ~Room service was friendly & efficient. Food was very good and not over-priced. ~Check-out process was fast & easy. (Except, we didn't want to leave.) No complaints...not one...and I am a VERY picky person. This company gets it. They know how to run a hotel. We loved every minute!!!

Reviews.Title: “More style than substance but great beds”
Reviews.Author: holidayqueen36
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights with a friend on a girls shopping trip to LA. Front entrance has four or five staff on arrival but they are more interested in parking cars than helping guests in and out of the hotel with luggage. Likewise we walked across the road to hail our own taxis every day. I get the impression the staff work for tips and if you aren't waving money at them they are not helpful. We booked the room through an online booking agent and were unable to stipulate we needed twin beds. However our reservation did not stipulate we had booked a King bed room. This arrangement has never been a problem when I have travelled to other hotels (especially 4/5 star places) who always accomodate by providing a twin bedded room when requested on arrival. Not so the Sofitel. The hotel was not busy but the receptionist advised that they had allocated us a Deluxe King Bed if we wanted a bed each we would have to pay an extra 30 dollars a night plus taxes. The room was not cheap to start with and this guy seemed to think it totally reasonable that we share a bed. I found the attitude of this member of staff dismissive and irritating. No effort was made to call a supervsior or to accomodate us. It was take it or leave it. In the end we paid the extra as we had already paid the website in full for the room and only had a short time in LA. The staff in general seem to pose areound the lobby in stylish black outfits. The service lets this hotel down but otherwise we went on to have an enjoyable 3 days in LA. The room was a little pokey but had nice decor, nice robes and Loccitane toiletries and it was very clean. In general the hotel is stylish and comfortable but staff service should have been better. One exception on the staff; the concierge was very helpful and didn't expect a tip, I gave her one anyway - grateful for some decent service. There are 2 big plus points to this hotel, the beds are fantastic and very comfortable and the hotel is in a great location directly opposite the Beverly Center with all its shops and restaurants. The hotel was cleaned every day but toiletries were only refreshed when my friend left a tip in the room for the cleaner. My friend used the laundry service which was fast and she seemed happy but it didn't come cheap as there was even a charge to bring the laundry to the room. There are 3 macs with free internet access in the lobby and the concierge will check you in on flights and print boarding passes. Be warned whilst they have Tmobile wifi there is a signifcant charge to have it in your room. Based on the cost of the hotel I would expect wifi to be free. Would I stay there again? Maybe; if I couldn't find an alternative because of the great location and I did get great sleep however I would eat out and use the hotel's chergeable facilities as little as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but can be noisy and rooms need refresh”
Reviews.Author: Cooeee
Reviews.Content: This Sofitel has nice staff and good restaurant and bar facilities and is in a convenient location but I had to move four times to get a satisfactory room. On arrival I ended up moving through three rooms. The first on the fifth floor was a lovely room but on the Beverley Blvd side and above the driveway so whistling for cabs, traffic and trucks throttling down made it pretty noisy. The next on the 'hills' (quiet) side of the hotel on the 4th floor was a disabled friendly room with a shower curtain and a stool in the shower, but this one had an overwhelming smell of mould. The next was also on the roadside but up the far end, still noisy but a nice room albeit with a musty smell. Finally the next morning I moved to room 825, on the hills side, a large room with no smell, but note to maintenance staff - show shower head is faulty and squirting water onto the ceiling. It's a convenient location to West 3rd Street, The Beverley Centre, Restaurant row, The Grove and Farmers Market are in walking distance (1km) but make sure you request a room on the hills side for a quieter stay. I suspect the plumbing needs a good rinse out to remove that 'stale waste water' smell (comes from the drain in the showers) and they would be fine. The restaurant was lovely, especially for breakfast on the patio and the staff were all very nice. It's not cheap so hard to recommend when there are other comparable hotels in Beverley Hills that don't have the traffic noise and smelly plumbing. I'd recommend the restaurant for breakfast though, whether you're staying there or not.

Reviews.Title: “Better than last time”
Reviews.Author: SYD-LHR
Reviews.Content: Our second visit here this year and things were a lot better. Found all the staff very helpful, warm and friendly this time with nothing being too difficult. Had the most amazing service by the pool from a very attentive waiter. Breakfast was great and our room was always well looked after by housekeeping. The best bit... our flight home was late at night and after a day in LA in the hot sun we returned to the hotel to collect our bags. We were ushered into the showers in the day spa so we could have a wash and feel fresh for our flight. So much nicer than having to battle with the showers in the airline lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: JJudy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel Los Angeles in August 2010 with out two children ages 7 and 9 for three nights. The hotel is located near Westwood, in a very nice area not far from Beverly Hills right across from the Beverly Center. We had a suite overlooking the Hollywood Hills, which had a nice view although due to what seems to be no zoning regulations in LA also overlooked an adult entertainment establishment. The bathroom was huge. We had breakfast at the restaurant which was excellent, and in true French style, with complimentary croissants and baguettes included. As in most areas of LA, a car is essential, as I am not aware of easy public transit to Hollywood, or Santa Monica or other touristy areas. The valet parking staff were all quick and pleasant. The hotel is about one mile from the Farmer's Market and the Grove outside shopping complex that we all enjoyed and that had nice restaurants and upscale stores. The fitness facility at the Sofitel is huge, and is one of the best equipped hotel gyms I have seen. The Sofitel has a night club downstairs, that become very busy, so a room on a higher floor should be requested if you want to make sure nights are quiet. The price for the room was good for a room of its size. With all Sofitel reservations, the earlier you book on line, the better the deal.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced....”
Reviews.Author: bubbino
Reviews.Content: My mum and i stayed for 6 nights during the first week of August. When we first arrived at the door tired from a long 15 hour flight there were 6 bell men standing at the front door and not one of them moved to help us with our luggage. We were settled into our small room over the top of the noisy night club. In which woke us up during the night a few times. We used the concierge as we have never travelled to the States before and needed guidance of how to get around. They had no enthusiasm or motivation to help us with booking our tours. Luckily enough we were smart enough to do our own research and did it all ourselves. On a positive note, the beds in this hotel are fantastic and the food is of high quality. Be careful if the waiters try and add an automatic tip onto your bill if you are dining with less then 5 people. This is illegal...we found that out after we tipped on top of a tip! Overall, a nice stay. Would i stay there again?? probably not.

Reviews.Title: “Nice beds, good food, but noisy and service sub par”
Reviews.Author: hinalani
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sofitel LA twice on business trips, for about 5 nights each visit. I had a mixed experience. Not horrible, but you should know what you're getting into. Beds are very comfortable and sleep-conducive -- and good thing because the restaurant downstairs is very noisy well past 2 am most nights. Nice fitness center, pool, and outdoor sitting area above the pool where you can enjoy a drink in the evening. I never sat down at the restaurant but the food they send up to the rooms is very, very good, and comes up unbelievably fast. (So don't take a quick shower after you order.) My biggest complaint about this hotel is that the staff, while abundant, seem poorly trained or maybe just slow upstairs. Example: On my second trip, my colleague and I arrived very late (around 4 am) due to a delayed flight. We called ahead to make sure our reservations weren't lost, but when we arrived, they only had one room booked. I said that was an error and we'd like two rooms, but the check in attendant told us we were out of luck, that the hotel was fully booked, and maybe I could arrange to get a second room the following day. Well, the one available room had only one king bed, so I asked whether we could change that to two doubles. And the guy said, "yes, I'll give you a different room." ! So obviously I replied, "that means you have two rooms available and you're NOT fully booked." So we got the two rooms. Anyway, it was irritating because it was very late, we were dog-tired, and the whole process actually took like half an hour. It was so unnecessary and somewhat embarrassing because under the circumstances, it would have been really inappropriate for my colleague and I to share a room. I complained about the guy the following day, but the morning staff seemed surprisingly blase about it -- their attitude was like oh well, this kind of thing just happens from time to time. No apology, just "ohhh . . . but you ended up getting the room, right?" Big smile. Anyway, to end on a positive note, the pillow menu is awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Great looking hotel in good area, but...doors/walls can be paper thin when people talk loudly”
Reviews.Author: mhltan
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is nice and the rooms as well, but...I wasn't able to sleep for a couple of nights due to loud noises in the hallway from people who stumbled home at around 3am-4am. It almost felt like a college dorm when I heard people talking loudly outside my room. For the price that I pay, the hotel chain's reputation and the location, I expected other guests to be courteous and respectful but unfortunately that wasn't the case. I told the front desk about this situation, but they couldn't transfer me to another room and adviced to call the next time people were noisy again. Overall, I think the experience was a mixed bag: a nice hotel with friendly staff members, but for a good night's sleep, I recommend earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “Great overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: AussieDiva
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight in transit back to Toronto after an 18 hour flight from Sydney. The hotel is about a half hour from the airport but we wanted to hit either Santa Monica or Hollywood for the afternoon, so location was good. Hotel was very nicely appointed and guest rooms were a dream - we had the best night sleep during our three week trip. The bathroom was also to die for with a lovely big shower stall with rainshower and handshower. No detail seemed to be missed and would stay here again. We had breakfast the next morning the Studio LA restaurant which also topped our list for the many hotel breakfasts we'd had over the previous weeks. The waiter who looked after us "Sandra" was exceptional - 10 out of 10! Service staff on front desk failed to impress.

Reviews.Title: “Upgraded Stay”
Reviews.Author: mostyn7
Reviews.Content: Hotel stays always go well when the room you walk into is better than the one you reserved. We arrived for the last night of our holiday somewhat regretting not having stayed for three nights in Santa Barbara and just driving to the airport from there. I am so glad we decided to stay at the Sofitel. The suite we were given was fantastically clean, well equipped and so comfortable. A quick unpack of the case into the walk in wardrobe with case space and large storage drawers, a tryout of the three TV sets (one over the bath), and photographic session of the hills from the balcony was followed by a short visit to the Beverly Centre across the road. Unusually we decided to have room service â€“ it arrived promptly, served with a smile and was excellent. An excellent nightâ€™s sleep in a fantastically comfortable Sofitel bed was followed by breakfast in the restaurant. We decided to eat outside â€“ complementary small smoothy and French breads, good coffee and the sounds of a waterfall masking the road noise of Beverly Boulevard. My husband is already planning a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Gsup
Reviews.Content: This was our 1st leg stop of our brilliant honeymoon and the Sofitel Hotel gave us a brilliant start. Upon arrival the bell boys were on hand straight away to help us with our luggage and was extremely friendly. The person who checked us in was also very friendly and helpfull and provided us an upgrade on our room upon hearing we were on our honeymoon and also helped us with information on how to get to Universal Studios, as we only had 2 days in LA and had a city, movies and beach tour the next day. The room that we had was located at the top of the hotel where all the special suites are located. It was very spacious had a king size bed that was out of this world comfort, (the best bed I have ever slept in), there was a seperate sofa to chill out on with an ipod dock system on hand. All the usual amenities kettle, coffee, glasses etc. Flat screen HD TV. The bathroom was fantastic especially the shower as it was enormous and even had a seating area inside. There is a window from the shower looking into the room that can go from see-through to frosted if you wanted your privacy. Also there were dimmers on the lights so you could adhust according to the mood. The Simon LA restaurant breakfast was amazing, the food tasted very nice and fresh and the staff made us feel at home. I would definitely reccommend this hotel to anyone, the service we received was great and there are pick up services available if you are planning tours around LA from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “dissappointed”
Reviews.Author: Jedda23
Reviews.Content: beds not very comfortable. too noisy during the evening(sirens) They charge your credit card as soon as you arrive for your full stay and then hold an extra $200.00 per day, of your stay. so go with plenty of money in your account. All this, they do not tell you when you arrive. When we complained we were offered a free breakfast as the best they could do.

Reviews.Title: “Great food, decent service, but noisy on the front”
Reviews.Author: purners
Reviews.Content: I think overall I had a good experience at the Sofitel in LA, stayed there for 6 nights. The service was pretty attentive, located across from the mall which can be a good thing and the food really was very good. We were holding an event there and the staff were extremely helpful and we had a successful event there. Only downside is if you get a room on the front it can be noisy because of the road and the bar. I ended up switching rooms to a room on the back and it was a MUCH more relaxing experience. Bar can be a little dark and hence offputting but the outside bar area is lovely. Wifi access was a pain in the rear as is run by T-mobile and I could not get e-mail to work in my room despite calling their "help" desk.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel LA.....”
Reviews.Author: caseyleewood
Reviews.Content: We Stayed at the Sofitel after and 17 hour flight to be checked into a room directly over a night club. We slept on and off that night only because we were so tired. We asked our room to be changed the following night if the night club was going to continue. Sure enough the room was changed. We ate in the restaurant 'Simon LA' it was OK but nothing special. The coffee was Super hot anfd the beans burnt... It's really hard to get good coffee in the states. The location was opptisite the Beverly Bvld shops... Apart from that- The location is not great. It was about a $70.00 ride from the airport and cost about $40.00 to get to Griffiths observetry in a taxi. We found all Taxi drivers took advantage once they heard an ozzie accent. The bathrooms in the Hotel were large but did not contain a bath but the shower was very large looking into the room via a glass window that you could frost over. The lobby is very nice and the bell boys were very attentive. The concierge was not the most informative.. We asked about local restarant and got a list with no address, no telephone number or local map.. All in all pretty useless. Anyway.. Was OK nothing super special,

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LUXURY HOTEL, AMAZING RESTAURANT AND CONCIERGE AND GREAT LOCATION...”
Reviews.Author: DHM202
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I visidted Sofitel L.A from Australia Sydney, we loved and enjoyed our time, it was absoutely amazing,the restaurant was delicious,hygiene great, the only thing is house keeping should leave more then one toilet roll, location perfect for shopping, Hollywood Blvrd, Rodeo Drive,Hollywood Hills,farmers market,beverly centre,City walk, and universal studios... Staff were great, we had a problem with one of the staff, and the manager rectified the problem straight away, which was great service, he took charge of the situation.. Would definately stay there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stop for me”
Reviews.Author: friendAustralia10
Reviews.Content: Always enjoy this hotel staff ghreat easy check in great locaiton Beds very nice Will be back

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay - Fantastic Room”
Reviews.Author: nbwat1
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel although I am a little biased as the rest of my trip around the US I was staying in 3 star hotels. However the hotel lived up to my expectations of a 4.5 star hotel. The room was nice and spacious, it was a nice novelty seeing the hollywood sign from my bedroom! The tv was nice and large and the bed was so so comfortable. I liked how each evening they would re-stock the complimentary evian water and re-make your bed if used since the cleaners came to the room during the day. The bathroom was also spacious. The shower had great water pressure and I LOVED the L'Occitane bath products!!! This is what won me over! Great choice Sofitel! I went to the restaurant twice during my 4 night stay and I thought it was fantastic. The food was amazing. I thought it was reasonably priced considering it was attached to a hotel. The cocktails ordered were also excellent. I thought long and hard about the location of this hotel when booking as I did not have a car. Although it's not in the most picturesque street like some other hotels, it was very conveniently located. I was there to shop and I walked to Robertson Blvd, Rodeo Drive, The Grove and Farmers Market and Melrose. It was a really safe area for a single female to walk around. The outdoor pool, whilst small and had intermittent bar service, was very nice. The only downside was that there was no free wifi. I think when you are paying these kind of prices, wifi should be included. For $9.95 I was happy to walk to the Coffee Bean and Tea Leaf for free wifi. I would definitely stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but noisy above bar patio”
Reviews.Author: SLOnative
Reviews.Content: This hotel really should be located somewhere else in LA. The Beverly Center is directly across the dirty crumbling intersection of Beverly and La Cinega. Politicians must steal from Public Works in California to help pay for generous public pensions. The hotel is beautiful. And it's also across the street from Cedars Sinai hospital, where my wife was an out-patient for surgery. So we drove down the day before her 6:30 AM appointment and stayed an extra day just in case. We ate in their great restaurant and loved everything on the menu. Some complain that the prices are high, but it was about what you'd expect to pay for a good meal in any major city. Don't bother going into the bar for an early evening cocktail. The prices are higher and the service is non-existent. Their bar is what you'd call a "bottle club" with sofas and low furniture designed to seduce females who stop by your table to share your top-shelf $300-and-up bottle of vodka. Since we had a 6:30 AM appointment we retired to our contemporary furnish room and flat screen TV with a ton of cable channels. It was barely dark before we heard a microphone chatting DJ directly below on the patio or open doors of the bar through our solid glass windows on the 8th floor. My wife called the front desk and shortly after they must have jerked the jerk's microphone or closed the bar doors. I recommend a room on the west side of the hotel. The bathroom is luxurious with a water-wasting, water-fall shower that you can't avoid. They charge $9.95 a day for wireless access, so I walked my iPad across the street to the Apple Store in the mall where service was free in a generous public lobby. There was no wine opener in the room so we requested Valet parking to get one out of my glove box. Later that day house-keeping delivered two more an hour apart. The neighborhood streets are crumbling and appear to have never been swept. The Macy's sidewalk entrance windows are scratched with Graffitti. Yet Sofitel draws lots of foreign tourists. We heard Russian, Italian and Aussie spoken in and around the hotel. I'm sure at these prices you can find a better hotel in a better location. Try nearby Beverly Hills. For those using Cedars Sinai, I recommend it. If you are a tourist coming to LA for to the Beach, try staying further west in Santa Monica or Marina del Rey. Or futher south in Orange County. The St. Regis Monarch Bay across from the Ritz Carlton in Dana Point is even "pet friendly" and in much better locations overlooking the Pacific.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Location, But......”
Reviews.Author: MCKA
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, good location, nice rooms - no full length mirrors (pet peeve) - no comfortable lounge to have a drink in - the bar is very dark and becomes a club on weekends. But the main issue for me was it is very difficult signing up to use internet access if you do not have a credit card billed to a US Address. The hotel uses T Mobile for internet access and it took two days dealing with T Mobile to solve this problem (and two months after returning home to cancel the continuing debits). The hotel staff were no help - they continued to transfer me to the same TMobile number. Many business guests (me included) make their choice of hotel dependent on high-speed internet access being readily available in the room. Additionally, it was very expensive especially since most hotels I stay in at this level provide free access.

Reviews.Title: “very cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: robertadams
Reviews.Content: stayed here august 09 for 3 nights as part of our san diego to san fran drive really cool hotel everything already said by those who have reviewed before and given 5/5 met ferne cotton at the hotel for those that know who im on about! great location for LA and an easy drive just following one road down to beach should you also want to hit santa monica beach

Reviews.Title: “Everything was perfect”
Reviews.Author: redwinter
Reviews.Content: I had a delightful 5-day stay at the Sofitel and I had an amazing time - not a single complaint. The hotel is stylish without being austere; the staff were all delightful (from the valets to the concierge, housekeeping, restaurant staff - all marvellous); the room was lovely (great bed); convenient location; excellent restaurant and bar. I don't have enough superlatives and hope to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Service - Great Hotel.... Just watch your valubles.”
Reviews.Author: johnlocash
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel, Overall a fantastic stay! Friendly service.... Great Location..... Clean Hotel. The "Stone Rose Lounge" is a great club and has a really awesome atmosphere about it. ***Only bad point was a missing IPOD and $300AUD so a handy tip keep the Valuables locked up in the safe***

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location; great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Globetraveler40
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Sofitel Los Angeles in May 2010. We had booked a special deal through the Sofitel website and were supposed to be upgraded to a suite. I did not take this very seriously but when we arrived we had already been upgraded to a gorgeous and luxurious penthouse suite. The hotel is conveniently located from across the Beverly Center. Great restaurants close by - we went to XYZ by Michael Mina and Bazaar by Jose Andres. If you like a hip urban scene this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect hospitality at this place..”
Reviews.Author: thearcher83
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a couple of friends for 4 nights. We were staying on the penthouse floor and was definately NOT worth the extra money! We were not given a joined room as promised. The reasoning was because 'it is not guaranteed' but was for other guests who arrived a couple days before us, and for other guests who were arriving on the Saturday (we arrived Thurs.). We were not able to check into our room until almost 5pm! Even though we arrived at 12pm (it does not take 5hours to clean up one room) No compensation was given to us. Room service was slow.

Reviews.Title: “You call this a 4-star hotel???”
Reviews.Author: FallsChurch2
Reviews.Content: I booked this through American Airlines Vacations and was sorely disappointed: our room overlooked the Hollywood Hills ... and four metal exhaust stacks from the level below; the top of the closet door banged against the metal arm of the hallway door so you could open the closet door only half-way; a metal ring on the shower handle came off every time we used it; and we could hear every time the room next door flushed the toilet, ran the shower, or turned on their TV. On the positive side, the decor was elegant and this was one of the most luxurious hotel beds I've ever slept on. Plus the location can't be beat: on Restaurant Row, across from the luxe Beverly Center, and surrounded by Beverly Hills, West Hollywood and Westwood. So, great location, but this so-called 4-star hotel needs to take care of the details first. Like the cobwebs on the window frame.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SharkATL
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Sofitel for three nights recently. A beautifully maintained modern gem in Beverly Hills. Great location, right across the street from the Beverly Center, and walking distance to Beverly Hills. Fantastic staff and our room was immaculate. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: lauraSwiss
Reviews.Content: Excellet staff, nice and clean rooms. Along the line of other Sofitel business hotels with a touch of LA style as well. The pool on the terrace is a big plus. I have looked at other hotels while in LA and I was sooo happy about my choice!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic bed, great looking restaurant/club”
Reviews.Author: chuckee
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic 2 night stay here. The bed is one of Sofitel's special beds that really was like sleeping on a cloud - I've never fallen asleep so quickly in my life! The bathroom amenities were high quality (L'Occitane) and I hear that you can request a view of the Hollywood sign (which we should've done). While I only got a walking tour of the restaurant and club, they looked very stylish, and a great place to spend an evening. The club had a really nice outdoor area, with booths, and devices with flames/fire to keep you warm.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed!! Sleepless nights”
Reviews.Author: GorGor
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed with the noise level of this hotel. The bar downstairs had LOUD (VERY LOUD) MUSIC all the way until 2am everynight. Overall this is a great clean hotel in a good location opposite Beverley Centre. BUT the level of noise is unbearable. Only stay here if you don't wanted to sleep until 2am.....

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: SaFot
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 5 nights. The Hotel is very modern and nice decorated. The stuff is friendly and the location is also good (for Los Angeles- you need a car) on the other side of the road is a big mall where you can buy anything. Starbucks is also around the corner and a Convenience store. At the arrival we where given a room at the lower levels and there where the air condition facility so the noise was very loud. We called the receptionist and they changed our room immediately without any questions. There is also a restaurant which is very good but a little bit expensive *for our budget) At night you have to take the car cause there isn't anything in walk distance ( it's LA) Our room was very clean and the bathroom was just perfect. We would stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “just great”
Reviews.Author: INSSH
Reviews.Content: very nice checkin !!! the receptionist waited for us in the lobby and guided us to the front desk. they call you with your name which really makes it personal. great bar and even greater restaurant. Good location and nice pool outside. best spa I've ever been at. concierge was a bit arrogant but still helpful. great room with a marvelous view to the hollywood hills, seeing dusk and dawn. we can really really recommend this hotel !!

Reviews.Title: “Still the best”
Reviews.Author: island085
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd time at the Sofitel and I love it each time.. Staff were very friendly, especially Daniella and Marco. They made my sister and I feel very welcome on our arrival and our departure. ahhh the beds.. the BEDS! I could sleep in them all day.. My favourite thing about this hotel. Just amazing! I did not use the conceirge this time as I didn't find them very helpful on my other visits, often just referring us to "catch a cab". We often caught the Dash bus from around the corner out the front of the Petrol station for 25c up to Hollywood and Highland. The Beverly Centre is right across the road with all your luxury brands and H&M.. which we don't have here in Australia. A CVS is also over the intersection and Souplantation which was a awesome place to eat, shame we only found it on our last day. Its all you can eat salads, soups, drinks and deserts for $14! and it was so yummy.. Thanks again to the Sofitel... can't wait till our next stay in October!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely comfortable place to stay”
Reviews.Author: lainey007
Reviews.Content: I booked through Hotwire, and would have to say that this hotel exceeded all my expectations. It was clean, spacious and staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel, super friendly staff, excellent suite & stunning views of Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: Travel-Diva-KD
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week last August, in a penthouse suite overlooking Hollywood all the way to the Hollywood sign. One small problem when we arrived, we were placed in a room with no balcony looking onto the Beverly Centre mall. The room spec promised a balcony so my partner queried this at reception and we were moved rooms right away - it's just a shame that had to happen as the stay was otherwise perfect. I was so thankful that he queried it, as it was amazing to have a balcony and the views were fantastic. The suite consisted of two adjoining rooms: a living area with tv, sofas and balcony, and a huge bedroom with en-suite bathroom - bath with television & separate shower cubicle. We were very impressed with all the space and comfortable furniture. The staff were amazingly friendly, especially the seating hostess at breakfast who was always so happy to see us. The breakfasts were fantastic, with a different 'smoothie of the day' each morning and lots of delicious items on the menu to choose from. It was served in the outside seating area, so very sunny and warm - a delight. Just across the road from the hotel is the Beverly Centre - a shopping mall with loads of fab shops like Macy's, loads of placed to eat and drink, and even a cinema on the top level. Apart from that, transport was required to get around LA. We walked all the way to Hollywood Boulevard and found the walk of fame, but when it came to walking back it was too far. The rest of the trip we had to take taxis to all of our restaurants and excursions to the studios, etc, so be sure to budget for that (unless you're going to be brave & hire a car). We went to the hotel pool most days - it was small but quiet so we really enjoyed it. There were staff coming to take drinks orders from the poolside as well. We ate in the hotel's restaurant once and really enjoyed our meals and cocktails. Getting around LA is difficult so I think next time we will locate ourselves near the beach for a few days and then maybe elsewhere so we can experience more. Apart from that, this hotel is excellent, we had a great time and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, great location and fantastic staff - 10/10”
Reviews.Author: rodharder
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here recently for our wedding anniversary and were extremely impressed with this hotel. From the moment we arrived, the valets, doormen and front desk staff made sure that we were taken care of and treated just like the many celebrities that call this hotel home when in LA. We were upgraded to a hillside view room upon arrival on the 9th floor with an amazing view of the Hollywood hills and the famous Hollywood sign and the room was absolutely wonderful. The bed was absolutely amazing, and the bathroom was stocked with top shelf toiletries and a wonderful rain shower and robes and slippers for the both of us. The hotel is located in a great location, close to Beverly Hills,and Sunset and Santa Monica Boulevards and on the corner of La Cienega where many of the celebrity hangouts are, and the Beverly Centre Shopping Mall is literally across the street. We would most certainly recommend this hotel to anyone that wants a taste of the glamourous side of Hollywood and LA. Also, special thanks to Jack, one of the doormen at the Sofitel LA, who was an absolute class act. Thanks to all of the Sofitel staff for an experience that we will never forget.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Service”
Reviews.Author: AndyVand
Reviews.Content: I have got a list of 3 hotels when me and my wife decided to travel to LA, Sofitel was number 2 on her list, I booked via Hotwire ( Great Web site ) and got a good deal, This is a 4 to 4,5 star hotel, Lot of friendly staff, Great decorated,and a very good location just cross from beverly center. The only down side is the noise witch nobody can do anything about, If you stay in a city,You will have noise from the traffic or in this case from the kinden garden close by. Our total feedback for this hotel is possitive and we would be staying there again !

Reviews.Title: “Perfect.”
Reviews.Author: TinaF55
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with fantastic restaurant, excellent location opposite Beverly Center and excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “SweeeeeeeeT”
Reviews.Author: kingo904
Reviews.Content: Hollywood the way it should be done! Nice beds nice shower, nice sound system in the room and bathroom....nice nice nice!!!! you could throw a rock at the Beverly center

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Shoppers Location!”
Reviews.Author: Loz_dc
Reviews.Content: Well....for me, being such a shopaholic, this location was absolutely perfect. It was across the road from the Beverly Center...Love this shopping centre! I'll never get used to the tipping concept in the USA, but this hotel was perfect in every way. Great service, great room, and good value for what we were after. I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Very active, young, hip...noisy.”
Reviews.Author: lovetravelling0820
Reviews.Content: We generally love the Sofitel franchise in the US and Europe because it is chic and intimate regardless of size. (Washington, DC, Brussels, Paris- all typify the charm of a Sofitel experience. Romantic, business-like, quality amenities, good value for the price). This hotel is very large and in a highly trafficed area. That said, if you like the Sofitel hotels, we recommend requesting a room on the opposite side of the hotel from where the bar and restaurants are located.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: wreckcat
Reviews.Content: Traveled to L.A. for a yearly vacation with my girlfriends. We loved this hotel. Friendly, helpful staff, comfy beds, beautiful flowers everywhere. We rented a car for our stay and drove to the beach and all over L.A. , visited wine country, etc. Loved it all""". I have seen several people mention that there were not coffee machines in the hotel rooms but we had free coffee every morning that was located in the hotel lobby along with free newspapers and computers. We had lunch in the restaurant one day and it was delicious and the really neat thing was the pink cotton candy offered at the end of our meal. We give this place a great big A.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Hotel - bit pricey in some areas”
Reviews.Author: Dave_Webb
Reviews.Content: This was our third trip to LA and each time we have stayed in a different area. This hotel was well located near Beverly Hills although it seemed a bit limited at night. We chose not to eat in the hotel as it was quite expensive and instead went to the nearby Chinese Restaurant which was very popular, very tasty and very reasonbly priced. We also had a very good breakfast at the local Jerry's Deli. We felt that the drinks in the Hotel were also over-priced, a good glass of Merlot at the Chinese was $7 whereas it was $14 in the hotel. Friday night appeared to be singles night so it was great fun watching who paired off with who. The room was comfortable and clean but not as big as others we have stayed in. There was no tea/coffee making facilities so we had to use room service but this was always prompt and I am pleased to say that the gratuity was included in the price. We like walking in LA and the Farmers Market/Grove was only 30 mins away, the Walk of Fame and Chinese Theatre took us about 1 hour. Buses are easy to use in LA although a bit busy and it took us over an hour to get to Santa Monica beach but it was worth it although it could have been a bit warmer. The staff were always courteous although the Concierge was not aware of the Universal/Sea World Flexi ticket even though it was on the information she gave us. She seemed more keen on booking us a taxi and a single ticket rather than trying to save us money by giving us the options. Overall the hotel was a good place to start our two week stay in the US and I would cautiously recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Top Shelf Comfort”
Reviews.Author: mollydotcom
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a rare gem, blending elegance in both architecture and general service style with a warmth that makes one feel comfortable. Whether you're a known celeb walking through the doors or a worn out business traveler like me, the treatment is equal and attentive to all guests. My only regret is that I didn't get to try the spa, as I was short on time. Great drinks at the bar, and the appetizers were heaven. Try the Lobster Mac & Cheese - a perfect metaphor for the Sofitel in general - top-shelf comfort.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel, if a little pricey!!”
Reviews.Author: NicLiz
Reviews.Content: We spent the first three nights of our recent trip to the USA at the Sofitel LA. Location is OK on Beverly Boulevard - a 10 min drive to Rodeo Drive, 20 mins to Universal and 30(ish) to Santa Monica Beach. Big shopping mall across the road, but other than that there did not appear to be a huge amount to do locally - not sure if this is to do with the hotel or just the vast size of LA generally!!! Room was fantastic - we were lucky enough to secure a room with a full balcony (there are only a very limited number) but as smokers this was a godsend.
