Room very clean, very tasteful and the SoBed was just what was needed after a long flight. Also had a Bose sound system, with a built in ipod/iphone charger which was pretty handy. Large plasma screen, with plenty of HD channels. Robes and slippers provided, but no tea or coffee making facilities - which meant if caffeine is needed before you face the world a room service charge applied!! The hotel also has a very well hidden outdoor pool, which although it only has a very limited number of sunbeds (about 12!) was very refreshing after a days sightseeing and also had free drinking water and a waiter drinks service. Restaurant and bar were very nice and very 'trendy' (bar full of young pretty things both Friday and Saturday night) but was also fairly expensive for the location - the covered outside seating area was lovely and heated by both patio heaters and firepit - but you couldn't get a seat at the weekend. Valet service was again fairly expensive, but there is a carpark in the mall across the road - not something we tried, but would probably save a few dollars if needed. All in all a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service but rooms need urgent update”
Reviews.Author: melpapSydney
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel are exceptional. Unfortunately the room we stayed in had an offensive smell. I believe the carpet in both the hallway and room needs replacing.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel service”
Reviews.Author: the_nim
Reviews.Content: We booked two nights there based on some of the reviews here, and we were not disappointed! We spent a little more and booked into a luxury room with a king bed, and easily one of the coolest bathrooms I've seen in a hotel room. The best bit was the see through window into the shower, my wife freaked out initially... but then we found the button that makes the window opaque.... so cool... The staff were extremely helpful, we turned up at 8AM on the day of checkin and they did their best to get us a room, and we were checked in at 12AM. In that time we had breakfast at their restaurant - which was reasonable, and then spent the rest of the time in the spa (because they couldn't check us in, they gave is $25 off each treatment), and they had availability for the treatments... The spa was good, very relaxing and the treatments were really good too! Much better than our stay at the Hyatt a few days earlier. Once checked in, the hotel is right next to the Beverly Center for shopping needs - which was good. But don't believe the map, other interesting spots (universal studios, restaurants, Rodeo Drive etc.) are miles away! Can walk, but will take a long time, definitely hire a car or cab (typically spend about $10 per trip to most of the interesting locations). I don't think we had any negative points about this place at all, if you're going to stay in LA, and you're not staying in Santa Monica, this place makes perfect sense! Overall, would definitely stay there if we go back to LA (if we weren't staying in Santa Monica!)

Reviews.Title: “fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: squeegee10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for just 2 nights at the end of a month long trip waiting for return flights to our homeland. We found every staff member there to be polite, professional and first class. It was a pleasurable experience. There is something classy and old world to have a concierge remember your name when passing and ask how you are by name (Mr *insert name here*), though he had only met you once. Its the little things that so many places miss. I recall staying at a very famous 5 star resort in Australia, pulling up in my (rather nice expensive) car, and having their head concierge say "hi mate, hows things goin?" We stayed in a suite, but decided it wasnt quite large enough for the kids too (please dont get me wrong, it wasnt really small.....it had a seperate bedroom and living room....ad a very nice large shower), so we asked the front desk for another room, and they not only provided us a discounted rate, but allowed us to keep the room until later the following evening at no extra charge as we had a 11pm flight. This was unexpected, and very very kind. If I can only pass one commnent, watch the drinks and "extras" prices. I found it a little rich to order a mixed "standard" coke/spirit by the pool, and was charged $21 for it. This seemed to be a common theme thru room service too. One more comment...the gym as first rate. Best Gym I have ever seen in any resort or hotel. As aways, the defining question......Would I stay here again? Definitely yes, without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MagpieJB
Reviews.Content: Stayed for just 1 night but it was very good. Comfortable, clean and an awesome view of the Hollywood Hills. The bed was excellent. Very good nights sleep after a long flight. Good safe area and close to transport. Beverly Centre just over the road. The only thing which disappointed me was during checkout. The staff tried to charge us for a pay per view movie that we didn't watch. They told us the time it was viewed and we were in bed asleep then! They ultimately didn't charge us for it but I felt like they thought I was lying or something. Other than that incident the staff were very helpful and friendly and I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Safe, Great views”
Reviews.Author: NancyToronto
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in March 2010 for 2 nights. Paid $150/night through hotwire. Walking distance to restaurants nearby, both fast food and fine dining. Bus stop right outside hotel, and taxis always waiting. A bit far from Hollywood though, and you need to take public transit or an expensive taxi ride to get to Hollywood (unless you have a car). We ended up purchasing a 48 hour hop-on hop-off bus ticket ($30 each), which was excellent, informative and stopped right outside the hotel. That, along with public transportation and a taxi, allowed us to save the money and hassle of renting a car ($30 per night parking). Hotel has its own bar, which was quiet and okay (nowhere to spend an entire night). The room faced the hollywood hills (and sign), so the view was nice (ask for a room with such a view). The room was modern, clean, and had a very very comfortable bed (I've since ordered pillows directly from the hotel). As usual for L.A., lots of pretentious guests, but the service from the hotel staff was excellent. Overall, excellent stay, but be warned that it is away from all the major attractions and a metro station. Next time I will probably stay in Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, and great value for money. Couldn't ask for more!”
Reviews.Author: Chickita79
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I absolutely loved staying here. The location was fantastic and you could not fault the service. There were always staff in the foyer or at the desk waiting to assist. The Beverly Centre across the road was handy, as was the massive drug store with refreshments, around the corner (CVS Pharmacy i think it was?). The one and only negative that we could think of was the price for overnight valet parking ($30/night). We ended up parking at the undercover shopping centre car-park next to the drug store around the corner ($9 overnight) on La Cienega Blvd. It was about a 4 minute walk from the hotel and with that saving, we would have walked four times that distance!! Our room faced the hills and on the school side. Noise wasn't a problem with the school, perhaps it could be if you were a light sleeper though. A truly fantastic hotel. I'm so glad we stayed here!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed review”
Reviews.Author: Gilly83Sydney
Reviews.Content: This was the first hotel we stayed in when we arrived in America. Firstly, I have to mention the room, which was beautifully furnished, especially the bathroom! The beds were divine, and exactly what we needed to get over jetlag. The downside of the room was the noise factor. Every morning we woke up around 5am to traffic on the road below our window. We found the concierge very unhelpful. He could not recommend places to eat other than the hotel restaurant, which was out of our price range. Also, did not give us helpful advice on how to get around. The location is ok. Keep in mind that LA is huge, and public transport isnt great, so you need to use taxis to get most places. Its not a bad place to access the Hollywood spots and Universal Studios etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: RyanColombo
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is just across the street from the Beverly Center, so its very convenient for shopping, food and entertainment. A short cab ride from the hotel will get you to many of the interesting areas of LA, Like the walk of fame, Rodeo drive. The farmers Market is 15 minute walk away, and is a must! The room was on the smaller size but compensated well with a great panoramic view of the Hollywood hills/ sign. Only one gripe I had was that the room had an odour , that was not repulsive but more peculiar, maybe it was the air freshener they used, it had a chocolatey tinge to it...... ask for a room facing the hills as I was told the rooms facing the street can get a bit noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location to be without a car”
Reviews.Author: Cheebs
Reviews.Content: I used to hate Los Angeles. Now I love certain neighborhoods, and this hotel arguably has the best location in town from which to walk to some cool places and take public buses to others. It's also a pretty neat hotel with stunning views (tip: ask for a high room overlooking the hills and Pacific Design Center). Shuttles from the airport to the hotel run at around $15, and once settled, it's walking distance to West Hollywood and Santa Monica Boulevard for bars, clubs and restaurants. For gay travelers, walk within 15 minutes to The Abbey, Micky's, Rage and Hamburger Mary's. Breakfast a couple of blocks away at Jerry's Famous Deli'. Walk 20 minutes east to the Farmers Market and The Grove, passing cute coffee shops along Third Street. Up for more walking? Then head north-west to Greystone Mansion, a nice stroll through the tony Beverly Hills residential streets leading up to pretty gardens and awesome views. Closer to the hotel, visit the Pacific Design Center which is open to the public and affords more awesome views from the many levels. Even closer (across the street from the hotel) is the Beverly Center, a relatively new, incredibly stylish shopping mall. So, yeah, amazing location especially for folks wanting to survive LA without a car. And with a great deal on the rate, the stylish (but quite small by American standards) room was perfect too.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: SYD-LHR
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in a number of Sofitel hotels around the world and this one just didn't hit the mark. Far too many staff around the front doors almost tackle you on the way in, but not offering you any assistance with bags, etc and with so many people saying "Hello" to you, you almost get whiplash try to acknowledge them all back. Moreover the rooms let this place down, odd shaped and in need of a freshen up. Breakfast was very good, being simple breakfast eaters it was great being able to just get toast, juice and coffee without all the fuss. Otherwise a very good location with nightclubs and shopping a short walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience!”
Reviews.Author: IrishLassfromTheEast
Reviews.Content: Four of us went out for a week - sister was there for business for a few days and we decided to extend the stay and make it a vacation for the four of us. We had two rooms for 6 nights - enjoyed every single minute of our stay. The hotel staff was extremely accommodating - couldn't do enough for you. The rooms are small but very comfortable. The beds are so amazing - best night sleep I've had in a long time. The large bathrooms and showers with rain shower was fantastic. The location of the hotel gave us so many opportunities to explore a lot via car or taxi or by foot. Fantastic restaurants in the hotel - and nearby. Beverly Center directly across the street worth exploring - the CVS is great - sells everything from toiletries, Rx's, beer, wine, liquor, and even lottery tickets! PF Changs is a definite must - within 1 1/2 blocks of hotel as is Dominicks - a fantastic Italian treasure - very deceiving from the outside - a gem on the inside. Loved The Abbey on Robertson in west Hollywood - a definite must for EVERYONE. Would definitely stay there again - without hesitation. Would recommend asking for a room with views of the Hollywood Hills - absolutely amazing sites!!! Nigh club in hotel was beautiful - with outside cabana style seating areas - very private, cozy, and warm with the fire pits, heat lamps and strategically placed candles/lighting. Amazing experience!

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel Los Angeles-Not SO!”
Reviews.Author: TravelerAZ2008
Reviews.Content: On a trip out to Los Angeles some months back I had the terrible misfortune of trying to stay here at this hotel. The front desk staff was terribly rude and and when I asked to speak to a manager the gentleman who came out and claimed to be the front Desk Manager was worse that the girl that started out helping me. In fact after I asked a few questions regarding this attempt to stay, the manager in question rolled his eyes and walked away. This all would have been the end of it until I got called a few choice names under his breath as he walked away. When I tred to speak with the General Manager about this a few days later I got no where, I ended up speaking with some guy named Brian, who is not the General Manager. I specifically remember asking to speak to the General Manager, not some lakey who is trying to interced. This place would have been fun to stay at would it not have been for the horrible customer service. If you dont mind rude staff and overpriced parking, this might be the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Possibly the nicest bed i have ever slept in”
Reviews.Author: TysonWalker
Reviews.Content: Sofitel LA = Fantastic location, within walking distance to Robertson Blvd - best shopping in beverly hills if you ask me. Hotel Concierge were fantastic, every bar/restaurant they recommended was spot on !.. Rooms are clean, fresh and very Beverly hills !.. loved it ( amenities are L'Ocitane ), slept each night in the most comfortable bed ever...!.. Sofitel LA - i will be back again and again !...

Reviews.Title: “Uhhhh, not so much...smoke and mirrors”
Reviews.Author: Rodiah
Reviews.Content: As always when I travel, I spend hours on Tripadvisor.com, reading reviews and clutching my pearls at every horror story. The Sofitel Los Angeles had decent reviews and although some of them gave me pause, I decided to ignore my instincts and go with a friends suggestion. Said friend is in the music industry and is well traveled so I booked. The location is prime. Being a Native New Yorker who has spent half my life walking or on some mode of public transportation, I ignored the advice given to me by EVERYONE to rent a car... RENT A CAR (donâ€™t say I didn't warn you) (oh and pay $30 to park), luckily for me the Beverly Center is directly across the street as well as a CVS. The hotel is beautiful and I found all of the staff to be welcoming, courteous and friendly. So far... so good... then I got to the room. Hey, I'm from New York so I understand cramped spaces but ...really??? The room was teeny.. Now had the tiny room been CLEAN, I would not have complained...but the tiny room had what I like to refer to as a "film" or a "coating"... a certain "ick" factor that I could live without. Maybe they thought the flickering light by the door would make the stains on the carpet hard to see but I could still see them. Or maybe the electrical shock noise coming from the flickering light made was supposed to dry up the two WET SPOTS in the carpet...but it didn't... SIDEBAR: Those spots remained wet my entire 5 days stay. In fact I would not be surprised if the front desk called up each morning to confirm the re-wetting of these spots, because we kept the heat all the way turned up in an attempt to dry the spots and dry they did not. Now, I don't run a hotel so I am unaware of the procedure however if I did run a hotel, I wouldnâ€™t give a guest a smoking room without asking them: â€œDo you want a smoking roomâ€� or if the entire hotel is a smoking hotel, I would at least EMPTY THE ASHTRY on the balcony before the next non smoking guest (me) checked in...it would have been nice if they sent someone up to empty this ashtray upon my request but it wasnâ€™t emptied until 2 days laterâ€¦ My sister thought the sheets looked a little yellowish, I didn't notice this because I was too busy staring at the power strip wedged between the headboard and the mattress and sleeping with one eye open. I can't say the noise from the club downstairs bothered us like I read about in other reviews (I stayed on the 3rd floor) and I didn't have a problem bringing my cousin back to the room with us several times throughout the day (which was also a concern since a review said they couldnâ€™t bring people upstairs) The only other point I would make is, be prepared to spend money if you want to eat in this place. The food is yummy but it should be, it was the best $8.00 cup of tea I've ever had. ... My guess is that they clean the room for the fancy people... cuz I doubt Alica's (Keyz) Room looked like mine oh and no free wifi....

Reviews.Title: “A Treat From Bed To Plate”
Reviews.Author: PerthMovers
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 5 nights at the Softel LA in early January. We were meet at LAX by a driver from the hotel who was very hospitable, a good opening for the hotel itâ€™s self. The car pulled up outside the door and we were ushered inside by sharply-clad, black-suited staff, who smile and extend a welcome as if you had just arrived home. The warm professionalism continues at reception, where the staff seems genuinely pleased to see you. Oh, just a note here: NO â€œResort Feeâ€™ payable here, Palazzo and other Vegas hotels please take note! We were given a lovely room on the 11th floor with wonderful views of the Hollywood Hills and the ubiquitous Hollywood sign. The room its self is â€œsmallishâ€� if you were to pace it out. However, with a cleaver use of mirrors coupled with the use of light pastoral colours in the dÃ©cor you never feel cramped. The bathroom is wonderful and the bed is a great place to fall into after a big day down town. As a first time visitor to LA the geography of the place takes a bit of getting use to. In other words, the concept of walking anywhere in LA is unknown to almost everybody (including hotel staff.) Every direction based question is meet with the finishing refrain of â€œ best to catch a cab..â€� Public transport is never even mentioned. We were meet with quizzical looks of amazement by the staff when we said that we had â€œwalkedâ€� to the Farmers Market that day.. We later found out the reason for the looks of wonder. Despite its body beautiful reputation, apparently, only hobos and the criminally insane walk in LA. Concierge was every bit as professional as the rest of the staff. The Stone Rose lounge is â€œHollywood moodyâ€� with its mix of red and black and a great place to have a drink before dinner, and it is dinner, breakfast and lunch where this hotel excels! In other words their restaurant Simon LA is a â€œmust eat at!â€� My wife and I ate there often in the evening and had breakfast there every morning. No matter the time, the staff is always happy to see you. In the morning we were asked if â€œweâ€™d had a good night?â€� And in the evenings we were asked: â€œwhat we had done during the day?â€� They really made you feel as if you were welcome. In a lot of hotels itâ€™s the hotel that makes you feel as if they are doing you a favour by providing you with a bed and a meal for the night-not so the Sofitel LA nor Simon LAsâ€™ A couple of things that struck us about Simonâ€™s where, when you sit down of evening, water arrives, and then a complementary bread basked is served. Now, this is a practice that has sadly died out in most Australian restaurants around the drawn of the last ice-age. For a complementary bread basket it was a substantial offering of crisp breads and rolls that would have drawn a main course price tag in most restaurants we have eaten at. This one small jester by our host demonstrates their commitment to hospitality and putting the guest at the centre of the eveningâ€™s activities. There is a misnomer about America and American cuisine in particular, it being that America is: the land the â€œvegetable forgotâ€� and that Americaâ€™s only contribution to the dining plates of the world is ground beef sandwiched between two sweetened buns. So much more is happening in the kitchen of Simon LA! Whether you pick the â€œroasted young beatsâ€� or the â€œhamachi crudoâ€� each of the dishes is prepared with aplomb by a kitchen crew at the top of their game and delivered by a floor staff every bit in sync with the direction the restaurant wants to head. I can also highly recommend the â€œmeatloafâ€�, the â€œbrick roasted chickenâ€� or anyone of the wafer light pizzas (we had them all.) The cool sophisticated surroundings, matched by the great service of a wonderful meal was a great way to end a day in LA. As far as breakfast was concerned the stand out for me was the â€œtortilla wrapâ€� the light egg matched with the spicy chorizo sausage and the lovely hot dipping sauce was a real wake up â€œLA style.â€� We also received a complimentary Danish pastries for breakfast. Here again a lovely touch. So after all that is the Sofitel LA perfect? No. One small example, the remote control for the clock radio in the room wasnâ€™t working ( flat battery or something.)I asked if someone could take a look? Yes of course right away. Five days later as we checked out, the remote control still wasnâ€™t working. This is nothing more than the tiniest of flyâ€™s in what was on the hole a wonderful ointment of hospitability and service that the Sofitel LA tries to apply liberally to all its guests. Would we stay there again? You bet we would!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Great Hotel. Happy to Return, Highest Recommendation”
Reviews.Author: mrfoxycat
Reviews.Content: Just Completed My Stay at Sofitel, Los Angeles. Arrived in the Rain, Politely and Professionally Greeted by Valet and Doorperson. Fast, Easy, Efficient. The Hotel is located on the corner of Beverly Blvd / La Cienega Blvd between Beverly Hills and West Hollywood. The Beverly Center, with all Kinds of Stores, Retail and Shops, Including Macy's, Bloomingdales, etc. is right across the Street and Cedar-Sinai Medical Center is a 2 Minute Walk away across the Street. Much Shopping in the Area, Local Streets and Nearby Beverly Hills is a Short Cab Away or Can Be Easily Walked for those So Inclined. The Club and Bar Scene in West Hollywood is just a short cab-ride away. Can Easily Walk to These Places as Well. Many other Stores, Retail Adventures, Restaurants and Eating Places are easily within walking distance. Park Your Car with the Hotel Valet and Walk Most Places. Much Easier and Much More Simple. Takes a Lot of the Hassle out of Everything if You are New and Do Not Know the area. Fun to Walk around and Explore the Area, People Watch, Shop, etc.. Check In was Quick and Easy. I was Amazed that Before I knew It, I had My Room Key and Was Ready to Go. BOOM!!@@## My Room Was Basic but Very Very Excellent, Well Appointed, Clean, Neat, Impeccable. A Great Place to Just lay there and Watch TV. Read a Book or Magazine, Have Room Service or Do Nothing after a Long, Difficult Day. No Noise, Quiet, Great View. Bed Very Comforable, Big, Very Cozy. 32 LCD TV, desk and chair, "walk-in" closet AND shower. No tub. L'occitane amenities. I was Super Impressed. Great Job. Great Business Center for Email Access and Internet. Efficient, Well Organized, Excellent Top of the Line Equipment. I ate Breakfast Every Day at Norms on La Cienega and IHOP on Santa Monica Blvd. both of which are A short walk from the Hotel. La Cienega as well as Santa Monica Blvd are Full of Hip, Cool, Trendy Shops and Restaurants. Great People Watching. Had A Blast. I Also Had Dinner Every Night in the Restaurant. Bottom Line, Outstanding in Every Respect. Outstanding. I Did not want to Waste time going anywhere else. Outstanding Service, Presentation, Value, Atmosphere and Hospitality. Outstanding. Outstanding. They Made Me Spagetti with Meat Sauce Several Nights which was Just as Good As My Own, if Not Better. I also Asked for Help from My Server for a Desert Recommendation Every Time and They were Bang On Every time. I had what they recommended and wow !!@@## was it Terrific. Outstanding Beyond Belief. Outstanding. I took Several of My Business Associates to the Restaurant while there and they Were Very Very Satisfied. Could Not be Better. Management, Guest Relations, Conciere, Bar and Restaurant Staff Nothing Short of TOP of the Line. Highest Recommendation. Highest Recommendation. Check out was quick and easy. Check it Out.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible....”
Reviews.Author: momeve
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to stay at the Sofitel on our 10 year anniversary last Friday. We are local and just wanted to get away from our two little kids for a night to celebrate. I had initially booked a deluxe room and my husband said we should just get a suite. When we got there, we told them it is our 10 year anniversary and that we would love to get a suite and will pay the difference. We were told there are no suites available and were given the key to our deluxe room. We went upstairs to find our deluxe room to be TINY!!! No bath tub, just a shower and small!!! We called downstairs saying we would really like a larger toom and that we will pay the difference at which point they said they have a suite but for $300 extra a night (total $550/night). No problem, we take it. We get to our suite (very average and againon the smaller side) and we call for champagne glasses to open our specail bottle, they show up with a bucket of ice and glasses and they have a bill for $4.39!!!! Any other half decent hotel would send something up to the room of a couple who are spending their 10th anniversary there but no, not even a fruit bowl and we have a bill for glasses??? A few other things also happened, little, but showcased how the service is lacking. When leaving, I asked to speak to the manager and told her how disappointed we were at the service and she offered to take the charge off, wait for this.... for the glasses!!!! I was like " it is not a matter of four bucks, we paid $550 a night, we are not fussing over four dollars but the poor service". She did not even begin to get it. Poor poor service. We have travelled all over the world and was shocked over how a hotel can treat guests like this... Will never go back, there are plenty of other great hotels in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Sofitel , Would absolutly return”
Reviews.Author: Awesome__x
Reviews.Content: Myself and my Mam decided to go on a girls trip to Los Angeles. As we had never been before we based our hotel choice on reviews on tripadvisor. The Sofitel was brilliant , check in was quick and hassle-free , the rooms were always sparkling clean ( the beds are amazingly comfortable) and big enough for the amount of time spent in them. The cleaning service was great, we never saw them but the whole hotel was in great condition. (free bottles of water ever night aswell) The men working on valet and door service are great , if you need a taxi one will be there in less that 2 minutes, no joke!! The Location is great, right across the road from the Beverly Centre , CVS pharmacy , resturants ( P.F Changs is a MUST), Robertson Blvd is only a 10-15 minute walk away. Although as LA is very spread out you must drive to all major attractions like Hollywood blvd , etc . Which is like a 10 minute drive. The one downside to the hotel is that room service is over-priced for what you get, i would recommend running over to the beverly centre and get take out ! Over all this hotel is great , i would definitely recommend it to a friend and I will be returning in the very near future. Tourist Tip- do as many tours as you can it will be unforgettable , but the shopping in L.A isn't great unless your loaded . If you're travelling to LA in basketball season I would recommend trying to get tickets to a Lakers game , the staples centre is amazing , and the atmosphere is electric.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in America”
Reviews.Author: Shruggy
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for shopping (Beverley Centre across the road) and short cab ride to Melrose along with a cracking restaurant and bar means this hotel offers all the plushness you'd expect in Hollywood. The bellmen are beyond lovely, always smiling and helpful and not greedily expecting a tip (a bug bear of most US places for us British). The beds are the most comfortable I have ever stayed in and having discovered on this site you can buy the linen I am placing an order now for the pillows! There's also a spa and a fantastic roof-top pool. Don't say anywhere else in LA - this is the best.

Reviews.Title: “Not comfortable not sccomodating”
Reviews.Author: Abs66
Reviews.Content: Was given a smoking room when I requested nonsmoking so room smelled terrible. No effort to accomodate. Carpets stained. Pillows lumpy. $29 daily parking fee and no easy place to park otherwise as crowded corner next to Beverly center. Cool lobby. Okay view of Hollywood hills. Was okay price on hotwire, but would never recommend nor stay again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Sofitel LA”
Reviews.Author: Mom2rascals
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd visit to LA and we wanted to stay in West Hollywood this time. I researched long and hard on TA and decided on Sofitel for its location. And we are very happy with our decision. Every staff we met, from the check-in staff, the bell-hop, chamber maids to the valet service staff, provided impeccable and warm service. We were made to feel very welcome there even though we had booked our room through Hotwire. Our request for a high room was also met. We got a room on the 9th floor that faced the Beverly Center. So we didn't experience any disturbances from party noises from the bar as some other reviewers mentioned. The room itself was very lovely and clean. I loved its modern classic decor! While the beds were a little too soft for our taste, we still found them comfortable and slept very well in them. The bathroom was spacious enough and also very clean. We loved the L'Occitane amenities and also the fact that the toilet flushed very quietly :-). Its location was also ideal to our planned activities so that was another plus. We went to the nearby King's Road Cafe, which was very good, for breakfast once and ate twice at the in-house restaurant, Simon LA, once for breakfast and once for lunch. We had wanted to order room service for the breakfast but found that it was much, much better value eating at the restaurant itself. The food and service was excellent both times. I highly recommend it. The only thing I didn't like about it was the valet-only parking which was rather costly, though comparable to other 4*-5* hotels. Otherwise, we loved everything else.

Reviews.Title: “Love It!”
Reviews.Author: luvsundbeach
Reviews.Content: Really like this hotel!! The location is just right - close to everywhere you want to be in LA. The rooms although on the small side have all the expected features of a 5* hotel and the beds (have to confess I am a fan of the Sofitel MyBeds) is absolutely fabulous. The staff, in special the bellman, doormen and room service are the friendliest you will encounter worldwide. They do make you feel welcome every time, and although you still encounter some â€œsnottyâ€� treatment itâ€™s easily overlooked if you take into consideration that majority of people are really, really nice and helpful. The Bar "Stone Rose" manages to stay quite the hot spot - and is great to enjoy a drink with friends. I have to say that the only sour note is realy the quality of room service food, its so, so, but not what you expect at a hotel of this quality. At least ist not totally overpriced. All in allâ€¦another fabulous stay at Sofitel LA.

Reviews.Title: “Girls night out at the Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: pigeonvoyager
Reviews.Content: Guess what! we had a great time out in the Sofitel Bev Hills bar and Lounge. The have a very nice out door area with space heaters, fire pits, and an outdoor bartender. It's got the best location for shop-a-holics just across the street is the famous Beverly Center!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Property- Sofitel Luxury”
Reviews.Author: worldsmyhome
Reviews.Content: We found this property to be truly wonderful. Staff: We arrived late at night and found the staff friendly and helpful. We were greeted at taken to reception by a porter, the reception staff greeted us and were prompt. We were then escorted to our room. The concierge were knowledgeable and helpful. We were giving maps and detailed directions, and had a tour booked for us at the last minute. They also called us in our room when the tour arrived to pick us up. Rooms: The rooms are very modern, luxurious and very comfortable. The beds as heavenly- what you would expect from the Sofitel SoBeds. The mattresses are firm, however they put a feather and down duvet under the sheets so you feel like you are sleeping on a cloud. The bathrooms are a great size with large shower and vanity. The rooms have floor to ceiling glass windows which over look Beverly Hills and the Hollywood sign. The bathroom amenities are roger and gallet, TV's are large flatscreen. We found that there was no noise at all. Restaurant: The Simon LA was great for breakfast- food was fantastic, not over priced for a hotel. The decor was stunning, very modern and comfortable. And again the service was great. Location: The Beverly Centre is just across the road. All major attractions not far. We would definitely stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “so-fine!”
Reviews.Author: travelpassion789
Reviews.Content: Really great hotel. Nice Modern Atmosphere. Right by Rodeo and Robertson. Great Restaurant and Bar, and AMAZING Spa. Cannot stress this enough. Definitely a great pick.

Reviews.Title: “Home sweet home”
Reviews.Author: snailumm
Reviews.Content: What can I say, every time I stay in LA it has to be here, great location, rooms and service.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: maggis
Reviews.Content: Had a great 5 nights stay in October. After a 45min wait, while having a nice cup of coffee in the restaurant, weâ€™re checked in to a nice room with view of the Hollywood sign. As usual for Sofitel the room was impeccably clean, the bed excellent and bathroom quite large with good quality amenities. Tried the restaurant several times and the food was always good. What makes this hotel really amazing is the staff. Everyone we met seemed to really enjoy their work, made us feel welcome and helped us with all our requests. The receptionists even offered to buy stamps for us when we wanted to send some postcards during check out and they didnâ€™t have any stamps left. A special thanks to Allyson for serving us breakfast with a smile, Sam for helping us out with our dinner reservations, and the doorman working evenings who always was ready for a chat while we waited for our car (unfortunately we never got his name, but he was humming and in a very good mood). Will definitely return next time weâ€™re in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel near Bev Center”
Reviews.Author: pdx2006
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Sofitel LA while in town for business in the Bev Center, which is conveniently located across the street. The lobby is small but adequate, and includes the entrance to the Stone Rose Lounge. The room I stayed in was quite large, and was complete with an incredibly comfortable bed and a gorgeous bathroom with a rain shower head. I also had a beautiful view of the hills and the Hollywood sign (my room was on a higher floor). There was a school across the street which did get a little noisy during the morning hours and lunchtime. The Stone Rose Lounge was a good place to grab a drink, but the staff was rather surly at times. I would stay here again, but only on the company's dime.

Reviews.Title: “Classy, Convenient, Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: dysphorichousewife
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three days with clients. The service and location were great - the restaurant was excellent but a bit pricey - across the street from a fabulous mall - other shops and restaurants (the Ivy, etc) within walking distance - only complaint is having to pay for internet! The staff went above and beyond to accomodate my requests for a last minute group meeting. (The restaurant has a private room in the back that can accomodate about 12 people) The room layout was one of my favorites - very comfortable bed, large desk, flat screen tv, big sink with plenty of counter space, huge walk in shower with a window so you can see the tv (and hear the audio) while showering under a fabulous large rain showerhead with great water pressure. Also had a large walk in closet with many hangers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel (excellent bed!!)”
Reviews.Author: burge_83
Reviews.Content: This was the first hotel of three during our travels around california and after an arduous and long journey from western australia we were very pleased with the hotel. The check-in people were prompt and he put us on a high floor with a view of the hollywood sign! The bed was so comfy, you sank right into it and it was just what we needed. The room was immaculate with the exception of a broken light in the bathroom (with some tools on the side). That first night we had room service and got a pizza and some fries - absolutely gorgeous!! The only negative was that things were a little pricey and the breakfast had the 18% tip which you usually have added in parties of 6 or more added anyways and then you were expected to tip ontop of that!! But otherwise it was a lovely hotel with a great location.

Reviews.Title: “chic and clean”
Reviews.Author: EvergreenColorado
Reviews.Content: Chic, clean, good service - great business conference center for groups of 200 or less

Reviews.Title: “Top notch service and location, everything else a notch below...”
Reviews.Author: RomualdLA
Reviews.Content: Great location for visiting LA. Very good neighborhood, lots of cool places within walking or short driving distance - Restaurant row on La Cienega, Melrose, Hollywood, Sunset Strip, Rodeo Drive. Service is the best I've seen so far - everyone goes out of their way to ensure pleasant experience. For the price, however, (and that includes $40+ valet parking, no other option to park) rooms are on the small side, can be noisy, Wi-Fi not free.

Reviews.Title: “Grate Hotel fantastic personel comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: panosmon
Reviews.Content: Sofitel Hotel Los Angeles West Hollywood Location: As LA is such an enormous and wide city , there is NOWAY to be able to explore it by foot . There is also no metro. So its obvious that no one can find a location through wich he could explore a big part of the city (as one can do in NY).The hotel itself lays in a very good location, itâ€™s a good and clean area , just opposite to a very big Mall , only 15 minutes walking from Rodeo Drive and Farmers Market .With many good restaurants close to it. Amenities .Nice and clean rooms with some of the most comfortable beds I ever found in a hotel (no balconies) , tasteful breakfast and food with a very friendly personnel , even a bar is available. Gym and SPA also there but I didnâ€™t try them Personnel: Kind, friendly and very helpful staff . One of the best concierge office I ever found in this kind of a hotel. They helped me very much with several problems I had to deal with (they got me a car to drive from Las Vegas back to LA, they kept our luggageâ€™s with no fee for a five days period when we went to another country , they proposed good and inexpensive organized excursions to LA, Universal studios etc) Cost : We paid a fee of 259 US$ per night (aprox 177 Euros) which in my view was a very good price considering the service, the amenities and the brand name of the Hotel If I had to mention some negative points, one was that the hotel was a bit noisy especially the last night there was a party in the ground floor bar which kept us awaken although we were at the seventh floor. Also free wifi internet was not available and I had to pay some 8$ per day to a hotspot.

Reviews.Title: “Best Views Best Location”
Reviews.Author: anchorruud
Reviews.Content: What a great place, I have never felt so pampered in my life! The resturant had the best breakfast I have ever had in my life... I mean really... both my children and husband thought so also! I am very impressed with the Sofitel brand and would love to visit some of the their other hotels. The room had had the best views, the bathroom was large and it had all the little ammenities I look for in a hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Usual high level of service and good location”
Reviews.Author: venatoris
Reviews.Content: This Sofitel is what you'd expect from this chain, it is clean, modern, efficient and the service is good, though the formality of the staff can be a little off-putting at times. Location is great for shopping, it is opposite the Beverley Center, and the Grove and Beverly Hills shops are not too far to get to. First timers to LA might like to know the Silverline bus tours pick up there as well. The views on the north side of the hotel on the upper floors are great. We were originally put on a lower floor on the other side, having been told that a non-smoking king bed was not available only two doubles. It didn't take long to realise that the layout of that room with the two beds one against a wall and the other too close to the large windows was not ideal. After a short and polite complaint they offered us an upgraded room on a higher floor and on the north side, which id a great mark of their service, and the roon was excellent. Only slight disappointment was the bar, it was overly large and dark, the range of beer in particular was poor, and the service was relatively lacking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Room, but some weird service issues......”
Reviews.Author: dre51
Reviews.Content: We stayed here since it's just a few block from our daughter's new apartment in the Beverly/Fairfax area and we wanted to stay at a really nice place after five days of driving cross country. Plus side: #1. Location is great, right across from the Beverly Center and convenient to everything. #2. The room, though smallish, was beautiful, with plush bedding and swanky furnishings. The shower is large and the view was too cool - the Hollywood sign gleaming in the distance. The air conditioning is quiet and efficient, and the balcony doors really open! #3. The bar, though pricey, is worth it just to hang out on the over stuffed sofas and chairs. #4. Outstanding fitness center! Excellent equipment. Negative side: #1. Turn down service offered too early - on two nights the housekeeping staff showed up for turn down around 5PM when we were still getting ready to go out. On BOTH occasions, we said, "Can you please come back later?" They never did, so we didn't get fresh towels either night. #2. Previously worn bath robe? - after a shower my husband went to the closet and put on a large, fluffy robe and reached into the pocket where he found someone's swim goggles. We could only conclude that this robe had been used by a previous occupant. We called to report the problem and a staff member came to our room and presented us with two bars of soap and some shampoo and conditioner! Huh?? We called again and they came back to the room with two bath robes and asked us to produce the swim goggles as evidence. I hope some poor housekeeper didn't get flogged with them.... #3. Valet took our car out and left it sitting in the driveway - our daughter picked us up in her own car and as we were leaving I noticed our car sitting next to the Valet stand with all the windows rolled down. My husband asked them why our car was there and they said we had called for it. Obviously we had not. We asked them to put it back. To their credit, they didn't charge us for one night's parking. These were really minor issues and I would definitely say the pluses outweighed the negatives. It's a beautiful property.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: ejboldt
Reviews.Content: We decided to splurge and stay at the Sofitel this time in LA when we came for a wedding. We usually stay in budget (Holiday Inn Express or Best Western) level hotels, because we're not in the room much, but since it was a special occasion and we were staying for 5 nights, we spent the extra money and treated ourselves. The door, front desk, conceirge and valet service from the time we pulled up in a cab to the time we left in our rental car was great and very friendly. I have several complaints that might seem a little nit-picky, but they did effect our experience. First off, we reserved their "superior" room which I guess is the smallest room they have and the smallness was uncomfortable. The room was nicely decorated and the bathroom was cool and the bed super comfy, but because the bed is a platform bed and because the room is small and they put a chair at the end of the bed, I left there with a huge bump and bruise on my left shin and one on my right calf from banging into the corner of the bed. Nice look with a cocktail dress for a wedding.... I found it very annoying - and painful. Two weeks later I still have the bruises. The shower is a rain shower, which is incredibly relaxing and I loved it, but again it's the little things that make the difference. It was nearly impossible to shave one's legs in the shower because it's a stall shower and there is no foot rest, which might seem like a petty thing, but any woman over 35 knows what I mean. Finally, they have the duvet thing going on. I don't understand the obsession with duvets these days, because you have a choice of being hot or cold with nothing in between. So, in the Sofitel on the bed they have a bottom sheet and a duvet. No sheet in between your body and the duvet. I hope they clean them everytime someone checks out. So, because I'm always hot and my husband is always cold, we did not sleep well that first night. The second day we called housekeeping, but you can't talk to housekeeping, only the front desk and asked for a top sheet in addition to the bottom sheet and duvet. We got a scratchy blanket. It was too late to do anything that night, so another uncomfortable night. Third day we asked for a top sheet, no blanket and received another blanket. We called again and asked for a top sheet and have the 3 blankets taken away. The housekeeper showed up with 2 more blankets. At least this time we could explain what we wanted and the poor woman had to strip the bed and add the top sheet. After that we were comfortable and slept well. On the positive side, we requested by email and were given a room with a view of the hills and the hotel was really very quiet. For service (except for passing messages along to housekeeping), location and amenities, I give this hotel two thumbs up. For the size of a regular room, thumbs down.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice room, obsequious service”
Reviews.Author: hinalani
Reviews.Content: The most important part of this hotel -- the bed and the bathroom -- were outstanding. The service was excellent if you enjoy overstaffed slavish fawning. Personally, I found it annoying and unprofessional, but I'm not an LA native, so perhaps I wasn't acclimated. Room service food was good and valets were quick, and everything was overpriced. The gym was only ok. They ran out of towels and water frequently.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, Awesome Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: rm996s
Reviews.Content: Just what you would expect from a trendy Beverly Hills Hotel. The rooms were full of high tech trendy devices like the HD TV's and the LED lights throughout the room. The shower in my room was out of this world. The location is also what sells this place, you are right across from the mall and it has plenty of food and shopping within a few minutes walk. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “terrific service, room and location”
Reviews.Author: pkamison
Reviews.Content: We booked through an internet site - got a terrific rate - had 2 rooms next door to each other in the rear facing the Hollywood sign. The room was large, very well appointed , very comfortable and an excellent bath. All in all an excellent place. The valet car service was terrific (and friendly). We ate up the street for breakfest at local cafes anfd they were great and down the street at the deli for a late night feast - terrific!

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Best Sofitel I have stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: dk18
Reviews.Content: As a frequent traveller and someone who tends to stay in Sofitel hotels whenever possible, I was amazed. This really is a fantastic hotel. My stay was for five nights and I used the valet services for the duration, I didnâ€™t find $29 for 24 hours unreasonable and found the service to be prompt. Door staff welcome you back to the hotel with a simple â€˜Bonjourâ€™ whilst a further line of staff ask about your day. I even had a member of staff run to push the elevator button, such great service. Concierge booked restaurants at exclusive restaurants with ease and a hand written letter was pushed under the room door to confirm. If management do read this, they should be extremely happy with the service their staff provide. As an A Club Gold holder; a bottle of bubbly and chocolate dipped strawberries was waiting in the room, which had also been upgraded. Room was superb, view of the Hollywood sign and hills, the perfect Sofitel Bed, Bose radio, HDTV, rain shower etc. Turndown service at night left bottles of Evian but this fell short of my experience at the Sofitel New York where classical music was playing, curtains drawn, chocolates on bed and water. Ate at Simon LA twice, great service and beautiful fillet mignon. Also had breakfast everyday, which was typical Sofitel. With breakfast, parking, room and tax it worked out at $380 a night, money well spent. Donâ€™t consider any other hotel, this was pure perfection. Now a reason to returnâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “Another Sofitel Gem”
Reviews.Author: Hollywood1973
Reviews.Content: On the basis of previous reviews and recommendations from friends I decided to take stay in West Hollywood @ the Sofitel. A clean, crisp, modern take with simply brillant staff. It was a joy to return here after touring the everyday. I am an A-club "GOLD" member and they really took notice of that and gave us the usual advantages which other Sofitels have forgotten. The use of free internet in the lobby is a god send when you have left the notebook at home. The restaurant "Simon" was excellent and well worth staying in house for a brillant meal. Other notable points would include that the "valet charge" is a bit hefty but the crew were very efficient and had our vehicle up in no time. One little problem was the spa neglected to contact my partner back after an initial enquiry not once but twice over two days. It wasn't until I spoke with a front desk manager and voiced my opinion that my partner received some service. This was the only fault of a very well located, priced, well staffed hotel. By the way, you just have to love those Sofitel beds and pillows.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels we have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: whereismeg
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived we were greeted by lovely staff. Check in was a breeze, bags were brought up immediately and staff ever so helpful. Room was spotless. I loved the window from the shower that you could see through to the TV. A flick of a switch would change the window to non-see through if you wanted privacy. When we exited the lift and headed to reception to ask a question, there was always 3 staff there ready to walk you to reception to answer your enquiry. We requested a late check out, which could not be granted, but as we were not entitled to this it did not change our view of the hotel. Of course the hotel was happy to store our bags for us all day, as our flights did not leave until late at night. When we were ready for the airport, the staff asked if we needed a taxi, and then suggested for a few dollars more we could have a private car, which we took them up on. Two minutes later a lovely black car was there ready to take us to the airport. The driver told us that a well known band was staying at the hotel (which would explain why it seemed busy) but the hotel was so quiet, you never would have known it was at full occupancy. Did not check out the restaurant or bar, as we just ran out of time. There is no other place for us to stay when we come back to LA. Excellent location opposite the Beverly Centre. The DASH Hollywood and Fairfax leaves from the corner and the Hop on Hop off Hollywood bus stops across the road. $10 cab ride from Framers Market/Grove.

Reviews.Title: “Great View!”
Reviews.Author: SurreyTraveller58
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights, and requested a Hills View room ... glad we did as I think the rooms with views of the Beverley Centre wouldn't have been nearly as good. Fantastic shower lets you look out through the bedroom to the hills ... very unusual. As ever with Sofitel, great service and super comfy bed resulted in another "thumbs up" from us

Reviews.Title: “loved it!”
Reviews.Author: chinkyspice-007
Reviews.Content: I just had a 3 night stay at the sofitel in L.A. I found my room to be perfect for a solo traveller. The bathroom was well stocked with lots of towels which gets major brownie points, plus 2 frette bathrobes and slippers,nice toiletries and there was an electronic safe in the closet as well as iron and sewing kits. I had room service once and breakfast in room twice. I didnt get the feeling that simon L.A is really a single travellers place to go but a lot of the room service menu is apparently served there..i recommend the braised short ribs. I also got to meet the said celeb chef in the lift and he was very charming. The concierge team are fantastic esp megan and claudia, they really know L.A and how to get into the more popular restaurants! As for location the massive beverly mall is opposite and has most shops you would want inside, the grove and farmers market are near too, the red line tour bus actually stops opposite the hotel which is easy for those who dont know the area. The only bad point was the mix up with the extra night i requested at check in. this has since been passed to the management and all resolved in a very professional and polite way which helped the decision to visit next year when i return

Reviews.Title: “Nice place nice location”
Reviews.Author: AsianTraveler2009
Reviews.Content: Clean nice hotel in the middle of LA. The rooms were nice and ready when I got there. The staff are very friendly and nice. The gym was smaller than I expected. But everything was great, including room service. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: maribr
Reviews.Content: I have stayed twice at this hotel and I really liked. The service and the location are perfect!! The only thing I didnÂ´t like was the bed.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: napple
Reviews.Content: I can't believe the bad reviews that have recently been posted on this site. I've just come back from a 3 night stay at the Sofitel in Los Angeles and I have (almost) nothing to complain about. The hotel location is good - close to shopping at the beverly centre and the grove, close to west hollywood and sunset for going out and a short drive to lots of LA's popular spots ($12 cab to Rodeo Drive, $14 cab to the Hollywood Bowl). The public areas of the hotel are beautiful. Very sleek and modern. The staff on reception were extremely professional and very helpful. There is no free wireless internet in the hotel but there are free computers to use at the business centre and in the gym. The room was great - clean, well appointed, spacious and with a very nice bathroom. Only odd thing was the very loud echo in the bathroom, it was like being in a tunnel. Let's just say you can hear everything nicely amplified in the bedroom... People have mentioned the restaurant/bar area and the "night club" noise. I was there for 3 nights (including weekend) and it was empty... so I don't know where the club was going on. The pool area is on the rooftop of the second floor and is small. The pool is a great temperature though, just perfect for me as I often find outdoor pools a little chilly. There were nice loungers and the poolside service was good. Only complaint is that as it's on the second floor, there is a lot of noise from the street below so it takes away from the relaxation. Not much the hotel can do about this I guess. The fitness centre in the hotel is remarkable, really one of the best gyms I've seen in a hotel ever. They also provide free bottles of evian and chilled towels. Really well done. My only real complaint about this hotel is the parking. There is no self-park option so you are forced to use the Valet service which is VERY expensive at almost $30 a day. I really do think this is excessive. That said, I got a great deal on this hotel on Hotwire for only $110 a night so I can't complain!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel great staff good location”
Reviews.Author: kayc63
Reviews.Content: Good location for shopping and touring. Friendly staff that let us check into our rooms very early which we did not expect. Food at restaurant good. Rooms comfy and modern. Close to Beverly Centre, The Grove, Melrose and Sunset strip,can walk to all. Kayc63

Reviews.Title: “Great location - another sure win Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: jolly999
Reviews.Content: Just a brief note to say that the Sofitel chain are, in my experience, producing really good mid priced luxury hotels, Staffing is excellent, locations are first class and the designs are modern and fresh. I have stayed in Melbourne, Sydney and Los Angeles with them in the last twelve months and this hotel represents great value.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Room and view”
Reviews.Author: SoInLoVe1899
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 4 day stay in the Sofitel. I loved LA and I love the Sofitel. We have a viwn of the Hills and it was so beautiful in the night and in the day. The rooms were awesome esp the bathroom. Loved the shower! The bed was sooo comfortable too. The service was also top notch. We didnt eat at the restauant Simon LA but it looked pretty nice. The location could have been better but I would definalty stay there again no question. LA was great can't wait to return!!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: california_trip09
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights at the end of our trip in california. LA isnt really my kind of place, as its not the kind of place you go for a wander, you need to drive everywhere which is why I gave it 4/5 stars for location, but Im not sure where else i would have liked to stay in LA as Beverley Hills seems like the nicest area to stay, but it takes a while to get to the beach. The hotel itself was really nice and modern, the pool is outdoor and heated but small, but the terrace around the pool was really nice with big comfy loungers and quite cool round loungers and flat screens (very LA!). The only thing that annoyed me is both the constant seeking of tips and the parking, as Valet parking seemed to be $29/day. We stayed in one other hotel in LA the night before and looked around a few, and the expensive parking and seeking of tips seems pretty consistent everywhere. Anyway, to save a few quid we parked across the road in the beverley centre (big shopping centre), and at nights we parked in the road behind the hotel for free until 7am. The beverley centre was good for shopping and had some good value restaurants on the ground floor. I would recommend this hotel as a nice place to stay in LA and we got good value through expedia.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED THE HOTEL.”
Reviews.Author: dylannnx3
Reviews.Content: Wellll, my family and I stayed in the penthouse suite, and it was AMAZING. our hotel looked right at the mall and the city, and I loved it. would DEFINITELY go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel close to but not walking distance from all the great spots.”
Reviews.Author: Taniquan
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for three nights under a â€œstay for three nights and pay for twoâ€� special. All in all it is a very nice hotel with nice rooms and everything else that goes with a 4 star hotel. Service by everyone from valet, concierge, to bellman was great. There are three computers off the lobby open 24 hours on which there is free internet. If you want wifi in you room you have to pay for it. The pool is small and not very lavish although it is very warm and I had no problems getting a cot. The â€œbalconyâ€� they refer to in the advertisements is a literally 12 inch space between the French doors and the gate. It is only good for standing on to see what the weather is like. The negatives I found were that it is walking distance from the Beverly Center but nothing else. And there are homeless beggars all around the hotel so if you want to walk anywhere be prepared to deal with them. And the Beverly Center is such a blasÃ© shopping mall it does really adds nothing to the hotel. The real great shopping is in the Rodeo Dive area in Beverly Hills which is only 10 minutes away but you have to drive. So if you donâ€™t mind calling your car up from valet parking, driving 10 minutes and then finding parking in the Rodeo Drive area, this world not present a problem for you. The other thing that bothered me about the hotel is that two â€œfree drinkâ€� tickets I got at check-in for use in the nightclub could only be used for alcoholic drinks. I could not redeem them for bottled water, a Coke or Sprite. The waitress said I could get Champaign or some other alcoholic drink but nothing else. So since I do not drink alcohol I just tossed the tickets. I have no idea why the hotel puts this limitation on its free drinks but it really offended me. Do I ended up just tossing the â€œfree alcoholic drinkâ€� tickets. Now would I stay there again? I cannot say I would. I like a hotel where I can walk out the front door and be in the center of everything. In Beverly Hills this would be the Beverly Wiltshire-but at twice the price of the Sofitel it would be a hard decision. On a note of â€œwhat to see on the way to the hotelâ€� stop at Bristol Farms about a mile or two down Beverly Ave from the hotel. I have never seen such an upscale, posh, esoteric, expensive grocery store in my life. It makes Whole Foods look like a soup kitchen on Skid Row. In front of me in line was a celebrity movie producer with a grocery cart of goat cheese, caviar and the like which totaled over $1300. This is a great place to get some take out and just to see where the rich shop.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: MissPlanner
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic! Wonderful location, you can walk anywhere. The hotel food is a little pricey, but the rooms are beautiful. It was a relaxing and wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely go back to Sofitel...”
Reviews.Author: DainaMac
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel for only one night (sadly) in August. I booked the room based on cost and vicinity to the Price is Right taping. The service at the front desk was exceptionally courteous from check in, to calling a cab for us at 4 am, until the time we checked out in the morning. Our room was on an upper floor with an great view of Hollywood Hills. The room was on the small side, but very clean and sufficient for our needs. Unfortuately, we didn't have time to check out the pool area (maybe next time). But the outdoor lounge area was amazing!!! We had a nice glass of wine in one of the chic little cabana areas. It was a very relaxing place to unwind after our flight from the east coast. After drinks we went back to the room since we had to get to CBS Studios early in the morning. For those interested in the Price is Right taping, the Sofitel was a quick cab ride to the CBS Studios. The bed was so comfortable, it was like sleeping on a big fluffy marshmallow! We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Sofitel and we will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room”
Reviews.Author: sand4c
Reviews.Content: There is a significant amount of noise from the street. I had a room facing the Beverly Center mall which is right across the mall. Staff was reasonably friendly. I did find several feathers on the floor, presumably from dusting. Some of the furniture was dated and showed signs of age such as peeling in the wooden tables.There appeared to be no concierge or front desk on duty during the early morning between 5 and 6am. There was a stocked mini-bar with very expensive items but no refrigerator although there was a note that stated that you can contact guest services to arrange for a refrigeration solution. The room service menu was supposed to have both an English and a French section, but there was only a French language section. There is valet-only parking which I didn't use.The hotel is opposite the Beverly Center which has a huge parking garage but does not allow overnight parking although I don't think there's anyone to enforce that. The guest services operator was fairly helpful with my questions. I do think the prices are just too high to pay for them by yourself. I'm lucky that someone else paid for my hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Wow - good value for Beverly Hills”
Reviews.Author: busybine
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended. This hotel has it all! Incredible design, comfy beds, a bath room to die for. The only negative is; the bathroom has no ventilation. The humidity can't go anywhere and is 'killing' the light bulbs.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Luxury”
Reviews.Author: mustangmel
Reviews.Content: This hotel seems to be brand new and maybe that's why we got such a good deal. The design is ultra modern and the rooms are extremely unique as the bed is at an angle and there is window between the shower and the room! There's also a unique "balcony" inside the room. The hotel features a restaurant with a chef from the Iron Chef TV show and has a nice Night Club as well. Awesome drinks at this nightclub and they have a patio with cabanas and a fire pit. Problems: Don't stay here unless you are going to the nightclub on Fri or Sat or unless you don't mind falling asleep to booty music. Also, its across the street from Cedars-Sinai so on Sat night we got to hear sirens all night! All in all it really was not that bad for us though. The hotel was definitely the best bang for your buck I've ever got in LA. Try it out!

Reviews.Title: “Confortable”
Reviews.Author: Cenobre
Reviews.Content: The hotel is new, very confortable and good service. If you are tall, be aware that some rooms have short showers! Good location.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: tantam0unt
Reviews.Content: The location is great for us. The hotel is right across of the Beverly Center (mall). Nearby is Long Drugs (opens 24 hrs). About 15 minutes (by car) away from Hollywood/Beverly Hill area. Valet is $29 with unlimited in/out privileges-they are very fast getting our car up. Check in was fast and friendly-our agent walked us to the elevator (nice touch). The lobby was small, the lights were always dimmed-kind of dark for me. Concierge desk looks pretty nice. (the map that we received is not clear-very confusing). Room-we got two full beds- facing the Beverly Center/Front of the Hotel. We loved the balconies, the flat screen TV, Bose ipod dock, and the user friendly in-room safe. Mini Bar-beWARE! It has an automatic sensor. We didn't like how bathroom door doesnâ€™t shut all the way. Every time we close the bathroom door, there's a big crack giving us no privacy- I had to place towels between those crack. Pool-we love the pool hour-7am until 10pm! we love the sundeck- it's always clean! The pool itself is small, but it 5 feet deep. oh yeah...they had "cabana" with flat screen TVs-it kind of blurry though. The kids loved the staff- they feel very pampered every time we get to our car..the doorman, the bellman, the valet attendant always prepared to open the door and greet us. Complimentary internet and printer is near the reception area- WiFi is with T-mobile hotspot for $6 for 24 hours Thanks for the FANTASTIC luxury experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: 1995sb21
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located, clean rooms and very well priced. We have stayed here about 3 different times over the past few months and think it is a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Tansz
Reviews.Content: My Mom and I went to LA for a quick shopping trip weekend. We booked a balcony room. The room was lovely and very clean. The bathroom was super clean with a rainfall shower. There were slippers and a robe for our use, a laptop safe, Bose stereo, flat panel big screen, down bedding, and free Evian water. The staff was very friendly and attentive. The valet was $29 (ouch). Room service for coffee was $12 for a large pot, tip, and service charge (great coffee and service w/a smile). We got 2 free cocktail vouchers! The concierge got us reservations at the Ivy on the fly. We booked through Expedia at a good rate of $173. I think that was a great price for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Londonstevo
Reviews.Content: Superb hotel, not too bad location,, right opposite the Beverly Centre. Short taxi ride to down town

Reviews.Title: “Yes! Its brilliant”
Reviews.Author: HolidayGalDublin
Reviews.Content: Brilliant Modern Hotel. Opposite the Beverly Centre...which is amazing shopping. Great location in West Hollywood, even walkable restaurants nearby. Room was gorgeous, Bed fantastic. Go there.

Reviews.Title: “Service is impeccable!”
Reviews.Author: umdterp08
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel through Hotwire, thinking it would be Sofitel. It was absolutely gorgeous. The staff was knowledgeable and efficient, especially the concierge. They took all of our bags up to our room, since we had to move the car. The room was fantastic - a little smaller than I expected, but the furniture was great, the view was wonderful, and the bathroom! OH the rain shower, lovely! From the other reviews on this site, I asked for a view of the hills, and as seen in the picture, it was worth it. I liked the Beverley Center, but didn't want a view of it! This is a great location! We only stayed for one night. We went to the hotel bar, it wasn't packed as it was during the week. The drinks were pricey and eh, but the atmosphere was nice/relaxing/lounge like. I would definitely, hands down, go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury hotel but only for sound sleepers (poor sound-proofing)”
Reviews.Author: Art_travel50
Reviews.Content: Hotel is full of contradictions as far as having some excellent features such as top-notch furnishings and very helpful and knowledgeable concierge, yet having some serious downsides - including just about the worst sound-proofing this frequent traveler has ever encountered. Doorways opening and closing, the hotel elevator (at some distance from my room), and adjacent room's guest making his selection from his closet (you could hear hangers sliding across the bar) were all plainly audible. At first I thought the "hallway revelry" was due to some particularly unruly guests, and then realized that poor soundproofing was at the heart of the problem as merely closing a door somewhere down the hall sounded like slamming. Another strange contradiction - the bedding is obviously very high-end, but relatively hard (i.e. it's a futon) so it's great for those who think firm beds are better and a tough go if you like soft beds. A major plus - the location could not be better. Within easy walking distance of outstanding shopping and dining, it is ideal for those who like to be able to enjoy city amenities on foot rather than always having to drive. If you are a very sound sleeper I'd say this hotel is a great choice, but if you favor a quiet rest I would recommend against it.

Reviews.Title: “Stinky and worn out..”
Reviews.Author: Surfacing1982
Reviews.Content: Sofitel - Los Angeles was our second stop during our 3 week vacation in the West coast. Coming from a Four Seasons hotel, it was a definite downgrade. Our expectations werenâ€™t too high given the fact that weâ€™re not spending that much on our stay in this hotel, however given this is still a four star hotel, and ranked #11 for L.A. on Trip Advisor we thought it shouldnâ€™t be too bad. Bell Boys: As soon as I stepped out of the cab I overheard the bell boy complaining to his fellow worker â€œman these bags are heavy!â€� Well, I dragged them all by myself through 3 different airports and Iâ€™m a size 6 woman! Lobby & Front Desk: I wandered around the lobby while my husband was checking us in. The tables had finger prints all over them and the black, supposedly cool, surfaces didnâ€™t look that clean. The flowers werenâ€™t fresh, and the carpets were too worn out. Before giving us the room keys the front desk lady asked someone to go do a final check on the room. Why would they do that in front of the guests? Arenâ€™t they supposed to have the room ready well before the guests are about to check in? This makes it seem like the housekeeping doesnâ€™t always do their jobs thoroughly and that someone has to check after their work. Room & hallways: When the elevator opened its doors to the floor our room is in, I smelled something was off. When I got into the room I thought this is definitely some really strong detergent trying to cover a very unpleasant smell, like an old carpet that has been puked on and cleaned way too many times. To my horror, when I took off my shoes I stepped on a wet spot of the carpet. I hate dark full carpets in hotel rooms in the first place, only God knows what sorts of germs guests leave in them, let alone one thatâ€™s wet in patches. I thought thereâ€™s no way I was gonna be able to stay in that room too much longer, so we went straight back to the front desk and requested another room telling them that the reason was because it smelled. The front desk was very apologetic, kind and helpful and didnâ€™t hesitate to give us another room right away. We took the key to try out the other room, which was in a lower floor but slightly larger. The smell wasnâ€™t that bad, itâ€™s at least something you might get used to if you stayed for long enough. Bathroom: The shower didnâ€™t drain very well. I had to get off after 15 minutes or else the water wouldâ€™ve overflown. I reported this the next morning and it was fixed during the day while we were out. All toiletries I expected were available, including nail-filers which not many hotels Iâ€™ve been to provide. Bed: The bed didnâ€™t look too welcoming. The sheets were yellowish, and didnâ€™t have that feel of crisp new white sheets that I so look forward to in hotels. However, I did sleep throughout the night, so nothing about the bed bothered me during my sleep. Breakfast: The breakfast was included in our stay, which I think was well worth it. It was a menu breakfast instead of a buffet, but you could order anything you wanted for $50/person. Anything beyond that would be charged. However we ate there comfortably for 3 mornings and it never exceeded $50. The breakfast staff of the restaurant were friendly and the service was fast. I loved the food too, everything was fresh and good quality. Concierge: The concierge didnâ€™t really know to suggest things to do to our liking. I asked what was there to do in L.A. besides shopping (it was still too early for nightlife), he pointed out a few museums but that was it. When we asked where the best spot would be to take a good picture of the Hollywood sign he showed a corner on the map, we marked it on our navigation and drove there, but then decided to get closer to the sign and found out there are a dozen better places for a picture! Lost & Found: On the last day while I was packing my bags I realized that I was missing a jacket, I thought I mustâ€™ve left it in the first room that was too stinky to stay in. So I called the Lost & Found and asked if there was a jacket left in that room, they said yes and brought it right away. Then I though what if I completely forgot that jacket, wouldâ€™ve they called me to inform that I might have forgotten an item in a room that I checked into before? We stayed there for four nights, I forgot the jacket on the first night, and they neglected informing me about it. Iâ€™ve forgotten a jacket in a dorm room after a semesterâ€™s end in collage and they called me afterwards so that I could claim it. This is a four star hotel! The hotel was trying too hard to be cool with the style and furnishing but at the bottom of it itâ€™s just stinky and not very well maintained which only makes it look cheap. A wide flat screen TV is not the solution to a modern hotel. Weâ€™ve stayed in another Sofitel Hotel before, and that wasnâ€™t that great either, so I guess this will put an end to our stays in Sofitel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and excellent service. Not perfect, however...”
Reviews.Author: jsr914
Reviews.Content: I booked the Sofitel for a one-night stay on a mid-week business trip to Los Angeles. The hotel is nicely situated directly across from the Beverly Center, one of LA's best shopping malls. Good food and sightseeing options are right outside the door, which is rare for LA. The hotel is modern and hip with very well kept grounds and an impressive entry area. The rooms are also modern in appearance with flat panel TVs and sharp, clean decor. I found the service to be superior, from the reception to the valet parking attendants. No issues at check-in. check-out or anywhere in between. Consistent with earlier reviews, the room I was given was very small for the States. If I was with my wife, we would have been cramped. But, for one, the size was fine. I also found the room to be otherwise spotless and comfortable, with a good view of the busy LA street scene below. The bed was comfortable and I slept well. So, in all, I would recommend the Sofitel for travelers to LA or those on business. It is well located and can be a good value, especially if you shop around on discount internet websites.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable”
Reviews.Author: Paulofsf
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel is probably hit or miss, and for me, it was a miss. The hotel looks nice and it is furnished in a way you would expect from a 4-star place. The service was very friendly, and we had a decent time overall. However, we had a few problems--each minor, but collectively annoying--during our stay: 1) We arrived to find stains on our sheets and no soap in the bathroom. And because we had arrived late, we had to change the sheets ourselves. 2) The walls between us and our neighbors were surprisingly thin. At one point we could hear the local newscast on the TV next door as if it were showing in our room. 3) This was the kicker--it happened to rain on our last night there, and all the water off the roof drained right onto a metal windowsill outside our window.
