Needless to say, we slept very poorly, even after housekeeping gave us some earplugs. If it rains, DO NOT STAY ON THE 4TH FLOOR. Interestingly, when I complained to the front desk, she said many of the guests had made similar complaints, and that the hotel management was pushing for a renovation. I won't be staying again until they do.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms and good central location”
Reviews.Author: jonontherun
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel is located directly opposite the Beverly Center shopping mall (some good shops eg. H&M, Bloomingdales, Macy's) and within walking distance of the hotel are numerous restaurants and convenience stores and a Starbucks. Also just across the road are factory outlet-style shopping at Marshalls and Loehmann's. The trendy Robertson Blvd (The Ivy, Kitson etc) is just about 5-10mins walk away. I had booked a Luxury Room and was initially given a room facing the street and the mall. The traffic noise was very bad due to poorly closing balcony doors (the hotel has since informed me that they are addressing the noise issue) and we requested a change of rooms. Was given an identical room at the back of the hotel with a lovely view of the Hollywood Hills (including the Hollywood sign) and no noise. The Luxury Rooms have two windows/doors that open to Juliet balconies. The King bed is comfortable and a true king size and there is a small chaise lounge and a writing desk with chair. There's also a LCD tv and large robe in the entrance way. The bathroom is a standout with large walk in shower cubicle with a window to the bedroom (you can watch tv while in the shower albeit without the sound!) and a great rain shower. The front desk staff were all extremely helpful and polite (with the exception of one, but there's always one!) and there's also a free internet station in the lobby where you can check email.

Reviews.Title: “Can I please move to LA....”
Reviews.Author: Jesuisunfamilyman
Reviews.Content: I love California....be it on business or pleasure it's so much more pleasurable doing anything when it's sunny. Anyway, this hotel....fantastic. About 25 mins from the airport, check in was smooth and really pleased with the bedroom. Comfy bed, fantastic bathroom and everything that I needed (except somebody to actually come to my room to iron my shirts!!) The breakfast was ample, location was good for us and right opposite a shopping mall to buy the kids presents! The staff were really courteous and made you feel welcome. The only downside is the bar in the evening....I'm about 20 years (and a few stone) too heavy to feel part of the beautiful crowd!! Great for people watching Stay there....you won't be disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: oaklay18
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at the Sofitel. Stayed in a "basic" room and found it to be fairly spacious. I didn't feel like it was a small room at all. Actually a standard sized hotel room. We had a view of the Hollywood sign and the rainfall shower. The rooms were very nicely decorated and the bed was VERY comfortable. I typically go to LA to spend time with family and need a place to drop off my bags and sleep. This is a hotel I would recommend for someone visiting LA. Across the street from the Beverly Center, close to Melrose, and Hollywood Blvd. The staff is friendly and prices are reasonable. Valet was $29/day Gym was free and like a smaller version of a brand new Ballys. Lots of room and all new equipment. The only complaint I have is that in the morning we could hear our neighbors tv. I'm not sure if they had it turned up loud or if the walls were that thin, but I never heard any other noise from that room (no talking etc) just the tv in the morning. I would gladly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Oustanding Service, Great Product, totally renovated, Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: Reisefuedli
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sofitel Los Angeles in October. The staff was outstanding. All were extremely attentive, courteous and friendly. I was totally impressed, such service I usually only expect from Four Seasons or Peninsula brands. The restaurants are great, all new. The room is very spacious and comfortable. Loved the Sofitel My Bed. Location is great, just on La Cienaga and Beverly, by the Bevery Center Mall. Unfortunately did not see the Pool on the roof, hear it is great though. Would stay again immediately.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - can't fault it”
Reviews.Author: tessajane
Reviews.Content: Well, we got this for $156 on Hotwire - what a bargain. Had a deluxe room and it certainly was deluxe. The bed was the most comfortable I have ever slept in, with the lightest down duvet you can imagine. The bathroom was absolutely fantastic, with a window so you could see the TV, plus volume controls so you could hear it! The shower was wonderful - complete with seat. Complimentary toiletries of great quality. Bathrobes, slippers and complimentary water. So good that we booked for second night - this time $149, but only for standard room. However, hotel staff wonderful and quite happy to upgrade us free of charge. Lovely breakfast - not too pricey. Three free computers and a printer - so rarely needed to wait to use. Excellent location. Can't fault anything! Hope to return someday.

Reviews.Title: “A touch of luxury at a great price”
Reviews.Author: chigal82
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Sofitel in Los Angeles and was very happy with the entire stay. They were running a special (2 nights for the price of 3) which put a hotel like this in my price range (approx $250 a night). I was impressed that the gentlemen that met me at the front door actually walked me to the reception area, got me checked in, got me acclimated to the hotel & it's ameneties and escorted me to the elevator. I also appreciated his asking if I needed assistance to the room (which I didn't). I didn't really deal much w/ the rest of the staff, with the exception of valet, and they were always prompt & courteous in retrieving my car. The daily fee is a bit steep ($30), but we were in Beverly Hills. The room was very comfortable and stylish. My room faced the Beverly Center on Beverly Blvd, so there was a a little traffic noise, but being from a city, I didn't find it too distracting. Very comfortable bed and a really nice, large bathroom. The shower is one of those rain showers - I am not a fan, but that is just personal taste. The towels were fantastic, fluffy and plentiful. The location is great if you are a shopper. Right across from the Beverly Center and close to Robertson Blvd, 3rd street and the Grove. This will be one of the first places I look at when booking my next trip to LA and if the price is right, I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “super cool sofitel la ..”
Reviews.Author: StevensonLondon
Reviews.Content: This is one of the coolest Sofitels I have stayed in around the world. Has been completely renovated - so is super funky .. but without loosing any comfort or service. Fantastic staff, amazing service, from the moment we arrived - very efficient valet service, amazing reception all very black with candles everywhere, really cool restaurant and bar .. Rooms have a real European paris feeling, but still really cool, lovely big beds ours overlooking the Holywood sign. Amazing spa and gym - the spa is fabulous. really lovely outdoor pool area. the thing that made this hotel was the staff .. everyone is so friendly and the bar was definately a highlight. would highly recommend to anyone who wants a luxury central hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for comfort and getting around”
Reviews.Author: ScotlandRach
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here after reading the reviews on this site. I have to say i wasn't disappointed! the location was great!! as we were not driving we wanted a good base and we couldn't have asked for more. We walked to Rodeo Drive and even Hollywood (although this is a bit of a walk). We could also walk down past the Beverly Centre to the next main avenue and get buses to all location, we managed to go to Santa Monica and downtown by bus for example. When we first arrived we were given a room facing the Beverly Centre however after reading the reviews here we quickly asked for a view of the Hills and were given one immediately which was fantastic, could even see the Hollywood sign. Would definitely recommend this hotel, great base. Sunset strip was only a short taxi fare for evening entertainment. We got about a good bit by foot and public transport (although this does need improvement) and i would certainly stay here again!! Oh.. and the bed was the most comfortable i have ever slept in!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - One of the nicest”
Reviews.Author: davevt98
Reviews.Content: I got a great rate from Hotwire from this hotel and was extremely pleasantly surprised. The hotel is owned by a french company (Sofitel) so the entire hotel had an European feel. The gym was one of the nicest hotel gyms that I have seen as it had brand new equipment, free evian water and nice eucalyptus towels. The pool was very small and was salt water but it was nice enough. Not much of a pool scene but the other benefits of the hotel outweighed this small problem. The rooms were a little on the small side but nice. The restaurant was fantastic and the bar was very lively. We did manage to see a celebrity sighting going in to the bar. All in all, this is a great hotel and would return in a second.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel if your room is facing the right way.”
Reviews.Author: Juliette22
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in this hotel on Saturday night. We checked in at 3pm and found the room very comfortable. We stayed in the room until 7pm when we went out for a party. When we got back there was a HUGE private party in the hotel bar/restaurant. It took us awhile to drive up to the hotel door as paparazzi and limo's were blocking our way for a bit. When we finally got to our room on the 8th floor, it was like we were AT the party. The noise was unbelievable and was going to be that loud until 1:30 we were told. The hotel staff were fairly helpful and changed our room, however the first room they switched us to had the same problem, since we were still facing the street. I think the noise was bouncing off the Shopping Center's walls across the street... Finally, they switched us again to a room facing the hills, and we couldn't hear a thing and had a peaceful night. I would say the staff did alright - they were friendly and accommodating, but should have guessed we needed a room on the opposite side of the street the first time round. I would recommend asking for a room on the 'hill' side if you are staying at the hotel on a weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and rooms”
Reviews.Author: ilovethebeach86
Reviews.Content: Outstanding property! Great service, fantastic staff. The drive way is staffed by about 10 people waiting to welcome you back and assist with bags which was great. Everytime they gave us a personal greeting back to the hotel The rooms are very clean, large, and the beds are heavily. In room movies are up to date and not too expensive Room was cleaned to the highest standard. Pool is small but nice, gym is well equiped. One down side -they have 2 computers with free internet but do not extend this out to free wireless- when you are paying so much for a room free wi fi should be standard! Other than that its excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay at Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: AlanSusan
Reviews.Content: We spent three days before a cruise at this hotel and three days after the cruise at the hotel. The first three days were spent in a rear double room with views of the Hollywood hills and the second spell was in a front double room with views of the Beverly Centre. The second room was noticibly larger. We did not notice any real traffic noise from ther front room. The service and quality was excellent on both stays and up to the usual Sofitel standard. The location is good for a large city like Los angeles and most things are only a short cab ride away. Would not hesitate to reccommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, stylish hotel”
Reviews.Author: carmcd
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in August (without the kids) Our dbl room was very stylish and spacious but we decided to treat ourselves to a suite. For the views alone it was well worth it. The hotel is directly accross the street from the beverly centre, great for shopping. We did not hire a car and found it very easy to get around LA, taxis are not expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Pay attention to the details”
Reviews.Author: Avant_Traveller
Reviews.Content: Hotel has very modern and comfortable decor. The valet parking is a little steep at $30/day, which they don't seem to disclose anywhere on their site. There's plenty of street parking available. Most of the rooms are average size, but request the larger rooms at the end of the hallway on each floor. The hotel offers very few rooms with double bedding, so don't expect to change bedding unless you've pre-reserved the room. Each room is equipped with a flat screen, fluffy down blanket and the basic necessities. A complimentary mini bottle of Evian is replenshished daily. Internet access is available through T-Mobile hotspots for a daily fee of $10. All hotel staff is very courteous and attentive especially concierge and bellman. We showed up for our dinner reservation that the concierge helped us with and apparently they booked it for the wrong day. So just make sure you re-confirm everything with concierge. Make sure you check your folio upon check out. I pre-paid for the room, but was billed the full room charges again upon check out. Located in a great area, with lots of good eats around. Extremely easy access to Beverly Center, Melrose and Robertson for all those shoppers.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel won me over!!”
Reviews.Author: joanne777
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and absolutely loved it. First time at a Sofitel. The room was immaculate very modern the beds divine. The concierge was so helpful with every little thing we asked.The Beverly hills mall with Bloomies and Macys right across the street, CVS, Marshalls Old Navy and Starbucks also across the street. Within walking distance of Robertson. We did not eat at Simons but heard it was excellent. Great neighbourhood in the area for walking. Will definitely stay at Sofitel next chance I get.

Reviews.Title: “Just returned”
Reviews.Author: Paulacats
Reviews.Content: Just returned after a 6 day trip .Chose this hotel as i have stayed in a few of the sofitels , and found them great .This was ... well ok. Clean hotel , small rooms , helpful reception staff , but concierge made 3 mistakes in requests we made , and one was pretty major , and spoilt our last nite.And location is not great .Apart from a shopping mall across from hotel , theres nothing else within walking distance.Probably would not stay again .

Reviews.Title: “Central location and great service”
Reviews.Author: Shakers_7
Reviews.Content: My family and I booked two rooms at the Sofitel this September and reading a few of the somewhat negative reviews below, I wonder if we are talking about the same hotel. First of all, the hotel staff was gracious enough to give us adjacent rooms and not just rooms on the same floor. The rooms were very spacious, spotless clean, and equipped with all the amenities you could ask for. The bathroom was equally spacious and the supplies replenished without the need to ask. The service from the reception desk and the concierge are exceptional. To give you a few examples: My husband had paid for a laptop at one of the stores but did not have the time to go pick it up; they did it for us and had it delivered to our room. I had seen a video camera that I liked at the same shop but did not remember the exact model. The concierge took the time to search the website of the store I was talking about, scanned all the models until I recognized the one I had liked, and sent out and got it for me. It was again delivered to the room on the same day. This came at a price, but with the short period of time we had at LA, every second counted. At one point, when we came down late one morning, and my elderly mother discovered that the coffee stand at the lobby was shut down, the front desk manager took the time to prepare her a cup in person and bring it over to her while we were waiting for a tour pick up. Everytime we entered the hotel, the staff greeted us with a smile, asking if we were having a good time and if there was anything they could do to make our stay more enjoyable. Also, we had stayed at the Renaissance for a couple of days before that, and while the location was exceptional and the view of the hills and the Hollywood sign an unexpected bonus, the staff there was snobbish and extremely unfriendly. The staff courteous, friendly and efficient attitude at the Sofitel was like a breeze of fresh air. The location was also superb with lots of restaurants, shopping areas, and sights within walking distance. I had such agood time there, that I was really sorry we had only booked a couple of nights and had to leave to San Diego. On a next visit to LA, this is where I will stay and this is the hotel I will be recommending to friends. It is a shame that the Renaissance staff is such a turn off - the hotel's location next to the Hollywood Highland and the view of the hills would have been a great sell.

Reviews.Title: “average”
Reviews.Author: bellabe
Reviews.Content: average hotel. A lot of noise from the street. small pool side. friendly stuff. great for bussiness purpose B

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: TraeV
Reviews.Content: After seeing some of the reviews, I immediately requested a room facing the Hollywood Hills. The room was beautiful (6th floor), and you could see the Hollywood sign. We had a superior room, which I didn't feel was very small- then again, we're from NYC and used to apartments. It was very comfortable and quiet, with a great bathroom. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. We actually didn't valet, and found street parking, which was a little stressful, but saved us $100. Be very careful of the street signs. We were moving the car at 8AM each morning, which was fine, still being on East Coast time. The pool area was nice, but smaller than the pictures. Overall, a very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy hotel, lack of service”
Reviews.Author: Aunteen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for two nights. The room we booked was a King Superior with "some hills view". The room we were gives was a King room on the 8th floor but directly on Beverly Boulevard, with a view of the shopping center. We got into the elevators and noticed they were not very clean, this continued throughout our stay, as did trash that was not picked up the entire stay. Hallway carpets were dirty and stained. The room was small but clean, but very noisy. We could hear the traffic on Beverly and the people in the room next to us, especially when you were in the bathroom. We had to keep the bathroom door closed at night to keep the noise out. The bed was the worst I have ever slept in. It was lumpy and uneven from the mattress cover, there was no headboard only a 4" gap between the bed and the wall where they had placed electrical strips. The down comforter was so heavy and hot you couldn't sleep under it, and there was no top sheet on the bed, so it was cover or nothing. Noisy A/C too. Next morning I asked the receiption to please have housekeeping remove the comforter and put a top sheet and blanket on the bed. This was at 9:00 am. I asked again at 1:00 pm and 5:00 pm. Finally after my third call housekeeping brought me a sheet and blanket. This to me is no 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Time at this hotel, very centrally located”
Reviews.Author: Sheryll
Reviews.Content: Our second stay at this hotel (our last one being in 2006 when the hotel was undergoing some serious renovations) and we were keen to see how the hotel had been upgraded. As Sofitel Members we should be upgraded but unfortunately at check in there were no upgrades available, they were going to check and hopefully move us the next day. Only received one complimentary drink voucher (normally receive two) and when brought this to their attention a second was delivered. Our room was very small but with a great view over the Hollywood Hills and the Hollywood sign, but very very small. My husband went back down and complained and we were moved to a room at the front of the hotel overlooking the Beverly Centre shopping centre, not as good a view but certainly a much bigger room. The Sofitel never disappoints and the service is consistent with other Sofitel hotels we have stayed in around the world. The beds were extremely comfortable and all facilities in the bathroom including robes and slippers were of the normal Sofitel Standard. Again free internet and complimentary water were given. The Stone Bar (Cindy Crawfords husband designed it) was a happening place at night, a bit too noisy for us late in the night but a great place to have a drink before heading out at night, try and get one of the little booths outside and if not then a table outside. Check out the outside fire place with the dry ice - incredible at night >The breakfasts were reasonably priced for Hotel standard and of a good standard, we had exceptional service the first day but the second day we had to chase up our meal twice, not good, however, the Restaurant Manager apologised and this meal was given to us complimentary, so couldn't complain. >The concierge staff were very good,in particular arranging a Mustang Convertible car for us for one day with very short notice and the staff were always pleasant and very helpful. >This is a good central hotel for visitors as the public transport system (if you need it) is accessible out the front, the Farmers Markets and Grove Shopping Centre are about a $8.00 - $10.00 cab trip down the road, or a bus trip and you can also get a bus to Santa Monica from outside in the Street ( you need to change buses). The renovations have been completed to a modern contemporary standard and we would stay at this hotel again. > Lots of good restaurants around including the newly opened Gordon Ramsay "The London" In West Hollywood, again about $8.00 cab fare from the hotel.. We had dinner there (about two months after it opened) and the food was excellent, very small portion sizes so if you have the al carte you might want to order four or five courses. The Service could have been better and overall the restaurant was not up to the standard of his New York one, but it was a dining experience, a little more laid back style - but no Candy Trolley - which was exceptional in the New york Resturant Not far from the Hotel is "The Ivy" restaurant and the Concierge staff can normally get you a reservation, whilst we did not eat there on this trip (2006 was enough as the food was fine but the service not great and their attitude was poor and quite agressive if you felt the service didnt warrant a huge tip) if you want to see the Paparazzi in action this is the street to be in,. We drove by one night and both sides of the Street was Pap heaven, there were people and flash lights everywhere. Overall would recommend this hotel due to location and standard Sofitel exceptional service.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, terrible room”
Reviews.Author: Illinois4321
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was nice. The staff were all wonderful. They were very nice and helpful. Always saying hi, opening doors for you, making good recommendations for restaurants, ect. The facilities were nice too. Everything was clean, nothing was falling apart, no complaints there. The massage I had at the spa was great. The spa itself was great, the fitness room was great, the restaurant was great, the room was great...except for the noise. That's what made it get 2 stars. I was on the fifth floor facing Beverly Blvd and it was like being in the middle of New York city! It is near the hospital, and it's a busy road, so that explains it. There was no noise from other guests, just the road but that's enough to keep you up at night. If you're lucky, maybe you can be moved to another room. But for the purpose of this review, it is about the room I was in. And there's a lot of other rooms that would have the same problem. As some advice, if you stay here, make sure you don't have a view of Beverly Dr. Don't drink the 5$ still water in the minibar, there's free water at the gym. There's free internet at the gym, so depending on your purpose for using the internet you can avoid the WiFi fee. If you even move the drinks in the minibar (like if you were using it as a fridge for leftover food) they will charge you for it even if you don't open the bottles, so be prepared to tell that to the checkout people.

Reviews.Title: “Fresh, funky and contemporary hotel”
Reviews.Author: We_the_Jetsetters
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 days overall and found it to be a pleasant hotel. It's very busy with a funky contemporary feel. The staff were mostly friendly, although some on the door were bordering on snooty. It's obviously becoming one of "the" places to be seen in LA, both in the hotel and the bar. We often saw a group of bodyguards escorting someone famous around the hotel. The room although slightly small was comfortable and the shower was a fantastic overhead rain type. The food was very tasty and priced as you would expect at a fine restaurant. Personally I would have liked a buffet type option at breakfast but thatâ€™s a minor gripe as the menu catered for all tastes. Waiters and greeters in the restaurant were the most friendly staff in the hotel. Valet parking only, which although I can understand that they need to do this to compete with the best I would have liked a self parking facility also. Would stay again, but would prefer to try elsewhere first.

Reviews.Title: “The beds were incredibly comfortable”
Reviews.Author: PaulaSparks
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was beautiful and every inch was immaculate. I was out on a frenetic tour with a band and I always have difficulty getting any rest under those circumstances, but the beds were unbelievably comfortable! I slept like a baby and I got the same comments from just about everyone in the entourage. The showers were fantastic and the service was excellent. I highly reccomend this hotel if you are looking to treat yourself or somone else to a special luxurious time.

Reviews.Title: “The star treatment in L.A”
Reviews.Author: joannetAustralia
Reviews.Content: Our stay at The Sofitel was a beautiful, luxurious one! After they had accidentally lost our web booking they made up for it by upgrading our room. The service was great and the hotel itself superb. Our room and bathroom was a good size with a huge shower and a view looking out onto the hollywood hills. The room was modern and stylish! The hotel was also conveniently located, across the road was the Beverley shopping centre with every luxury store you could think of, as well as being walking distance to a few popular streets. The hotel restaurant was fantastic, with lovely decor and great food. There was also a very popular and equally lovely decorated bar/lounge which we enjoyed visiting. For those wanting a day spa experience there was a beautiful day spa located just outside, but affiliated with, the hotel. All in all it was a great stay and one we are sure to recommend to others. The only draw back was the cost for parking and having to tip the valets every time you needed you car, but hey, its LA!

Reviews.Title: “Best bed in the world!”
Reviews.Author: Martin_and_Steggs
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a deluxe room, with a view of the Hollywood sign. The room was spacious enough for a city hotel, with a very large bathroom. The walk-in shower could easily have accomodated 3 people and what's more, with a flick of a switch you could watch the TV in the bedroom through the window! The best thing about the room by far was the bed! Large and very comfortable due to the feather filled mattress topper, duvet and pillows (all hypo-allergenic so no sneezing!), I have not slept in a nicer bed anywhere. The hotel staff were very attentive and the concierge was excellent. The valet parking always had the car ready in no time at all, and in Formula 1 style, 5 guys would be opening doors for you! The bar was very cool and on certain nights impossible to get into, unless of course you were either the owner of a Lambourghini...or a hotel resident! The location, in West Hollywood, was perfect for seeing the main sights of LA and nowhere was more than a half an hour's drive away. I highly recommend this hotel, especially if you are looking for a little luxury. If you think it is expensive for what you get, then you clearly should be staying in a Travel Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leasha
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night as part of a stop over in LA on our first night of our Honeymoon & was not disappointed. Great location opposite Beverley Hills Shopping Centre - literally across the road. Very modern lobby, spotted a celebrity upon check in - Chris Brown - popular US singer. Rooms were very clean - great views of Hollywood. There was a very funky & popular bar in the lobby which unfortunately we didnt get a chance to visit. Overall - beautiful & friendly hotel.

Reviews.Title: “pretty close to perfect”
Reviews.Author: y808y
Reviews.Content: I had fallen in love with the Sofitel in Chicago so I was curious to see how the one in L.A. stacked up and once again I was blown away. The management and staff were extremely accomodating and helpful, room service was quick (get Simon's junk food selection with cotton candy and cupcakes and order in a movie one night), the pool was the warmest heated pool I had ever gone swimming in, the architecture and design of the hotel, spa, restaurant and bar was beautiful, and we even had a celebrity spotting--Ice T! The hotel is right across the street from the Beverly Center so we had plenty of choices for shopping and restaurants but it's still quite a walk to Rodeo Drive and other hot spots. And don't let cab drivers scam you from LAX! It should only be $40 and we paid $71! That was the only time I gritted my teeth during our stay but that wasn't the hotel's fault it was our own and the shady cab driver's. A soak in their suite's hot tub though did the trick. If you get a suite, the huge bathroom has a tv by the tub and I took advantage of it every day. Such a wonderful experience, I hope to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Bed!”
Reviews.Author: MH1London
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 629 (next to the lift lobby, so some noise from people using the lifts, but not too much of a problem). The room faced the rear so there was no traffic noise like the rooms at the front, plus we had a view of the Hollywood sign from our bed (if you squint and it is a clear day!!! - but we found this really special). Breakfast was excellent, especially the continental breakfast (in bed!) which came with 5 different breads/pastries each, plus fresh juice, homemade smoothie and a huge pot of coffee. Staff very friendly. One downside was the showergel/shampoo was never replaced (we stayed 5 nights) - we had to call and ask for new supplies. We didn't hire a car in LA, and found this location to be generally easy to get around. The DASH bus stops adjacent to the hotel and will take you to Hollywood Blvd for 25 cents. Best Bargain in LA!!!!! But note, this stops running after about 7pm. The Metro bus runs longer, but need to change buses ($5 all day pass, or $1.25 single journey). We went down to Santa Monica (about 40 minutes from hotel). Overall, a very enjoyble stay in the heart of West Hollywood, close to Beverly Hills and good shopping opposite hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice for our young family”
Reviews.Author: sydneysooz_family
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in a SoFabSuite on a Universal Studios stopover enroute to the UK. We're both 38 and we have an 11 month old and a 3 year old and needed a room large enough to comfortably fit us all without disturbing anyone trying to sleep. The Sofitel LA looked as though it fitted the bill and indeed did. At first we thought we'd been upgraded as the room was so nice (from memory the room was AU$330 per night-ish), large SAFE balcony, two large LCD/Plasma tv's, great bathroom and furnishings etc (you'll see on the website) Our 3yo slept like a princess in the feathery mass that the sofabed became over night. Our 11month old had a PROPER cot/crib (not a travel cot) and his own toiletries, which fitted nicely into a little dark alcove away from the 3 year old. All leaving us with a room (and to DH's joy, a large TV) to ourselves. Concierge (Hector & the Team) had organised our pickups to/from the LAX and Burbank prior to us arriving . Needing 2 carseats for the kids is an issue in California as taxis etc. don't provide them. We didn't want to hire a car and argue directions for 2 days on the wrong side of the road and AirShuttle transfers with 2 kids, associated luggage for a month RTW and stroller wasn't appealing either. They found a Limo service which could provide a babyseat at the least. DH and DD(3) enjoyed the sweets and drinks provided, and we all felt like we were doing the LA experience on the 35 minute ride to the hotel. We ate breakfast twice at SimonLA in the outside courtyard, which offered good choices for us all (inc. the baby) at what seemed like reasonable prices (before taxes, tipping etc). We also had room-service after our day at Universal, which was yummy and a had a child-friendly menu. The only thing against the hotel ais: it's location - there's really nothing other than the Beverley Centre nearby. Even finding cheap evening food choices for a family was difficult. We did eventually find a wonderful Thai cafe with the BEST egg-rolls we've ever had (and in Sydney Thai restaurants are a time a dozen). The Beverley Centre was good for a bit of quick shopping which was all we had time for in a 48h stopover which included Universal Studios. Getting to Universal on public transport was EASY and took less than an hour! We took the 25c bus right outside the hotel to Hollywood/Highland then 1 stop on the redline. The shuttle up the hill came quickly. The 25c bus took us through West Hollywood, up the strip etc so was a good little sightsee! The only other hotels we considered were the Hilton Universal (a Club room) and the Beverley Garland. Overall we feel that staying at Sofitel LA was a better choice for a such a short stay, we really felt like we were in LA!

Reviews.Title: “Great service but not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: AJW34
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a one bedroom suite a few weeks ago (May 2008). The service in the hotel is impeccable, they do try very hard to make you feel as if you are in a 5 star hotel. The suites, however, are not worth the exhorbitant price. Noise is a problem if you're sensitive to it. My first room was very pretty (with a deep tub), but there was a persistent (24 hours a day) humming noise rising from the fans at the restaurant below. I was moved to another suite without the tub, and for the same price, but no fan noise. The busses start roaring up La Cienega at about 6am, so I was not at my best for meetings all day. En suite dining is limited but pretty well prepared (nouvelle, not a lot on the plate, but well cooked.). There are better hotels for this price.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated for the price”
Reviews.Author: Nitra315
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel Los Angeles is a nice hotel. The service staff are friendly and efficient and the hotel and rooms are very clean. In my opinion, the double-bed room was surprisingly small. I guess for the price per night, I expected it to be bigger. I am a Sofitel rewards member; however, they neglected to provide me with the membership benefits even though my rewards status was clearly provided on the reservation. The bedroom windows open out to a main street and the Beverly Center is directly across the street, so great shopping is close. I didn't like the fact that the window looks like it has a balcony, but it doesn't, and one misstep could land you on your face in the street below. There's a Rande Gerber bar/lounge in the lobby that is frequented by the young and beautiful Los Angelenos. If you stay at the hotel you cross the velvet rope hassle-free. They also have a really nice restaurant with an outdoor patio which is perfect for brunch. Overall, the hotel was nice. Definitely not the best hotel I've stayed in, but certainly not the worst - just pricey. If it had cost less, my review would be more positive.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in a great country loved it :)”
Reviews.Author: EMMA1005
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel Los Angeles was great. The location was perfect right opposite The Beverly Centre for all your shopping needs under one roof. The hotel is very clean and tidy and all the staff were there to help you in any way possible. The rooms were always kept clean and there was never a shortage of towels. I must say i have never slept as well as i did in their beds they were to die for!!! The Valet car parking service was really good as you only had to make one call and the car was parked outside ready to go on a short journey to Santa Monica and Malibu. Overall it was fantastic and couldn't fault it at all well done to everyone who made my stay fantastic

Reviews.Title: “Welcome Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Simon165
Reviews.Content: A very professional service extended throughout the hotel. We arrived late after a delayed flight and it was a relief to check into such a luxurious room with delightfully comfy beds! Breakfast was superb with the waiter actually amending the order for a cheaper option - whilst I still received what I had ordered! The concierge was very helpful and nothing was too much trouble when it came to getting directions and just locating certain shops.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great !”
Reviews.Author: f2s
Reviews.Content: The screened off drinks terrace gives the exterior a bit of an unfinished look.Thats the front wall.Our room on the back had the hills view and that Hollwood sign in the distance,and the unfortunate school yard below.To compensate the noise double glazing should be in place of the strange opening "french doors" windows. The staff are good,but an upgrade was denied against my expensive "Accor Favorite Guest "loyalty card.Thats OK,except that the two of us and four bags and a room service trolley were more than our little triangular room space could hold.The shower was large but we chose not to eat in there.Exceptionally good air condition unit.LED bed lights,and some other toys,but where's the space and quiet? The bar and restaurant are fab designs,the locals know how to party,dont go looking for any quiet corners here.You pay for the style too. I did not see any good near by restaurants , I should have asked the friendly concierge. The fastest check out in the West. I would stay in another district , if I return .

Reviews.Title: “A Modern Gem in L.A.!”
Reviews.Author: hotgravy
Reviews.Content: I just attended a work meeting at the Sofitel in L.A. Let me start by saying that I live in L.A. all my life (37 years) and have seen many hotel both in L.A. and around the country. The Sofitel is a very modern, upscale hotel since the remodel. Everything from the lobby accents to the rooms are polished to a high sheen. Check in was easy as was check out. We used several meeting rooms while there and the catering service was outstanding. Food was top notch and the service always came with a smile. Actually, that theme spread throughout the hotel. I have to say I was not expecting a hotel in this area to have such a friendly, outgoing staff. Everyone who worked there greeted me as I walked by. They really made you feel welcome. We had over 50 people in town for our meetings from around the country and those I spoke to gave grand reviews. I think the location is very good. You have the Beverly Center just South for shopping and a lot of food and entertainment within walking distance. You're close enough to the Sunset Strip to jump a short cab ride to get there but far enough to stay away from it if you don't want to be right in the thick of Hollywood. It's L.A. so things are a little pricey but you do get the best. Room service was delicious. The bar/lounge is very cool. Wed night is the big night at the Stone Rose lounge. It gets BEYOND packed. The only note I would make if I returned would be to get a room on the South side of the hotel. There is a school as other reviewers have mentioned. It's located on the North side of the hotel where my room was. I had to be up early for meetings anyway but the noise from the school on weekday mornings could be an issue for anyone who wished to sleep in. A fantastic place with great customer service!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: LALitLover
Reviews.Content: I know this hotel has a great reputation - and the service was top notch and very professional, but this property is not that good. The biggest problem is the location - right next to a major hospital so that you'll be up all night with the sound of sirens on the street below. Maybe there are quieter rooms in the hotel? Also, the rooms are really small-ish and the beds not very comfortable. This place can be a bargain - especially since it is outside of Beverly Hills - but you get what you pay for. Would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay at Sofitel Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: Wismergirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sofitel Los Angeles for 2 nights during March Break. The 4 of us had 2 SoFab suites (each suite is 850-sq.ft. big). The spacious room and upscale amenities made our stay so wonderful that we just didn't want to leave. I was most impressed by the newly renovated bathroom which was totally amazing with a big patterned glass window that looked out to the bedroom & you could watch TV while taking a shower, or you could turn on a switch and the glass would become frosted so it's not transparent any more. The shower stall had a hand-held shower or you could use the less powerful but nice big round ceiling shower. The 2 suites had different lay-outs & the spacious bathroom in Suite 921 had 4 shower heads so a couple can easily and comfortably take a shower at the same time. Valet parking was great and we never had to wait for more than 5 minutes for our car. Overnight parking was $29 per day (pretty expensive but OK in Beverly Hills) but there were always at least 2 people around you and at your service. They did make us feel like Royalties. Opposite the hotel near the gas station on N. La Cienega Blvd. there was a DASH bus to Hollywood Blvd (Kodak Theatre, Mann's (Grauman's) Theatre) and each journey was 25 cents (10 cents for senior). When we arrived at Kodak Theatre we found out that we could park the car there for 4 hours for only $2 as long as we bought something from the Theatre shops (even a coffee would do). I didn't recall reading about the cheap parking from other travellers, otherwise we would have taken our car there so my parents didn't need to wait for the bus that ran every 15-20 minutes. Sign up online to eat at Todai Japanese Buffet ($5 off) in Beverly Centre opposite the hotel. It's yummy! We ate in Todai in Planet Hollywood Hotel in Las Vegas and it was great! It's free to sign up online to become a Sofitel Privilege member, you'll get a free drink (champagne, wine, cocktail, etc.) each day during your stay from one of the bars. The business centre at the hotel near the check-in counter was the best as there were 3 computers for guests to use and they were all connected to a nearby printer. Internet access & printing service were all free of charge. We did our web check-in easily and printed out our boarding passes with no problems. We bought two 2-litre bottled soda for $2 at the gas station opposite the hotel. One bottle was $1.79 & $2 for 2. So we bought 2 bottles and left the unopened one at the hotel for staff to consume should they choose to. Buy a map with locations of famous Movie Stars' homes & it also provided you with driving directions to get close to the spectacular 50-ft. high "Hollywood" sign viewed from Deronda Dr. This is basically the only problem we found while staying in the hotel: Please be aware of the kids' noise early in the morning as the hotel was opposite a daycare or elementary school. Kids' activities took place in the school yard early in the morning and we got waken up as early as 8 a.m. as our rooms were facing the side street. The location of the hotel was great as it`s close to L.A. airport (20 minutes`drive even in morning rush hour) and it`s close to Hollywood, Santa Monica, Griffith Observatory (where you can see L.A. from the hilltop) and they were all within 30-minute drive from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, Stylish Hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveldudey
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel a few times while traveling on business to LA, most recently in Jan. 2008. I very much enjoyed my stays at the Softel LA and would welcome the opportunity to return. The rooms are stylishly decorated, the beds are as comfortable as they come, and the flatscreen TVs are a nice touch. The bathrooms are very modern and have large rainfall showers. The gym is well equiped compared to most hotel gyms. The staff was consistenly friendly and helpful. I had only good experiences at the restaurant and bar. The hotel is centrally located and convenient to the Beverly Center (right across the street), West Hollywood (a short walk or cab ride), Beverly Hills, and Hollywood, as well as many other parts of LA that tourists might find interesting.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and Dark”
Reviews.Author: Woodstock210
Reviews.Content: I'd read all the great reviews on Tripadvisor before we went to the Los Angeles Sofitel in March this year and was excited about our visit, but found the reality didn't quite live up to its billing. It is a nice hotel, but the rooms on the mall side of the building are loud (no noise glass, french doors that didn't even close all the way) , small and not very special. The lobby is very dark and pretentious. The surrounding immediate area offers nothing except a mall, nothing of interest or charm is walkable from the hotel (I know it is LA, but still...). Though expensive, the restaurant does do a delicious breakfast. The concierge gave excellent directions and was very helpful in general. It wasn't a bad place, but it lacked charm, quiet and distinction. I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back!!”
Reviews.Author: Joe24
Reviews.Content: We were overbooked by the Hyatt Regency Plaza and they put us in the Sofitel. It turned out to be a blessing in disguise as the Sofitel was perfect for our 1st trip to LA. The location couldnt be better as all the best West Hollywood shops were within a few minutes walk.... Melrose, Sunset and Hollywood Blvd etc. Santa Monica is 10 mins drive and the valet parking was seamless. The room was briliiant. Great bed with all the usual amenities and a superb view of downtown LA. A little strange that there was a window in the bathroom looking out into the sleeping area?? But this is LA right?? The food in the Simon LA restaurant was top class. Try the ahi tuna if you like that sort of thing!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Family Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Glomer1163
Reviews.Content: I was traveling to Los Angeles for business and needed a place to stay with my family the night before a conference. I booked a hotel using hotwire and got the Hotel Sofitel. Upon arriving, I explained to the front desk that I had infant twin sons and that I needed a two cribs. The gentleman manning the desk informed me that the room I had been assigned would not accommodate the cribs, but that he would be happy to change my room. The room was gorgeous and had a large shower and a great view of the hills behind the hotel. The cribs arrived shortly after we made it to our room and came loaded with baby shampoos, lotions and powder. We made use of the valet parking $23 a night, and met some of the nicest valets ever. They even did the best job of loading our five bags and two strollers into the car that I have ever seen. I praised the front desk for the excellent service when I checked out.

Reviews.Title: “Could be nicer!”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugsEB
Reviews.Content: This is a very nicely decorated hotel with modern upgrades. It is a half hour walk to Rodeo Drive, and half hour taxi to Hollywood Blvd. It is next to CedarsSinai Hospital. The decor is amazing. The view of the Hollywood hills is mediocre. The shower is good. The bed is definitely four star--very comfortable. They really need to improve on: 1. Their doors slam so even at 2am, some idiots will not close their door gently, you can be woken up by them. Considering how much I paid for this hotel, they really should get better hinges. 2. The restaurant is good but not super. Everything seems to be full of salt... Not worth spending that kind of money there. 3. The pool is no where to be found even though the signs point to it...

Reviews.Title: “Overly SO-SO Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: BIGBENITO
Reviews.Content: Overrated and overpriced, the rooms are not extraordinary, but admittedly stylish and well-equipped, dimensions notwithstanding. The art is great, especially in the lobby. On weekend nights it seems to be a hopping place for Hollywood wannabes and other LA types. The "morning-after" breakfast/brunch scene in the restaurant was a hangover gone bad, with too loud music (DJ brunch? Obnoxious.), pretentious and pricey menu, and staff attitude. With so many hotel choices in this area, this one can be overlooked.

Reviews.Title: “No individual treatment”
Reviews.Author: The Wright Family
Reviews.Content: Great location if you donâ€™t want to stay in downtown LA. Catch the â€˜Dashâ€™ bus 25cents to Hollywood, just outside the petrol station on La Cienega Boulevard. The price of the ticket hasnâ€™t changed over 2 years. Car rentals are on La Cienega within walking distance. The Beverly Centre is across the road. Sunset Boulevard is a 2 minute bus ride. There is a 24 hour drug store across the road. Complimentary internet on 2 PCâ€™s and 1 Mac. Complimentary coffee and tea in the mornings in the lobby. Rande Gerber owned and run bar downstairs. Reception quick and courteous to check in but failed to acknowledge frequent user of Sofitel and returning visitor to this hotel. Placed us on a smoking floor, had no other to move us too. When checking out staff appeared to loose interest in you when requesting certain things (large taxi). They even called me by the wrong name constantly with no apologises. Mandy faults in carpentry / workmanship (shower ceiling bubbles, cornices, carpets) Not what youâ€™d expect from a 5 star hotel. They need to pick up there game, since their renovations the hotel staff seem very pretentious.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay for LA shopping!”
Reviews.Author: scduthie
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, right next to the Beverly Centre for shopping, and a few blocks from Melrose Ave (my preferred shopping area). We arrived late, checked-in swiftly and loved our comfy room and great view of the West Hollywood Hills. Has a great bar and outdoor patio area with canopy seating and an open fireplace. Great Sushi place on the same block as hotel that I can't now remember the name. Its on the corner of West 3rd Street and S La Cienega Blvd. Overall a lovely hotel with swift service and great amenities and location.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: anthonyuk
Reviews.Content: Apparently this place has recently undergone a refurb, and it looks great. We got a great internet rate on a basic level room. We requested a view of the Hollywood sign and got that too. From the moment we walked through the lobby, we knew this place would be great. The reception staff were great. And a special thank you to Claudia on the Concierge desk - her recommendations were spot on, could get us bookings at short notice for good restaurants, and was always happy to help us out. The room had a really comfortable bed, and modern appliances. It also had a great bathroom with one of those huge shower roses which had fantastic water pressure. The gym is also the best equipped I've seen at a hotel. A great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent!”
Reviews.Author: Kingbear23
Reviews.Content: This hotel lived up to all my expectations and exceeded most of them. The room was exquisite and nicely-appointed. The staff were friendly and courteous. Simon LA was wonderful and celebrity chef, Kerry Simon has designed the in-room dining selection. I definitely recommend this hotel for leisure or business.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Sofitel!”
Reviews.Author: sheilor
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sofitel for 3 nights as part of our vacation to California. We couldn't have been happier with our experience! We were greeted warmly at the front desk, and we were thrilled with our room. It was spacious and modern, with all the ammenities we could want. Flat screen tv, VERY comfortable bed, large marble bathroom, bathrobes and slippers. The shower head placement was a little low, and I was disappointed that we didn't get a room with a rain showerhead, but other then that we were loved it all. It is just a well-thought out place. We only had breakfast at the hotel restaurant, but that was good enough and certainly expensive enough, although typical prices for LA. Valet parking scene in front is always a crazy thing; be prepared to tip at least three guys: one who opens the car door, one who prepares your ticket and one to open the door. It's ALWAYS like that, but everyone was nice and kind so we didn't mind spending the tips. The pool is great, with little cabanas with flat screen tv's around it and great, heart-pumping techno music being played all the time. We would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “excellent all the way....”
Reviews.Author: jojocorazza
Reviews.Content: the service is top notch at this hotel from the time you walk in the door until you reluctantly leave. the staff - from the bellmen, to the front desk, to the room service waiters, to the spa staff - everyone....was amazing. they were attentive, curteous and friendly all the time. always immediately at your service, and with a smile. the decor is very modern, which was a surprise to me since last time i stayed years ago it was very conservative french decor...now it's ultra modern, which isn't my favorite...but it was tasteful nonetheless. the beds are amazingly comfy...down comforters, down pillows and a feather bed on top of the mattress. flat panel tvs in every room and high end toilettries. the maid service was great, efficient and very neat every night. the gym is really nice, one of the nicest i've ever seen and i always stay in high end hotels. free water in the gym and internet service in the lobby and at the gym...oddly enough...but convenient also to have an alt internet access where nobody would expect it. the concierge was friendly and very well experienced. the spa was amazing too....they offer a foot soak and hot tea while you wait for your treatment and the therapists were excellent. the spa was beautiful and very nicely appointed. there was also fresh rosemary growing outside the spa which was a very nice aroma as you walked by :) the only slight problem i had was w/the valet. they were slightly disorganized...the first morning i left the hotel in a rush to get to work, i waited 15 mins for my keys although i called ahead for my car and it was sitting in front of me because the attendants were much more concerned w/the cars coming into the hotel than the ones leaving. i waited so long i forgot to give them a tip!! i had to insist that they give me my keys which made for a stressful start of my day. other than that, the hotel is excellent. the food is great, from breakfast to dinner and the outside bar has a wonderful fire pit that made the cold nights enjoyable. the seating inside the restaurant was not very comfortable...but not unbearable. all in all, a wonderful stay!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “My only regret is that I couldn't stay longer...”
Reviews.Author: 58sgirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect from the time I walked in. The staff was sooooo friendly and eager to help. The location is perfect, across the street from the Beverly Center, a 10 minute walk to Robertson for more boutiques, a 10 minute ride to Rodeo Drive. I was travelling alone so I wanted to make sure I stayed some place where I felt comfortable and this was it. Despite it being a hot spot, it was quiet in my room. The room was clean, the bed was heavenly, and I never wanted to get out of the shower. It was cool seeing the Hollywood sign in the hills behind my room too. I'd definitely recommend this hotel and plan on returning for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best place I have ever stayed, best time I have ever had”
Reviews.Author: Badnorwegian
Reviews.Content: And I am an event organizer and have stayed in nice hotels all over the World. The staff was fantastic even though they had to deal with a lot of celebrity customers needing extra attention this weekend due to a big crowd attending the American black film festival in the hotel. The Stone Rose was great, it was hopping even on Sunday night. The bartenders and wait staff there were genuinely nice to me, good luck to you Kim. My room, 809, had a great view of the hills, and the most fantastic shower, only short of the shower at Skyloft in Las Vegas (you'll just have to take my word for it, Skyloft starts at $950 a night though). Room service was fast and fantastic. If you want the best sushi you'll ever eat, walk up to Yabu about 200 yards north on La Cienega, on the left side of the road. Sit at the sushi bar, toss the menu and let the chef feed you. Be prepared to pay $75 per person if you go all out but it's worth every penny. Ah, I already miss this place, I will be back, it was better than home.

Reviews.Title: “The ultimate place to stay”
Reviews.Author: KC305
Reviews.Content: The recently remodeled Sofitel LA is absolutely gorgeous. We last stayed there several years ago, and although then it was outstanding, it has now totally transformed into a sleek, sexy and hot place to stay. Many high end hotels come across as impersonal - not the Sofitel. Every person we met, valet, front desk, concierge, housekeeping and restaurant staff were very friendly and made us feel welcome. Our room was a suite on the penthouse (10th floor) level. The living room featured a flat screen TV, Bose sound system and a spacious balcony overlooking the Beverly Center and a view of the downtown skyline. The bedroom featured floor to ceiling windows with electric shades, a very comfortable bed, chaise and another flat screen TV. The bathroom was enormous with separate roman tub, glass enclosed rainfall shower, closet and well lit vanity area. When returning to our room after dinner, the maid had prepared the bed, and left water, cookies, chocolates and a personal welcome note from the manager. These are the unexpected touches that we will remember for a long time. The next morning we ate a delicious breakfast in the hotel restaurant where we sat outside on the terrace under sunny blue skies. We were sad to leave as we felt so welcomed and were treated like royalty. The location is perfect, an easy drive from LAX in under 30 minutes (take La Cienega all the way from LAX to the hotel). For us, there is no other hotel or hotel chain that comes close to the perfect blend of comfort, service, quality and perfection as Sofitel, and if visiting LA, we hope you will enjoy it as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Super Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: WriterWillTravel
Reviews.Content: Frette towels & linens. Roger & Gallet toiletries. Hollywood Regency, Dorothy Draper style decor. Heaven! My only complaint is the Stone Lounge - the drinks are VERY expensive ($18...) and not very good. I still can't believe they put a margarita in a SMALL wine glass. Also, the Stone Lounge is very loud so don't try to have a business meeting there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: gad52
Reviews.Content: Everything about the Sofitel is amazing. There's really nothing to complain about. The location, the rooms, the hotel staff, the drinks, the restaurant were all good. The pool was pretty small but I didn't use it. The only issue that i have is the price of the hotel. For 3 nights at the Sofitel one could easily fly to Europe and stay there for 3 days at the same price. The Valet parking was also pricey but all of this is expected. Each member of the staff expected a tip at the end of the day which I wasn't too crazy about but they do a good job. The taxi from the airport took about 20-30 minutes due to traffic. Hollywood Blvd and Rodeo drive are not really in walking distance to the hotel but if you like really long walks it's possible (i did it)

Reviews.Title: “comfy bed!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: turtleholidaycat
Reviews.Content: we had stayed at the Sofitel before its renovations a few years ago and decided to give it another go to see if it had changed. The staff were still very efficient but had become more friendly which was nice. The rooms seemed a little smaller but the bathroom a bit bigger. The rooms were much nicer as before they were a bit cluttered. The shower was enormous with two different shower heads for choice. The bed, i am pleased to say was the same as before. You must believe me it's a bed to die for!!!! Sooooo comfy its unbelievable!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: wash2tex1
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel and it's staff was over the top. The front desk staff was helpful and courteous. Our small suite was beautifully done, flat panel in the living area and bedroom and a small television in the bath. A great Bose sound system and although we'd brought our own CDs there were two Sofitel CDs that were very good. Internet service is free and they provide a cord in the desk drawer to connect. The bed was so comfortable we almost didn't want to leave it! Extra thick down/feather pad and four pillows of assorted firmnesses topped off with a wonderful down comforter. Perfect. The shower was another treat, a rainhead ( I think that's what they are named ) and a window that you could see through to the bedroom but also with the flip of a switch became opaque for privacy. Big jetted bathtub as well. If you go be sure to have a drink at the bar downstairs Stone Rose ~ later in the evening it is very busy and lots of fun. The outdoor patio has wonderful couches that give the feeling of privacy. There is also a nice fire pit to sit around. We had a wonderful meal the hotel's restaurant Simon LA, on the patio, but wish we would have paid more attention when ordering the seafood appetizer which was priced pp. making it kind of expensive. But there was plenty of lobster, shrimp, mussels, clams and oysters ~ delicious as were our various entrees, especially the seared tuna. The fitness area is well done with free weights, cardio and weight equipment. The hotel provides headphones, water bottles, fruit and cool damp towels scented w/mint. We also went to the spa, I had the Ideal facial ( with Vanessa) which was nearly the best facial I've ever had. My friend had a massage and said it was great. They start the spa experience off with tea and a foot soak, very relaxing. You can access the steam bath and shower as a guest of the hotel even if you don't have a spa treatment. The showers in the women's locker area had 20 jets! I would stay here again in a minute and recommend it to everybody. We were told the hotel went through an extensive renovation a year or so ago. It's a great place to stay while in LA.

Reviews.Title: “good choice!!!”
Reviews.Author: JonatanLoter
Reviews.Content: I recommend this hotel.... Location can't be better, great architecture and interior design, the bathroom is INCREDIBLE and the room is ok. The only thing that I didn;t like is that I spent $310 for one night and I had to pay to have an Internet connection!!! The service is GREAT!!! The employees are really kind and also the valet guys!

Reviews.Title: “The BEST hotel to stay at in Los Angeles is the Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: dshodiss
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in Los Angeles at the Sofitel and I have to say it is the best hotel I have stayed in anywhere. The hotel is beautiful and the staff is very very friendly, all smiles and very willing to help and make sure your stay is a great one. The pool is very nice and clean and they even had a BBQ going on so we did not need to go looking for a place to eat. The rooms are very nice and clean and have great views of Hollywood. Every detail in this hotel is perfect all down to the nice carpeting and art in rooms. The gym is the best of any hotel I have been in and it's clean and they supply water , towels and fruit for after as well. I will always stay in this hotel when I come back to Los Angeles since the Sofitel Los Angeles beats any other hotel by a long shot.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel, Will Be Back”
Reviews.Author: MsMarg0
Reviews.Content: Room: I upgraded to a SoElite room, which is 425 sq. ft., with a King bed. The room is laid out like a rectangle with a large and a small triangle both cut diagonally at the top corners. The large triangle is the bathroom, which was very large for a hotel bath, with a fully glass-enclosed rainfall shower, vanity and toilet. The small triangle is the step-in closet. There are two sets of French doors leading out onto a tiny balcony (about as deep as a shoe), but itâ€™s still a nice touch. The bed was one of those â€œalmostâ€� Kings; my 6â€™ husbandâ€™s feet reached all the way to the end. But the bed was very soft and comfy with plenty of pillows. It you like a very firm bed, it will likely be too soft for you. There was good lighting on either side of the bed for readers. Also in the room were two small dressers (one doubled as a nightstand), a chaise, and a desk on wheels. It was a little cramped to fit that much furniture in, but not overly so. The room is advertised as having a plasma TV, but it was actually a LCD. Still a very nice TV. The alarm clock does have an adaptor for your mp3 player, but it wasnâ€™t very obvious. The bathroom had good lighting (which took a few minutes to figure out with multiple position rocker/dimmers). There is a phone next to the toilet, for those who need to be connected at all times. The TV sound can also be played into the bathroom, if you want to hear the TV as you get ready. The water pressure was good also â€“ too much for my hubby, who would have preferred a bit less in the shower. The sink has a small towel rack next to it, and a shaving/makeup mirror that can be used at the sink, or from in the shower (through the glass wall). The huge shower is stone/tile with a small built-in bench, a shelf for toiletries, and a photoelectric window that looks out over the bed into the room. Flip the switch and itâ€™s opaque, flip it again and itâ€™s clear. We had much fun, flipping the switch back and forth, and it was nice to shower with a view of the Hollywood Hills. Amenities: The closet had 2 Frette robes, 2 pairs of slippers, padded lingerie hangers, a well made shoe horn, and safe that can fit a laptop. I thought the slippers were a nice touch, even if I was a little put off about the idea of wearing â€œusedâ€� slippers. The closet also had a terrific sewing kit (the Queen of all amenities!) In the bath was a small canister of cotton puffs and Q-tips. There were plenty of fluffy towels, and the usual array of soap, shampoo, and body lotion, all Roget and Gallet brand. There is a hairdryer in a small cubby in the vanity, which was nice as it didnâ€™t take up excess counter space. Also in the bathroom was a loofah mitt in a sealed package. I thought it was a little silly until I wore an adhesive bra out for the evening and had to scrub off the excess adhesive the next morning! There is high speed internet, but you have to pay $10 a day for it. That seems a little steep when most low-end motels are now offering free wifi. My computer savvy husband was able to find an unsecured network easily, so if you have some computer skill, you wonâ€™t need to pay. The mini-bar was well stocked, although crazy expensive, as most mini-bars are. Donâ€™t try to get anything youâ€™ve left behind at the hotel gift shop. They sell everything in the room, from the soap, to the robes, to the lamps, to the sheets, to the mattress, but not a toothbrush or bottle of aspirin. There is, however, a 24-hour drugstore/chemist's right around the corner for your every need. Staff: The staff were all very polite and helpful, but we still had a few small snags. Although I specifically asked for a Hollywood Hills view when I made my reservation, at first we were given a room that would have faced the Beverly Center. (Be sure to get a Hollywood Hills view, itâ€™s much nicer.) We also asked at check-in for 4:00PM check-out on our last day, but when we got the new room the request didnâ€™t seem to go with it, so on our last morning we had a chambermaid trying to get into our room while we were still in bed. A call to the front desk straightened it out quickly, but it was a bit of a hassle. The first night we stayed, I wanted to watch a pay movie, but their system was down. I called the front desk and someone was supposed to call back when it was fixed, but Iâ€™m glad they never did, as we went to sleep at midnight. We were skipped for turndown service one night â€“ not a major issue as I know how to take the decorator pillow and throw off the bed. The valet stand always seemed like no one knew what was going on, but the car was always waiting for us as soon as we called down. Itâ€™s not made very clear that parking is $26/day, but given the location you really have no other choice. All-in-all, very small snags, and I certainly will be staying at the Sofitel again.

Reviews.Title: “the outstanding sofitel!!”
Reviews.Author: tre_12
Reviews.Content: I have just got back to england from 3 wonderful nights at the sofitel LA. On arrival we were greeted by the friendly porters and valet service men. the staff at the desk were also very friendly. the rooms were that of a superb specification with HD TV's and a very stylish bathroom/shower. i most enjoyed the complimentry spa, steamroom, sauna facilities, which i visited every morning. the hotel is in a prime location with great access to the beverly centre (which includes all the top designer shops). it also has a stunning bar and restaurant. overall, i found my stay at the sofitel a truly unforgettable experience. i will definitely stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: sedgwick3895
Reviews.Content: If you are under 24, have never stayed in a hotel before, and are dazzled by pitch-black, hipper-than-thou faux-trendy dÃ©cor, this is the place for you. Otherwise, this is the amateur hour. Sofitel took a beautiful French-style comfortable and reasonable hotel and turned it into an exorbitantly overpriced, hideous post-modern house for their nightclub and spa, with all the charm of the Cultural Revolution. They've seen to every inconvenience common to the arrogance of aggressive post-modern designers. There is no lightswitch inside the door of the room; stagger around in the dark until you find one. An electric outlet (and the lamp plugged therein) didn't work; the alarm clock didn't work; none of the room's key cards worked, so I had to go all the way downstairs to get a new one from the front desk every time I went to the room. The lighting in the bathroom is harsh, extreme, poorly aimed and hard to locate and operate. My traveling partner's room was an unacceptably small, strange triangular wedge (for the same exorbitant rate as my more normal rectangular room). Her room featured a glass window over the bed, looking into the bathroom. Since when are the activities of a bathroom considered acceptable to display through a window into the bedroom? The beds are covered with huge duvet/quilts and no top sheet. One lays on what feels like a thick, floppy, supportless goosefeather pallet of some kind over a bedboard. Actually, there's a mattress under the pallet -- I ripped the pallet out of the undersheets and threw it (complete with human stains) on the floor, and extracted the quilt from the duvet cover to approximate the universal standard of a mattress with normal bedclothes. There is no sundries shop. Nothing happens if you try to get hotel services, like check-out, on the TV -- they've set the clock back twenty years by requiring a front-desk check-out. The pitch-black lobby with its hideous metal constructions is matched only by the already thread-bare carpeting in the elevators, and the aggressive and unattractive orange curley-ques of the corridor carpeting; room numbers are offset on diagonals so they can't be read until one has passed the door and inset room number. Nothing dates faster than today's hip trend, even if it had been done artistically and with finesse; the cash-happy twenty-somethings who seem to be the exclusive clientele here seem happy with the cutting edge of yesterday.

Reviews.Title: “the Sofitel was amazing”
Reviews.Author: TravelerDallasTX
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sofitel for business for 5 nights. The recent renovation has catapulted the hotel into a different category. The entire hotel is beautiful as well as comfortable. The beds are extremely soft with white down comforters and pillows. The bathroom design and amenities are top notch. The rain head shower and brand name toiletries were great. They even have a speaker in the bathroom so that you may listen to the news while you get ready in the morning. Also located across the street from the Beverly Center Mall and down the road from Cedars Sinai. The restaurant/lounge in the lobby serves great food. Typical hotel prices but well worth it. The cotton candy dessert is to die for (ask the waiter for the assorted tray of desserts). In the evening the lounge becomes a "VIP" type of place so expect the velvet rope to come up after 9 or so.

Reviews.Title: “overrated”
Reviews.Author: kaltpost
Reviews.Content: Hallo Travelers, if you book on specal rate its ok , but its not very clean, check the internet cafe next to the reception, you will stick to the keyboard. We found a open bottle of wine behind the flatscreen TV ??? Best are the cool guys at the valet parking, they are so cool that they forget who is the client.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed blessing”
Reviews.Author: a72645
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights, first in a room facing Beverly Blvd. and did not sleep until 2 am when the downstairs nightclub closed. The large french windows have very poor noise insulation. The second and third night were better, we got a room facing the Hollywood Hills and could even see the Hollywood Sign from our bed, but still the constant slamming of doors after 8am made a restful night with sleeping in on the weekend close to impossible. The staff was very professional, courteous and understanding, the restaurant for breakfast, brunch and dinner excellent and the valet very fast and reliable. In summary, get an even numbered room, facing the hills, but still do not expect the restful atmosphere one otherwise would expect at this level of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ho hum”
Reviews.Author: mark121
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during the final push of its refurbishment - so things were pretty topsy turvey. The staff were incredibly helpful. And nothing was too much trouble. They didn't even mention that we smelt (we'd just spent a week in the Nicaraguan jungle)! However, some of our hugely expensive cleaning came back with jungle baked-in rather than having been cleaned. We were given a room upgrade to a Junior Suite. It looked beautiful and the bed was sumptuous. However, the whole thing was rather spoilt by road noise - there was no double glazing and we looked out over the main road. I found the location a bit of a bind. But I guess that's because I'm British and like to walk or take buses everywhere. It's a long, hot walk to Hollywood. And the buses don't seem to stop very near the hotel (but maybe I was just using the wrong buses). The food in the restaurant was good, without being first class.

Reviews.Title: “Please...not again!!!”
Reviews.Author: roberta_nyc
Reviews.Content: I have to stay at this hotel when I am in LA due to corporate policy. How I wish this wasnâ€™t the case. I donâ€™t hate staying at the Sofitel, but I certainly donâ€™t love it. That said, the hotel rooms themselves are perfect! The bed is unbelievably comfortable & so soft. They actually sell them because theyâ€™re that good! Iâ€™ve contemplated buying one & probably will if I move. The walk-in closets are perfect & great for women who don't exactly travel light! The bathrooms are also nice with spacious showers w/benches. Toiletries have a rather masculine smell, which I can't use. This may sound silly, but they also have great alarm clocks that are soo loud - I've never overslept here despite the super comfy beds. Management & staff here are beyond awful. Not everyone, but they are unfortunately overshadowed by a bunch of wannabe actors who canâ€™t do their jobs. Once I had to use a personal credit card to check into the hotel room & I hadnâ€™t alerted the CC company that I was traveling. So, it didnâ€™t go straight through, instead it asked them to call in to verify the charge. Well, the check-in guy made a loud fuss that my card was declined & I insisted that it wasnâ€™t possible, but he didnâ€™t care. After arguing with him to try again, I received a phone call from my CCâ€™s fraud dept. asking me about the charge because the hotel didnâ€™t call into verify it. So finally, I got into my hotel room an hour later with no apologies from the wannabe actor. Then upon checkout after he learned of my company he was ridiculously fake nice & superficial. Since that checkout, when all of my info was entered into their system he has consistently been fake nice. Every time I arrive I hope that he has been fired, but nopeâ€¦always there. Unless you like being located near an express way (or highwayâ€¦not sure, large, fast road), the location is horrible & the views are non-existent. It is also located across the street from a monstrosity known as the Beverly Center. The Beverly Center can be handy (tons of mass dept. & chain stores), but the shops arenâ€™t great & the exterior is hideous. Cute hotel gift shop that stocks wonderful things like Marvis toothpaste alongside novelties like Mile High kits! Lastly, this is LA. Every hotel has a fun pool scene, strong restaurant & fun bar â€“ EXCEPT the Sofitel. If you like to mix business & pleasure, plan on having to head out to other hotels (or nightlife destinations).

Reviews.Title: “I heart Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: eclecticone
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel leaves not one detail spared. We stayed in a King Superior room for $220/night. After shopping many, many LA/BH hotels, I found this to be very reasonable.
