After you stay one night at Sofitel you won't regret one penny spent. The room is decorated with whites and browns for a very modern and clean appearance. The shower was unbelievable with a fog window so you can watch TV (42" HD LCD with surround sound in bathroom) while showering if you wish. The hotel supplies each bathroom with fine soaps and shampoo (which I enjoy as I travel a ton). The customer service was excellent. We never felt out of place at this swanky hotel. There is someone to help you with everything (luggage, valet, housekeeping), so come prepared with plenty of $1 bills. The parking is $26/night which is comparable to other LA hotels but is an added expense that must be considered. The pool and fitness center were excellent. Luckily, the pool wasn't crowded so it was quiet and relaxing. The pool chairs are super comfortable. The fitness is state of the art with some of the best equipment available. They also offered free bottles of water and cool scented towels. We will stay at Sofitel in the future whenever possible.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok, nicely located near everything”
Reviews.Author: MaryBabcock
Reviews.Content: Hotel was ok. There was no great shower like everyone mentions, so it must not be in every room. Room was average size. Beds were comfortable. View was of the side of the mall with a huge billboard of Evan Almighty. Conceirge was fabulous and helpful but the best part of the hotel was our bellhop, he was such a doll and soooo very helpful. Guy at front desk was a bit stuffy. Never got to use the pool as it closes at 10pm. I learned nobody likes to walk in LA, as I chose to walk to The Farmers Market & The Grove and people thought that was nuts, it wasn't that bad. We took a cab back and that was only $10. Walking distance to The Ivy were we had lunch. Walking is also close to Spago were we had dinner. Parking was $26, which for LA is not too bad, but it was no fun having to call every time we needed the car and of course each time you called for the car you have to tip the valet. The Mall across the street is great! We felt very safe at all times here at the Sofitel. Overall, I think the hotel is overpriced, but the rooms were nice, nothing to write home about though.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is great but management should be replaced”
Reviews.Author: Poshexpert
Reviews.Content: Fourth stay at this hotel after it was refurbished. Booked through Sofitel's priority service and the hotel was clueless to this fact. The rooms are very comfortable but I booked a premium single and the clerk tried to book me in a minimum room on a lower floor facing the Berverly Center. Everytime I'd arrive at the hotel they would ask have you stayed here before at the front desk? The valets would recognize me since I drive into LA but not the desk clerks. The management is the weakest link in this hotel and all the other staff are great. Service at the front desk needs work. Why don't they have Europeans manning the front desk instead of people who should be selling coffee at Starbucks? Returning to another hotel I've used before. On check-out, waited twenty minutes for a belman.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good experience”
Reviews.Author: MsFran
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect for shopping and restaurants. The lobby is beautiful....we checked in and once in our room realized it was cold. We turned on the heater and waited for 3 hours, the room never got warm.....apparently the windows were not sealed. They moved us to another room, this room extremely hot....and the air conditioner did not work. They move us a third time, this room was small but it appeared to have working heat and air. It was 1:30 am before we could finally settle down and rest. The hotel management did not apologize or even offer an explanation...in fact the person at the front desk was rude. We checked out the first thing the next morning and went to the Hyatt which was wonderful. I would never stay at this hotel again. I understand things happen, an apology would have been nice.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel, I will go back!Â¬”
Reviews.Author: bembridge
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel. Having seen the pictures of the outside online, I had expected the hotel to be somewhat ordinary, functional and fairly sterile. It turned out to be none of these. The hotel recently went through an 8O million dollar renovation which has turned it into a trendy, funky but stylish place - although the outside (other than the grand glass entrance) still looks plain and uninspiring. When you walk into the lobby you are warmly greeted and although it is a little gloomy you soon realise it has an interesting and unique style. There is, for example, a massive swirling steel sculpture in the centre and touches like a chair made of coins. The staff on reception are all chatty, tell you about the hotel and see you to the elevators. The hallways are bright and have a striking swirl designed carpet. The bedrooms are slightly quirky shape wise but this adds to the interest. The bathroom has no bathtub, only showers. The bathrooms are a good size and the basin is very modern, and the shower is fantastic. It has a large shower head above you so is kind of a "wet room" type of shower. As the bathroom has no window, there is a very clever solution as there is a large window in the shower that with a flick of a light switch makes it clear (so you can see into the bedroom and watch the TV while showering, the sound already plays in the bathroom which is something I always like). The bedrooms are not huge but have an enormous and very comfortable bed with amazingly soft pillows and high quality bed linen. There is a good sized desk to work at and internet access is about Ten Dollars. Another nice touch is the large flat screen High Definition TV. On the lobby level is an enormous bar which is trendy and attracts a hip crowd most evenings but is very busy on the weekend. The restaurant the other side is also great looking and the food pretty good. One stunning feature is the large fitness centre. This has loads of great equipment, is stylish and has nice touches like free bottles of water, fruit, internet access stations and even chocolate brownies as a treat for working out. The meeting facilities are good and team very helpful. I would love to stay here again. Not only for the hotel but a brilliant location with Beverly Mall opposite and seemingly zillions of very good places to eat around (every night we had some celebrity at a table next to us). I have poseted a video of my room (415) on tripadvisor or you can cut and paste this link to see the video: [--]

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in LA, Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: MichaelTraveller
Reviews.Content: I have now stayed in this hotel 3 times in the last few years and wanted to add my voice to praise Sofitel. I have stayed on the Penthouse Level, Run of House and a room with a balcony on a high floor. You get a great view of the LA skyline and local area. The rooms are really nice and the atmosphere perfect. You get a feeling of high quality but not too stuffy, plenty of good customer service, great concierge and fantastic waiter service. All the fixtures and fittings are extremely high quality and it has just been through a refurbishment programme which has made the rooms even better. The bathrooms are great with lots of little extras you wouldn't even have thought of! Nice large plasma screen TV in the rooms with a good choice of channels, well stocked mini-bar with top notch snacks and drinks. All the fabrics and furnishings are high quality and the beds are very comfortable (I like soft beds). There is a taxi rank next to the hotel and there is always at least a couple of cars waiting for you. 'Westfield' or Century City (name changed) is a great shopping area and also the Grove is only a few minutes by taxi with lots more shops. The best part for me was to find the Beverly Shopping Centre is on the opposite side of the road with lots more shops and even a Cinema to catch the latest movies. Whenever I go back to LA I will be staying here. I understand the point made by another reviewer about the slightly sniffy French service at reception but I am from the UK and we are used to dealing with the French so not a problem. I would recommend you stay here, it is expensive but worth the extra dollars.

Reviews.Title: “Professional service with one problem”
Reviews.Author: Sarah_in_New_York
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Sofitel LA for 17 nights. Overall the service was excellent - professional, fast and gracious. However, there was one issue and the way it was handled was surprisingly unprofessional. First, the good: the rooms are comfortable - bathroom/shower is excellent and huge. beds are pretty good - they're new, which counts for a lot, but a little on the soft side due to a featherbed. turndown service at night with bottles of evian. someone always at the front door to welcome you and open the door. Once, there was no one at the door and one of the valets saw me coming and RAN to open it for me. We had breakfast at Simon 5 or 6 times and it was excellent each time. They serve excellent french press coffee (i'm a terrible coffee snob). One morning I asked for a new cup as I had let my coffee turn lukewarm. Instead, I got an entire fresh new pot of french press. Once they forgot the avocado in my omelet and rushed out an entire plate of avocado. They also let us sit forever on the sunny mornings. We also had dinner and drinks at Simon/Stone Rose - the scene is a little too much but the food was excellent. Best thing to order is off the menu: it's the Iron Chef Burger. Tiny, perfect burger; fries with truffle oil, and a little milkshake. don't miss it. The fitness center was clean and open from 5am (helpful when you're on a shoot). They also provided bottles of evian, chilled towels, and brownies or muffins; internet access and computers; and headphones. a pretty complete place to hang out. the spa has very nice treatments - I did a facial and a massage - though it is very pricey. I'm from new york and this compares to the priciest spas here. however, you can't top having a massage in a relaxing setting just a couple minutes from your hotel bed. The sauna is not open yet, unfortunately, but the locker room is nice. what else? the location can't be beat. we walked to dinner many nights - not sure that's even possible in other parts of LA. also walked to shopping on the weekend. there were a couple very minor service issues along the way: the maid opened our door and came in one morning at 8:30am while we were still in bed (she apologized and quickly left) and the shampoo and conditioner were not replaced for days and I had to call housekeeping to get new ones sent up (but they came quickly). not big deals. Ok, now the bad. After we had been there 10 days with two cars parked, the front desk called up to confirm our credit card because of all the charges piling up. what charges? we asked. Oh, the $26 per day per car charge. That's $884 extra for parking the rental cars for our 17 days. I went to the front desk to speak with the manager. I don't have a problem with paying whatever needs to be paid, but I thought it was wrong we weren't told. There's no mention on the valet ticket they hand you, there's no mention in the literature in the room, there's no mention in the packet they give you at check-in, and there's no option to park in a separate lot. Instead of apologizing for not informing us of the charge and making some small gesture of good will (for example, a $25 credit to the restaurant or spa or something that wouldn't cost them much - or, god forbid, an apology) they just said "This is LA and parking is at a premium." Yes, I said, I understand, I'm from New York. I don't have a problem with paying for parking, I have a problem with the hotel sneaking charges onto my credit card. It's something a less professional place would do and doesn't fit with the rest of our experience here. Anyway, it continued this way for a while, with the manager refusing to acknolwedge that we should have been told and getting increasingly more huffy. Did i mention we were there for 17 nights? In the end I paid the $884 and consoled myself with taking a few extra brownies and bottles of evian from the fitness center. It's still a very nice place and, though it pains me to say it, I would probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel Los Angeles c'est si bon...”
Reviews.Author: David_Edward
Reviews.Content: I have had the pleasure of staying at three US-based Sofitels in the past few years. Bloomington, Minnesota, Chicago, Illinois and the one I am going to write this review about which is located in Los Angeles, California. My stay at the Sofitel in Bloomington was back in the mid-90's on a rather unremarkable business trip. The one thing that stands out in my memory is how odd I thought it was for the front desk staff (who were obviously dyed-in-the-wool Midwesterners) to be speaking with an affected French accent. The Sofitel Water Tower in Chicago is a spectacularly beautiful building that comes to a knife's edge point. And they actually made good use of this unusual architecture. I know because the suite I had there was *IN* that narrow portion of the building and it was gorgeous and eminently functional. I moved from Northern California to Orange County at the end of 2006 and have stayed at the Sofitel Los Angeles more than half a dozen times since then. The reason being that I often spend my weekends in LA proper and the drive back to Newport Beach sucks after a night of partying. But I digress. From my first stay there, I have been tremendously impressed with this property. From the well laid out carriage-way, to the polite valets, bellmen and front desk staff to the lightning quick elevators. This hotel recently underwent a $40M renovation and it really shows. The lobby is very understated and elegant. Black marble and subdued lighting. That same sort of low-key elegance is evident in the rooms as well. I have been lucky enough to stay in both of their uber-suites at either end of the top floor. Both boast gorgeous marble bathrooms with HUGE tubs and separate shower, outdoor patios with fireplaces and seating areas and voluminous sitting areas in addition to the spacious bedrooms. Both also have wide-screen high-def televisions in both the living area and bedroom and have gorgeous views of Sunset Blvd and the Hollywood hills. Those rooms are prohibitively expensive (even for someone like me who spends money like a drunken sailor) but even their standard room is a pleasure and a joy to behold. The room service is excellent, especially the hamburger and ham and cheese sandwich. Steer clear of the chicken soup which was surprisingly tasteless. I wasn't too impressed with Stone Rose despite the Rande Gerber connection. I am pretty spoiled when it comes to nightclubs and the one time I popped into Stone Rose it was WAY too crowded to be enjoyable. Simon:LA served an excellent breakfast the one time I managed to make it downstairs to eat in their dining room. I will have to try them for lunch or dinner sometime since a birthday dinner at Kerry Simon's other location in Las Vegas back in 2005 was outstanding. All in all, if you can afford it, the Sofitel LA is an exceptionally nice hotel. It is centrally located to Beverly Hills and just a short drive to the endless club and dining opportunities in Hollywood. No fake French accents here. This place is a class act from start to finish.

Reviews.Title: “Like the room”
Reviews.Author: MooOun
Reviews.Content: I like the location of the hotel. .a short drive to Rodeo Drive (I think about 3 miles), and to Sunset Blvd. It's also right across from the mall. The room was also very nice, big, and with new furnitures,. What we like most was the marble bathroom with adjustable shower pressure We didn't eat at hotel during our stay, so can't say. The gym was pretty large and fully equipped, but the equipments were a little old

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location !”
Reviews.Author: guyinsocali
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a weekend with my boyfriend during December 2006 and forgot to write a review for Trip Advisor so it's a bit late. I just wanted to tell everyone that this is a great hotel. I felt welcomed at check-in, the hotel itself is very classy and trendy. The rooms are clean, stylish and roomy. There is a great bar and restaurant at the hotel and the location is perfect (near West Hollywood, Beverly Hills, across from the Beverly Center mall) I did not find anything wrong with this hotel at all. The room price is a little high but well worth it! I will say those who like hip, trendy hotels will like it as much as we did. I will be staying again for another weekend in March so I will give another review.

Reviews.Title: “So Good.”
Reviews.Author: J_and_A_1
Reviews.Content: This recently renovated hotel works well in many ways. The rooms are very nice with new modern furniture, flat screen TV, great bed, and good lighting. We booked a SoElite room that had two French doors overlooking the Hollywood hills. The room was not square. It was laid out at an angle which was a nice change of pace, but may have made the room feel a little smaller. The bathroom was nice size, with a large rain shower that had a glass window that can be â€œsee throughâ€� into the bedroom or â€œprivateâ€� with the flick of a switch, but no tub. The gym at the hotel was really great. You can get a full circuit workout. It also has a little lounge area in the middle with water in a fridge, apples, a sweet treat of the day, and several newspapers available. The gymâ€™s dÃ©cor is dark with an almost club feel that may put off a few people. The Spa should be open by the time this review is posted. The location of this hotel is excellent. If you want to leave the car behind for awhile, the shops and restaurants of the Beverly Center are just across the street. Downtown Beverly Hills, The Grove, Sunset Strip, Robertson and Santa Monica Boulevards are all just a five minute drive away. If a hot trendy bar scene is for you, The Stone Rose Lounge at the hotel should keep you busy at night. We did not use the attractive adjoining restaurant. Our only complaint would be that the pool, closed during our stay is hard to get to and may not be worth the effort. It is very small and the area around it is nothing special. Not sure if it was closed for renovations.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Sofitel (Dec 21-23/06)”
Reviews.Author: tulugaq
Reviews.Content: My wife and I got snowed out of Denver on December 20, so we made some rather last minute plans for L.A. instead. We checked Trip Advisor for hotel reviews, then Expedia for availability of hotels in Hollywood/West Hollywood/Beverly Hills. We ended up booking the Sofitel through the hotel's website, which advertised a special of $228 US/night. It was the perfect choice! From the moment that we walked in, staff were attentive to all of our needs and questions. The lobby is rather dark when you walk in, but don't be fooled by first appearances. Our room on the 4th floor (with a view of the hills) was very well appointed and the feather bed on top of our king bed provided a great sleep. The room comes with shower only, no bath. The mini-bar is movement sensitive, so beware of moving anything even if just to check it out. High speed internet is available for $9.95 a day through T-Mobile. We ordered breakfast and lunch through room service on two different days. Breakfast took a mere 10 minutes from the time we placed our order! Lunch was more like a half hour but my wife did order a steak. We had dinner at the hotel restaurant "Simon" one night. I'm not really one for fancy "nouvelle cuisine", but the meal that we had at the restaurant was excellent. We checked out the Stone Rose Lounge on our last night and were surprised to find a good mix of people and great service. The hotel is in a great location, right across from shopping at the Beverly Center, and restaurants on Lacienega. I stayed at the Elan Hotel Modern just down the street on my last visit to L.A. back in 2005 and it pales in comparison to the Sofitel. If you can afford the extra $ and want a hotel in the general West Hollywood/Bevely Hills area, then treat yourself and stay at the Sofitel.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: CatPacker
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night at the Sofitel on business. This was a great experience overall - good sized, clean room, nice bathroom, quiet, etc. The lobby is a bit disorienting on arrival, but there's a good restaurant downstairs. Service can be hard to attract, but the food was good when it arrived. (Apparently the lounge/bar attracts a fabulous crowd on the weekends, but I was there on a Monday so my colleagues and I had plenty of room to lounge and relax.) The view from my room included the Hollywood sign - fun! - as well as a number of nudie bars - but some people might consider that a bonus. My colleague had a balcony as well - I think you have to ask for an upper floor for that. I'm always a little skeeved by hotel bathrooms, but this one seemed scrupulously clean. It has one of those "rain forest" showers, which was a nice touch, although if you're really tall or don't want to wash your hair I'm not sure how you'd manage. Lovely thick robes (2) and slippers were provided. Turndown service with a free bottle of Evian, another nice touch. Best of all, I couldn't hear the comings-and-goings of my neighbors, which is great when you're trying to get a good night sleep before a meeting. I will probably stay at the Sofitel again when I return to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: garda19
Reviews.Content: I travel quite often and this is one of the most beautiful hotels that I have stayed in. I stayed here for 2 nights returning from Tahiti to New Jersey. From the time I pulled my rental car up to the front door until the time I feft for my flight back to New Jersey two days later the staff at this hotel were wonderful and could not do enough for you. The staff at this hotel are professionals and go out of their way to please you. When I asked for directions to a restaurant the hotel staff printed out a map to the restaurant, informed me of the restaurant's specialities, and not only got us a cab but told the cab driver what route to take to the restaurant to avoid traffic. Our room was large and beautiful. It looked like it had been recently renovated. Everything appeared new from the large flat screen television to the bedding. There is nothing in this hotel that I could complain about. We were treated like royalty. If you have read the previous reviews they spoke of construction noise. We hearn absolutely no construction noise during our stay and we did not see any construction going on in the hotel. We had turndown service every night and in addition to the wet bar containing water housekeeping left two complementary bottles of water on the nightstand every evening. While getting dressed one evening I realized that I had left my black shoes in the trunk of the rental car. I called down to ask that the car be brought up so that I could get the shoes and the staff member offered to get the shoes and bring them to my room. Approximately 3 minutes later the man was at the door with my shoes. I call that service. Yes the hotel is a little pricey at $330 a night but then again you are in LA. and this is a top of the line hotel. The locations is right across the street from the Beverly Center with Bloomingdales, Macy's and all the best stores. The top restaurants are all a 5 minute cab drive away. I give this hotel a triple AAA rating not only for the property but also the the professionalism of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “One night in LA”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravelhk
Reviews.Content: I had missed a connecting flight coming in from overseas and decided to stay at the Sofitel as I didn't want to stay at the airport hotels. Front door/lobby a bit too trendy - with about 4-5 men standing at the door all dressed in black. The lobby is basically black too - a bit intimidating and doesn't make you feel relaxed and welcome. The guy at the front desk was really friendly and check in was efficient. First impression was the room was small. Could just fit between the hallway to get to the bed. Distance of bed from TV was about 1 metre. Lots of wasted space with the covered balcony/window but the view to Hollywood Hills was impressive. Missing bottled water in the room, so had to drink tap water. Not even sure if you could do that in LA. Did not get turn down service so was very surprised getting back to room at 10pm. The bed was comfortable with duvet cover and mattress top. Bathroom had a nice huge rose shower head about 10" but the light in the shower didn't work so it was pretty dark in the bathroom. No bath - just a shower, so if you need a bath, I suppose you have to tell them. My bathroom did not have the glass separating it from the bedroom. Ordered room service breakfast - brought on a huge tray with little nice touches and newspaper. Generally a good stay but for $300+ you would expect to. I had stayed at the L'ermitage a few years ago and the Sofitel rooms are newer and much better designed, but smaller. The room itself was a bit dark at night even after turning on all the lights. The hotel is very busy because of the Stone Rose lounge but once you get upstairs it can be quiet, except some guests would come back at close to midnight and you could hear them talking then the doors slamming shut. Wifi connection was $9.99/24 period. Regret not trying the food from Simon|LA but hope to be back again soon as it's probably the newest hotel in LA right now. No problems with service at all and staff wasn't snobbish or arrogant.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Service + Unbelievable Comfort at the Sofitel Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from 5 days and 4 nights at the Hotel Sofitel in Los Angeles. The hotel has recently been given a 70 million dollar remodel. Every aspect of the hotel was awesome. I have travelled all over the world and this is one of the finest hotels I have ever stayed at. From the time I drove up to the time I left I was greeted with an extremely professional and friendly staff. Everybody from the valet to the housekeepers went out of their way to my our stay as comfortable as possible. I read on the reviews on Trip Advisor about the recent construction and I did not hear a single sound from any workers my entire stay. They have finished all major construction of the hotel. We checked into our deluxe room which faced the West Hollywood Hills and the Hollywood Sign to the east. Some of the features of the room was a deliciously comfortable bed with feather duvet and pillows, brand new LG Digital Flat Screen High Definition TV with the latest movies to order. Very contemporary, NEW and comfortable furniture and a very sweet bathroom. The shower had a window which overlooked the bedroom, tv and windows out to the mountains and with the flick of a switch the window magically frosted over for complete privacy. There was a mini bar with great snacks and beverages. The hotel was more than happy to accommodate us with a fridge to store our own snacks, beer, etc. for the week. There were a lot more great touches to the room that made us enjoy just hanging out. We ordered room service several times which arrived hot, quickly and with a smile. The food was from their new restaurant in the hotel Simon/LA. When something was delivered to your room like room service or an extra pillow the staff did not bang on the door, they gently tapped. Small touches like this make a huge difference. The new bar at the hotel was very chic. It was designed by Randy Gerber and is sure to be the new hang in LA. Very cool furniture, hip music, beautiful people and great drinks. Expensive drinks but it's to be expected at a trendy hot spot in LA. The outside of the bar has big comfy couches, a cool fire pit and fountains. We ate at the restaurant Simon/LA for breakfast and dinner and again the staff was very accommodating in our requests. I would highly suggest a meal there. I saw travellers eating there alone who seem to feel very comfortable. If you are looking to stay at a great hotel in the West Hollywood, Beverly Hills area I would highly suggest the Sofitel. It feels new, it feels hip and cool but not ostentatious. It's a very comfortable place and oh did I mention the bed.

Reviews.Title: “Administrative flaws”
Reviews.Author: dreamonixx
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here with a friend, having cancelled my own reservation and opting for a shared room. It's been done up and looks great inside yadda yadda no issues there. The reservation I had required 24 hours notice or you would be charged a night. So a week in advance I emailed them, cancelled and they acknowledged back via email. Then I get a $230 something charge to my Visa. Write to them and tell them to immediately reverse the charge which happens three days later. The dollar has dropped and the conversion makes the amount they credited $11.30 less. So I am now out of pocket $11.30 for THEIR mistake. Not a lot of money but no one seems to now want to know about it. Be weary when dealing with this property and ensure you keep all correspondence. They will try it on!

Reviews.Title: “Comfort in a building site”
Reviews.Author: Caoimhin
Reviews.Content: When booking this hotel I didn't know that most facilities would be unavailable due to renovation work, or that loud incessant drilling would begin every day at 7am exactely. Nevertheless, the room was very comfortable, and service was good. Breakfast was tasty and reasonably priced. I would stay again, only when renovation is complete however!

Reviews.Title: “princess and the pea”
Reviews.Author: draycot2
Reviews.Content: sleep like royalty in what must be the most comfortable beds in the world. Beautifully decorated rooms, lovely restaurant and bar area. In a good location a short walk to Rodea dr and all attractions. Very competant staff

Reviews.Title: “Best Service in So Cal”
Reviews.Author: johngaltgirl
Reviews.Content: As the mom of two young children under 3, I never take the time to review the places we stay. However, I had to make an exception this time! The Sofitel was a wonderful surprise and our standards are fairly high. We stayed at the Beverly Hilton a few weeks ago and it was nice... good food, good service, nice suite. But nothing extraordinary. We picked the Sofitel because of its close proximity to Cedar Sinai Medical Center - our destination this week (it is also right across the street from the Beverly Center, Hard Rock Cafe, and loads of other fantastic shopping locales) We did not expect much as the Sofitel is undergoing extensive remodeling (reflected in their prices I believe). The Sofitel surprised us with excellent service, immediate check-in (under 5 minutes, everything was ready, including the crib in the room with baby products inside! This is key for traveling families with nap times!), gorgeous design in the newly remodeled suites, impossibly quick room service, friendly European (usually an oxymoron in my experience!) :) hospitality all around, from the valet to the turn down service. We stayed in one of their newly remodeled suites - the design is modern, but not cold and linear. Huge framed mirrors, the most comfortable bed ever, an amazing bathroom with rain shower & soaking tub. (NOTE: as another reviewer indicated, there is a window between the shower & the bedroom - but there is also a switch that automatically frosts the glass for privacy!) And flat screen HDTV's everywhere - even the tub had a TV built into the wall. Our suite had a beautiful view of the Hollywood Hills - worth requesting. And main rooms in the suite had two sets of french doors - shallow balconies. But they are nice to look at & bring alot of light into the rooms. (Room darkening curtains are available to make your room nap-ready for the babies as in every good hotel!) Also of note: the staff seemed to be trained very well. Quick, courteous, professional. They don't even wait around for their tips - I had to chase down the room service guy to give him his tip! Best service I've ever had in California and one of the nicest hotels I've stayed at in recent memory. The overall feel of the place reminded me of THEhotel at Mandalay Bay in Las Vegas - but with much better service. The Sofitel looked like an ordinary hotel from the outside, inside (in spite of the remodeling) it reminded me of some very upscale boutique hotels that cater mostly to couples or business travelers, but it turned out they Sofitel caters to whoever their guests happen to be - in our case a very young & demanding family! We requested extra blankets, pillows, duvets, wake up calls - you name it. And I give the Sofitel an A++ on every point tested! It's so refreshing to be pleasantly surprised with a hotel. My husband is never impressed (he travels the world in the best hotels), and even he agreed it was a first class experience. Oh, also, I found the best rates & the quickest service by calling them directly... and I usually book through expedia or the like. Prob. worth a call anyway. :)

Reviews.Title: “good choice!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 days in January. Overall the hotel was a really good choice, ideally situated accross the Beverly Shopping Center. Although it was being renovated, the rooms and the service were excellent. However, we thought that the rooms should get a renovation too. For example the bathtub looked kinda dirty because it was overused. Generally, the bathroom was in a desperate need for a renovation. Moreover, there was indeed some noise in the morning (the hotel warns you about that before you book) but most of the time we were away so it didn't bother us. I think that you can hardly find something better in the area for that price.

Reviews.Title: “Renovation is not pleasant!”
Reviews.Author: TaminatorSF
Reviews.Content: When I arrived, the hotel people told me that they could not find my Cheaptickets reservation. They claimed Cheaptickets did not fax up the paperwork and that even if it did, it did not keep a log of what was successfully faxed. After 30 minutes of searching and checking, they then realized that they did receive the paperwork but forgot to put it into their system. Their attitude changed dramatically, realizing that it was their fault. Apart from the mix-up, Sofitel is currently under renovation. The hotel was more like a construction site. Looking through the hotel window I can see the cranes and the windows were dirty... On the plus side, amenities were plenty, and it was especially great since they were from Roger & Gallet. The cleaning people also showed up about 4 times a day. And location is great, right across from the shopping mall. I would say spending $200 a night is not worth it. I'd wait until their renovation is done (April) before returning.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome Back Sofitel!”
Reviews.Author: alekona
Reviews.Content: I have now stayed 3 times at the Hotel Sofitel. Once in 1996, 2000 and 2005. Each time I have really enjoyed staying there. From the easy access to the Beverly Centre (across the road literally), to the amazing beds. Starting off with location - I did not hire a car in Los Angeles and didn't need to! The Beverly Centre across the road provided many hours of shopping. In 1996 and 2000, I even walked up to Sunset to Tower Records from the Hotel. As I was traveling by myself in 2005, I felt very safe staying at the Sofitel. The hotel room doors had double locks and there were always people around in the foyer late at night. All 3 times, I have stayed on the Bev Centre side of the hotel and have had no problems with the traffic noise. My room has always been massive with plenty of space to store luggage and clothes. The room is furnished adequately with a storage cupboard to hang up clothes/ items and a large chest of drawers for other clothes. The bathroom was very clean and had plenty of light. Room Service was also very good and punctual. (I had room service every time I have stayed there) and the vanilla crÃ¨me brule for dessert was AMAZING! I had a slight problem with check-in the last time I stayed there, but nothing that wasn't able to be sorted out. Note - if you book online through sofitel.com or other sites, be sure to bring a printed copy of your booking information (they tried to charge me hotel tax twice!). Thankfully, I had a printed copy of the reservation with me to show that I had paid the total rate online. A downside of the hotel is that it's a bit expensive to stay here and the rooms are looking their age slightly. Overall, if you want a nice hotel for location and that is safe, I highly recommend the Sofitel.

Reviews.Title: “OK for being renovated”
Reviews.Author: Digest
Reviews.Content: Pros: Good location, good gym, staff very good, some of the rooms are brand new, room service is excellent, decent price for renovation, nice shower. Cons: 6th floor facing the Beverly center is extremely noisy, book the back side of the hotel. The bathroom door broke off of the track and no one repaired it. The bed is too low to the ground and does not have a box spring and slides off of the frame. The sun comes through the room darkener shade. Room, including the bathroom needs additional lighting, very low light levels. As with all Sofitels, no coffee in the room. Beware of cabs across from the hotel, LA is notorious for having cab drivers who claim not to speak much english and will rip you off, some are not licensed cab drivers,our cab driver did not know where Sunset Blvd was located? Hotel lobby looks as though it will be about 6 months before the hotel is complete. Weird wash cloths. Maid service did not make the room up the last day.

Reviews.Title: “Hits & Misses”
Reviews.Author: AndrewMichael
Reviews.Content: Pros: 1) One of the most cushiony, fluffiest, most comfortable beds EVER, here at the Sofitel. 2) HUGE mega sized free toiletries: body gel wash, shampoo, conditioner, 2 soaps 3) Very well lit bathroom 4) Balcony overlooking the mall & Beverly Blvd. 5) Very nice rooftop pool 6) Super quiet room (304) despite facing heavily trafficked Beverly Blvd. 7) Subtle floral aroma coming through the A/C vents make for a refreshing room. Cons: 1) They are currently doing MASSIVE construction to the hotel, so the maze called 'entrance to the 2nd floor check-in' is quite the walk. 2) NO WIRELESS INTERNET CONNECTION. [How 1996 of them]. I couldn't get the dial-up [what's dial-up?!?] connection to work at all, so I just gave up. I tried the TV internet instead for $10.95, but that was a bust, as oversized web pages did not fit in the TV. 3) They put me on a smoking floor, but at least my room had a nice balcony. You can see my pics posted.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel and its staff”
Reviews.Author: ItsLinz
Reviews.Content: I have just returned home from a fantastic holiday in USA.San Francisco then Los Angeles finally Las Vegas.We stayed in the Sofitel it was wonderful.Although renovations are in place it is still a great place to stay.The staff were friendly polite and could not do enough for us.They do not know the meaning of the word NO. Beautiful bathroom with plenty towels and accessories which are continually replenished turn down service if required and chocolates what more do you want? The bed was the best bed I have ever slept in.As for expensive for breakfast I totally disagree.Breakfast is served at a lovely table on beautiful plates with lovely cutlery orange juice flows and coffee never ends.OK nearby you can go to a deli which we tried its ok.But for a couple bucks more you are served a bit special. Worth it I can assure you. Shopping is easy with the Beverly Centre across the road with every shop you need. I will be back in LA sometime for a holiday and I can tell you The Sofitel will be my first choice of where to stay they sold it to me on my recent visit. Ohhhhhhhhh how I wish we got that service over here. Linz

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite hotels”
Reviews.Author: stb1
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot and stay in many different hotels. I just returned from Los Angeles the day before yesterday and spent two nights at the Sofitel. (My 10th time there). In reading some of the reviews preceding this, I am amazed at some of the comments. It is certainly enough to make me sure that I would hate to run a hotel! Some people are so hard to please. My room was a standard King room facing the hills. Great view. The room was very clean (what's with all these people finding dirt?) A good size desk (could have brighter lighting for it), comfortable armchair and table, good size closet with iron and ironing board, nice new in-room safe, and a very cosy bed (which a number of people have remarked about). By the way for those who did not like the duvets, there is a blanket in the room and the maids are there to exchange them for the duvets. The bathroom was large, clean and the best-lit bathroom in the business. Nice fluffy towels and plenty of them, white terry-cloth bath robe and soaps and shampoo by Roger & Gallet. Turn down service in the evening with a bottle of water on the bedside table. What's to complain about???? (They used to put a fresh red rose in a bud vase in the bathroom in the evening but no more apparently) The hotel is undergoing major rehab. The reception, bar and restaurant are on second floor and someone had the very bad idea of decorating in black and white in a space with very limited outside light coming in. I saw pictures of the new decor. It is very contemporary (not like the current French provincial look). The lobby and bar area look pretty wild. Not sure how us regulars will like it. The bedrooms will be very pretty if the pictures are accurate. Finally, the staff is exceptional. Very pleasant and no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Going, Going, Gone an Insider view”
Reviews.Author: crazyhorsellc
Reviews.Content: On a quick return visit we decided to visit our old stomping grounds the Ma Maison Sofitel. Both my wife and I worked at Sofitel at opening plus 8 years. We intended to eat in Gigi. We of course were awe struck to see its ongoing rennovation. We hope 70 M can buy a better hotel. It is undergoing renovations/ heavy renovations. We arrived at 8pm on Saturday evening. It is difficult to find the entrance, there is no directional signage to the relocated recepetion or "lobby". Someone took the unusal tack of painting black lacquer paint all over what used to be French County. We found it odd. More delightful was the fact that the hotel appeared to be a ghost town, we went though the old Ma Maison(now a construction office), and reviewed a full set of construction plans. We also toured all of the offices which were wide open. The new rooms and suites will be interesting. They are being completly gutted. Larger bathrooms with seperate showers in most. I don't know about the picture window from the shower to the sleeping portion of the room?? What remains of the guest floor not under constuction was dirty, with a very bizarre mix of styles and colors. We stopped by the restaurant but decided on Hard Rock, Ma Maison is really no more

Reviews.Title: “Under remodeling but staff outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Recently my husband and I were at the Los Angeles Sofitel for three nights, including a weekend. The hotel is extremely well-located across from the Beverly Center (a large interior shopping mall) and within easy walking of many very good restaurants. It's also two blocks from Cedars Sinai Hospital, if one needs a hotel near to that hospital. The lobby and front entry are undergoing extensive renovation (to be completed early 2006) but signs direct one to a temporary side entrance with three or four staff members present to direct & assist one to the temporary lobby and elevators. Every single staff member was friendly and quick to offer assistance. The rooms are in excellent condition, very clean and look freshly decorated, and many have a nice view of the nearby hills. The rooms are quiet, bathrooms of an adequate size and the bed comfortable. This is our third happy stay at the Sofitel and we plan to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Impressed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We visited LA as our first stop off on the way to Fiji & Australia. In response to earlier comments there is building work going on and this could put you off. To be fair it didn't bother us at all given that we were only there for 2 nights and the only inconvenience was only a little noise on our last day. The staff were all very friendly from the reception to the bar staff and waiters. The room itself was fine, the only disappointment was that as it was on the smoking floor and therefore was a little, well... smoky! The beds were fantastic and after 10 hours from the UK were a dream to sleep in. Another comment is that the breakfasts whilst expensive were very tasty indeed and apart from the Beverly centre itself are the only place within the near vicinity to eat. I am sure that once the renovation is done the hotel will look wonderful again. If you are only stopping in LA for a few days we were certainly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great service!”
Reviews.Author: Pilates_Gal
Reviews.Content: Several times a year, I have to stay the night in L.A. After spending too many nights at the West Hollywood Ramada Inn because of their: A. Paper thin walls (You can hear conversations in the room next door and feel the footsteps and hear people in the room above you-loudly!) B. When out of non-smoking rooms, the smoking rooms stink to high heaven (why don't they use Lysol?) C. They charge like 22 or 24 bucks for parking. (That's called "ransom" in my opinion) I decided it was time for a change. (In defense, the Ramada Inn has a GREAT location) Last week I had to come to L.A. and stay the night, so I booked the Sofitel via Hotels. I enjoyed my stay so much that when I got called back to L.A. this week, I stayed there again even though I could have driven back home. Even though there is renovation going on, it never interfered with my stay. The rooms are very well insulated and quiet. The beds are a dream. I also like how they don't have traditional bed spreads, but rather comforters that are encased in a luxurious sheet that is removed and cleaned with each guest. It seems much more sanitary. Customer service is key at this hotel. ALL the staff members are quick with a smile and greeting. I like being so close to the Beverly center too. I loved staying here and after raving about it, I came to find out that a few of my friends have stayed here too and feel the same about the place and especially the beds! I thought their pool was great. It's clean and very warm. Maybe it's not great if you're a lap swimmer because it's not super large. The gym is huge. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: catdr
Reviews.Content: a friend and i stayed at the sofitel aug 5-7. we arrived at 11:30 pm to find that the hotel was undergoing MAJOR renovatations (not infomed of this). we were told that because of the renovations the water would be cut off from midnight to 5 am and that if we wanted to take a shower we would have to go to the 2nd floor (our rooms were on the 6th and 7th floors). this hotel is ranked as a 4-star hotel in a major city--and there is no running water! i asked for the business center--closed for renovations. i asked where i could find internet access, like at a kinko's--i was told that the closest internet access was about 4 miles away (WRONG--there is a kinkos in the next block). all service requests were met with "not avaible due to renovations" or were factually inaccurate. when i spoke to the manager on duty on saturday aug. 6, she said she would comp the rooms and we would receive a refund through expedia--didn't happen. my stay was memorable but not pleasant. if i wished to experience a third world, third class hotel experience i would not chose to stay in a 4-star hotel in LA

Reviews.Title: “June tour visits 'the Sofitel'”
Reviews.Author: Steve_and_Lorna
Reviews.Content: We stopped here on 8th June 05 for 3 nights. The Hotel is very clean, close to Shopping (next to Beverly Hills Centre) and in a good area for local touring around LA. Our room was a standard room of a generous size that looked out towards the Hollywood hills. Parking was $18 a day. Staff were courteous. The pool outside was little used, in need of a coat of paint, but nonetheless clean. The one thing we will not forget about the Sofitel was those beds...incredibly comfortable! We thought previous trip advisor reviews were exaggerating, but they really are incredibly luxurious. Excellent stay here, would definitely stop again, would definitely recommend it. To put our review into context, this was part of our June tour of California and New York that included the following hotels, also reviewed on tripadvisor. Sofitel - Los Angeles, Best Western O'cairns - Lompoc, Travel Lodge Monterey Bay, Serrano - San Francisco, Wuksachi Lodge - Sequoia Nat park, Yosemite View Lodge - Yosemite Nat park, Furnace Creek Ranch - Deach Valley, Aladdin - Las Vegas, UN Millennium Plaza - New York

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but needs some work”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If youâ€™ve ever stayed at the Sofitel in Philly or Chicago then you know this is a nice hotel chainâ€¦however, LA is lagging behind. The hotel is getting really dated. The drapes and the flooring appear very warn and dusty. The biggest shock was getting to my room and realizing there was no high-speed internet. The staff was very accommodating and moved me to a deluxe room that had high-speed; however, it was a smoking room and I am NOT a smoker. Unfortunately, only the deluxe rooms carry high-speed, which in this day and age is unacceptable. Again, I do want to stress the staff is very nice and accommodating, but their kindness does not over shadow the run-down condition of the hotel. I was told the hotel is going thru a renovation so there is hope it will improve someday. Overall, an okay hotel, but I will not return again until the renovations are completeâ€¦ not worth the $$$ right now.

Reviews.Title: “Dusty Stuffy Rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a gorgeous hotel, nicely decorated. But there was so much dust and dirt in each room on the air vent, lights and walls, I am amazed this hotel can be listed as "clean." I stay in LA every month and I won't stay here again. A shame, as the rest of the hotel is immaculate.....

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Pegstar
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sofitel for 7 nights and had no problems with the place (apart from once small incident with a false fire alarm waking us up!) but that aside the hotel itself was great. I agree with other reviews the bed was the most comfortable ever! The hotel accomodated us with a early check in which was great, plenty of toiletries and little extras in the excellent sized bathroom. Right across the road is the Beverly Centre with lots of shops and a cinema and a few restaraunts at the base as well as a food court on the top level. The turn down service in the evening provided free bottled water and sleeping masks also. Don't hesitate to stay at The Sofitel! I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, treated very well!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a night for a rondevous with a friend. I booked it on priceline, so I didn't know what hotel I was getting. The service was excellent. For what I paid for the hotel, we got a room that was lavishly furnished and had a nice view of Los Angeles from the balcony. The hotel is smack in the middle of Beverly Hills for all of you star watchers and right across the street from the Beverly Center, a ritzy L.A. mall.

Reviews.Title: “they allow pets at no charge”
Reviews.Author: melissablack
Reviews.Content: they allow small pets at no charge -

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Now Under Renovation”
Reviews.Author: Eclipse827
Reviews.Content: Beware, this hotel is now under renovation and short-staffed accordingly. There were no problems with the room but I did experience numerous service lapses--this while paying the premium rate of $200/night on weekends and $250 weeknights. On the evening I decided to eat at the bar, others had the same idea and there were far too many of us for the two servers on duty. When I went to check-out, my calls to the front desk to request my bill be prepared went unanswered and upon arrival in person, there was a 15+ minute wait. Three phone calls since to request the bill be mailed have heeded no response now over a month later.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel yes please”
Reviews.Author: oersue
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights in this hotel in March, the room was spotless, bathroom well equiped, loads of towels and toileties also robes for my husband and myself provided. The beds were turned down at nightime, a note left with information of the next days weather. The beds at Sofitel are so comfortable made in a special way by Sofitel Hotels. I needed a doctor during my stay and the staff were very helpful, because of my illness we had room service which was prompt and well presented and enjoyable. The lobby is very pretty and the staff were very helpfull. If I return to Los Angeles I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel.
